Reviews.Title: “I love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: gagirl47
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay here (for two weeks) and I really enjoy this resort. the rooms are clean, colors bright, comfortably arranged and the large tub/spa in the master bedroom is awesome. The kitchen is well stocked and there is no sign of wear that I have seen during either stay. The grounds are beautifully maintained, the pool is wonderful and the staff exceptionally accommodating. The activities are great and designed for all ages. The Polynesian show on Thursday nights is really a highlight. I also own timeshare at the Boardwalk Villas at walt Disney world and I must say this resort is just as nice, if not better due to the extensive activities and grounds and the ability to park outside your condo. You cannot go wrong with this resort and I look forward to many future visits. I write this as I sit on our lanai at the resort, cool breeze coming through the screens, cocktail in hand, after another relaxing day in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway”
Reviews.Author: ktdipaula
Reviews.Content: The facilities were very nice. Rooms were spacious & clean. The staff was very courteous. Only negative was the pillows, but I feel like every hotel I stay in lately has those wretched pillows that don't offer any support.

Reviews.Title: “April 2012 Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Phil S
Reviews.Content: Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Property is beautifully maintained and unit was immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Great time by all”
Reviews.Author: conmarjohn
Reviews.Content: From the minute we drove in the yard everyone was very professional and gracious. Zach checked us in and was very thorough explaining all ammenities including a new day spa. Room was recently updated and exactly what we requested. First floor end unit in the 6500 block. A follow up call welcoming us to the resort was appreciated. Lots of activities for all ages including bicycles (actually they had 4 wheels) for up to 4 people to ride. Had a grat time as a family touring the resort. Gas grills were available along with swan boats and fishing. Will choose this Marriott resort over others when planning our next trip South.

Reviews.Title: “worst Marriott ever!”
Reviews.Author: janessajoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 12-21 because the reviews were good, bad mistake. We called 1 week prior to reserve desired villa and upper floor, however when we arrived, they got the villa right but on the ground floor. We changed villas to #55 again a mistake, the room had the smell of mould, no matter what we did, spray freebreeze, leave the door open the smell prevailed. The front desk wanted to move us.... are you kidding with 2 kids in tow and the grandparents, just not happening! We were speaking to some of the workers and they claim they have been battling mold for about 2 years. The dishwasher was not working, maintenance up and upplugged it said sometimes this happens... ok next day dishwasher not working again ugh I give up! I think there must have been a short in the unit. On our second to last day large cockroach crawling in our bedroom, needless to say we left immediately at 5am. When notified desk staff and was mortified, the young girl stated this happens all the time even in peoples homes and they spray. Great not some place I want to stay and definately not up to Marriott standards in terms of service or villas. The staff have no regard where they park taking up front row spots in the shade in front of your villa so you have to park further, how rude! The villas all face each other around various small ponds therefore when you are on your balcony you look right at the person on either side of you, not very private, you also see all the people on either side below you too. The grounds are not what I would expect from a Marriott resort, Grande Vista much more well kept and staff are great! The room design and set up was the only thing I really liked, it was spacious with separate bedroom and 2 baths with giant size round jacuzzi tub in bedroom. Yes there is full size washer and dryer but I think it was tripping the switch and making the dishwasher not work. If you can handle mould smell, and large cockroaches and your neighbors looking at you when your on your balcony this resort is for you, however I won't be back I will be staying at the Grande Vista!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mochamom04
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Cypress Harbour property is beautiful. We had the opportunity to stay there for 5 days and loved the accommodations. There is a beautiful full kitchen and a screened in porch. Our unit accommodated 8 people and was extremely spacious. The only complaint was that the units are so spread out around the property and where we were located was so far from all of the pools and recreational activities. The property is located about 10-15 minutes from the Disney parks and less than 5 minutes from Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bf67
Reviews.Content: Lovely property. Lovely room/suite. Lovely views. A good selection of activities. Good location if you have a vehicle with you. Challenging if you have an interest in using public transportation, which we do when we travel. The staff support was OK to GOOD however on a few different occassions we were given poor directions/instructions/guidance - which we ALL know and understand happens pretty much anywhere. We enjoyed our 4 nights here. We would gladly return and hope too.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Grayella
Reviews.Content: We love the Marriotts and stay quite frequently at them but I would have to say that the 7000 building we were in was in desperate need of renovations. The place definitely was outdated and smelled a little musty. The water was extremely rank. The unit wasn't cleaned very well, as you could see the dust lying on the chairs, etc. The master bedroom was quite dark. it wasn't terrible by any means but definitely isn't the Marriots we are used too. I would definitely pick the Marriott Grande Vista before ever staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Cypress Harbour--"Days Inn Quality"”
Reviews.Author: Dale F
Reviews.Content: We were in building 7000. We definitely did not have a "refurbished" villa. Outdated, poor kitchen supplies, clock in bedroom did not work, shower curtain in guest bathroom was coated with mildew, cigar smoke smell in master bedroom, dishwasher shelves broken, stove drawer off rollers, garbage disposal backed up on 3rd day there, mold on coffee pot. Our "lake view" was of a pathetic water hole that had a diminished amount of water in it; not nice to look at! A very disappointing experience for a Marriott time-share holder---the quality was of a Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Spring break 2012”
Reviews.Author: Hippo1021
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending Spring break with my kids at this resort; stay was from 4/08/12-4/14/12. We had six in our party so we reserved a 2 bedroom unit and loved our location. We stayed in room 6532 and had no problem with noise being so close to the pool. Grounds are fabulous with great activities for the kids. Being a Starwood timeshare owner, I was very impressed with the facility. Big laundry room, full kitchen, comfortable beds. Since we were using points for our stay, we had daily maid service and loved the fact that the beds were made and received new towels daily. On our last day we were able to negotiate a 1pm checkout (it's usually 10am) so the kids were able to advantage and go swimming before we left town. Close to all the attractions in the area. This was our first visit to Orlando so if I use my own timeshare the next trip, I hope the resort I book will be just as good!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property”
Reviews.Author: Franklin H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort multiple times and just love it!!!! Much better value than when we've stayed at the Disney properties. Location is ideal--close to Magic Kingdom, Universal Studios, and Sea World. Property is very big with lots of amenities that include: restaurants, pools, arcades, miniature golf, basketball, water activities, etc. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa which was big! Master bedroom has a king size bed, in-suite bathroom with a large jacuzzi tub. Second bedroom has a queen size bed, and a couch with a pull-out bed. Kitchen is and dinning area are adequate in size and can actually be used for cooking. Screen-in balcony is awesome and having a washer and dryer is pretty good too. Lots of parking available and most of the entertainment within the property is close by. Many restaurants and shops close by and it's right by International Drive. The staff is friendly and the room are great. Would definitely recommend and will obviously come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great timeshare resort that gets you away from hectic pace of Orlando”
Reviews.Author: arozylo1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several timeshares in Orlando, both Marriott and non-Marriott. This one is by far the best for me. Why? As usual for Marriott, all the units are clean, well-kept, well-equipped, roomy and modern. The complex is on a quiet street, away from the traffic and bustle of many of the resorts in Orlando. The three pools are large and all have different characters. Restaurants and shopping are nearby (less than 10 minutes away). Disney resorts are 15 minutes, Universal is 15 minutes, and Sea World is 5 minutes away. As an aside, I had a few minor maintenance issues, and after I called the front desk, the maintenance person was there within 10 minutes. The front desk then called me an hour later to make sure the issue had been resolved. That's service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Judytraveler13
Reviews.Content: We love Marriott properties and would add this resort to our favorite list! They have 3 pools that offer different things at each one of them. The fitness center and spa were both very clean and had great equipment! There is a beautiful lake surrounding the property and they offer a boat to get to the main area along with boat rentals for family use. Galley Grill had good food for our stay at the resort lunch. A few updates could be made to the units in the kitchen area, but the rest of the unit was clean and comfortable! We would come back here!

Reviews.Title: “consistently good”
Reviews.Author: hydrangea80
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time staying at Cypress Harbour. This time was better than the last because they gave us a recently refurbished room. All the appliances looked new. The kids played at the playground, played mini golf and arcade a few times when we didn't go to the parks. We also did the boats, which was really fun.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in a lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: keut
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd Marriott Vacation Club we've stayed in. We were in Orlando for a week, and it was great to have the full kitchen and two BR for me, hubby, and college son. The screened balcony was so nice, to look out at the lovely grounds. The casual Galley Grille was a good choice for those nights you just want to stay at the resort and not cook-- the quesadilla and the shrimp appetizers particularly good. The pool bar also fun, and the entertainment, esp. on Hawaiian nights, a blast! Son esp. liked the "beach" at the island pool. Just a really super place to stay when in Orlando with all the amenities one expects of a Marriott Vacation Club.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent Marriott timeshare”
Reviews.Author: pandavet
Reviews.Content: This is the 10th Marriott Vacation Club we have stayed in, and the experience is still excellent. This resort is coming up to 20 years old, but the refurb programme is a continous process as you would expect. The facilities are super, with lots of pools, a great gym, large lake with boats to hire and an excellent (though very busy in season) golf course. My tip is to ask for a refurbished villa (we had 6544) to ensure you get the latest kit - flat screen TVs etc. Would definitely stay here again &would recommend as it is very close to Seaworld and has easy access to I4 although it is not audible in the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Property”
Reviews.Author: JRFord
Reviews.Content: With a Marriott property you kow what to expect and this Marriott Ownership Resort is a great spot and very family friendly and well maintained! In the summer you can watch a fast moving thunderstorm and then see the fire flies all from you covered and sceened patio room. Full Kitchen available in the master units which have additional room for the children. Spacious master suite bedroom and bath with the livingroom and kitchen and laundry.

Reviews.Title: “a great resort with plenty to do and close to all parks”
Reviews.Author: decko-h
Reviews.Content: we took a 2 bed apartment for a week and it was a great base in Orlando. the apartment itself was immaculate and we had a great lake view. you get everything in the apartment to make life easy, and after being to Orlando 9 times i would call this the best place i have stayed. also the facilities of the resort are very good, and they have various activities on every day, if your into that!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: weekendrunaway
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort at least 7 or 8 times over the last 12 years. It's beautiful and well maintained. It has two large pools and A few kiddie pools as well. There are a few hot tubs around the pool area as well. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. The rooms are always clean. The units are spacious. ( ours is a large two bedroom, two bath, with kitchen, living room and laundry room). The master has a very large hot tub and shower. The second bedroom has a queen bed and a pull out. The living room also has a pull out. The unit sleeps 8 people. I think there are some smaller units as well. Each unit has a large screened balcony. It has a table and 4 chairs for dining or playing games or just relaxing in the morning with your coffee. It's a peaceful escape that I look forward to going to as much as possible. You do not feel like you are in Orlando, when you are here. It's not crazy busy like a Disney hotel. It's family orientated, but in a more laid back area. I have never visited during the summer or spring break, so I never had a problem getting a chair by the pool or a parking spot, but I'm sure those are concerns at peak time. This is a timeshare property, but available to rent as a hotel. It's one of the older " vacation club" properties, but perfectly maintained, and always spectacular, in my opinion. It is conveniently located between Disney and Universal. It is very close to Seaworld and the Outlets. You need a car if you stay here, there is nothing within walking distance . I do wish this property had a real restaurant. It does have a pool bar and a snack shop that sells food and supplies. The pool area has a pizza hut/ food window that sells chicken fingers, pasta, salads & sandwiches. Nothing fancy, and nothing wonderful. I usually stock the refrigerator with breakfast and lunch supplies and go somewhere else for dinner. Some units overlook the golf course or pond. They are quiet and serene and quite breathtaking. The units overlooking the pool are very noisy. There are units far away from the pool ( by the kisa club area) that have another smaller pool, that are just perfect for families with little ones. Very easy to walk back and forth all day. There are also free paddle boat rentals. This a a perfect spot for the family who wants to do Orlando on their own terms and wants flexibility and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “This Marriott resort feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: Sherri A
Reviews.Content: Marriott Vacation Club resorts always make us feel so comfortable. We deviated a few days of our recent trip to a different brand of resorts and were so disappointed. Marriott has it figured out or it just fits our taste/expectations and beyond. This resort has it all - pools, lake with paddleboats, other watersports, a challenging 9 hole mini golf course, a Nick Faldo real golf course, surrey bicycles-fun!, perfect small meal/snack choices for any meal poolside. The suites are wonderful, clean, so roomy! Marriott has the beds figured out-so comfortable always! This resort is more mature with beautiful grass and trees and flowers. All feels like a true getaway vacation experience. Not to mention - the added amenity of being in close proximity to so many world class attractions and eateries and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but Marriott needs to work on this property a little more”
Reviews.Author: smackron
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Vacation Club owners in Ko Olina Hawaii so it is hard not to compare that to every other vacation club property. Let me start by saying there are several pluses with Cypress Harbour. One of them being that all the staff members we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. We were treated graciously at every turn. The grounds are lovely and well maintained. You don't need to fight to get a chair by the pool. It is busy but not overly crowded. We had a problem with our washer one evening, by late the next morning, we had a new washer in our unit. My daughter had a problem with her manicure at the spa, they promptly arranged for her to have it redone...with a smile. So in terms of service..top notch from the front desk to the spa. We stayed in a renovated Villa and herein lies the problem. Our villa was very clean, yet still smelled of mildew on occasion although we couldn't pinpoint the cause or the source. We had a king size bed, but the pillows were standard....even with 2 pillows, they felt too small for the bed. When they renovated the villa, instead of replacing the nicked, somewhat broken baseboards....they chose to heavily paint over them. They updated the bathroom but kept some of the cheaper fixtures .I realize I am being picky, but the high quality standards I expect from Marriott were not there and will be noticeable too, to people who have stayed at other, nicer MVC's, There are fun activities to do around the resort but my kids are young adults, so most weren't for them. The resort is very big, so if you have small children you may want to request being close to the pool or activity center or you may have to walk quite a ways or drive depending on which pool you want to go to. You can also request to be near the golf course or other areas that are more quiet if you wish it to be less on the hectic side of things. The spa is lovely and there is also has a nice work out facility. We did not use the golf course, but it looks well maintained and was always busy. Lastly, there is a least one alligator in the lake that likes to hang out near or on the golf course across from the nature deck trail. Probably not dangerous, but I would watch my kids by the waters edge none the less in case he likes to travel to other parts of the lake, and I wouldn't dangle my hand in the water if you rent the paddle boats! A very nice place, but not a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely surroundings, great location”
Reviews.Author: TheJagManWatford
Reviews.Content: The rooms are advertised with high speed Internet access, i.e., an RJ45 cable connection, it doesn't. The hot water takes ages (a good minute), to come through which goes against Marriott's attempt to be green. The villa (7034), is as expected from a Marriott, very clean, comfortable and high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort But Not Marriott's Best”
Reviews.Author: cjbesq
Reviews.Content: My family of six (6) stayed here in July, 2011. We are MCVI owners at Harbour Lake and Lakeshore Reserve, and wanted to experience one of Marriott's other Orlando properties. As with all MCVI properties, the resort is beautiful and the rooms are very well appointed. One thing we didn't like is that the second bedroom on our two bedroom unit did not have two beds. Instead, it has one bed and a pullout sofa. The room was extremely tight when the bed was pulled out. The kids activities were not on par with those we have become accustomed to at Harbour Lake, and there seemed to be less for the kids to do. Overall, this is a very nice resort for a family vacation, but it not Marriott's best in Orlando. Harbour Lake is clearly better for families with young children and Lakeshore Reserve is clearly better for families with older children. We will stick to those two going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: simp246
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my partner. The apartment was clean, comfy, very well equipped and everything we could have wanted. Great areas for relaxing by the pool/lake. Very central to everything (recommend hiring a car though) and the staff were all lovely. Go and stay, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: junerob8
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to this resort. The surroundings provide a peaceful oasis yet are well situated for shopping, restaurants, international drive and the I4. It is only 10 minutes by car to Disney and Universal whilst Sea World is around the corner. the resort is friendly and very well maintained with excellent facilities. The new gym and spa are a great addition.The condos are spacious and ideal for friends and families who like the option to self cater. I would highly recommend the resort and will return next time we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Consistenly great place to stay for family trips to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDolphin
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time staying at Cypress Harbour over the last 8 years. The resort continues to deliver consistent quality with large 2 bedroom condos, great pool areas, and a good kid's activity center. Access to Disney parks is quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Musker1
Reviews.Content: Great place. Close to the parks. Huge rooms with great service. Great for kids too.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: Canadiangirl2008
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 2nd stay ( 1yr later) and a week longer this year. Just wanted to note that it was still a great value. We were given a newly renovated room last year, however they are still in the process of renovating the rooms and the villa we got this year hadn't been done yet, but I still thought it was in very good shape. I will continue to recommend this vacation spot. Great staff, great rooms and super convenient location!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful spot”
Reviews.Author: merilees
Reviews.Content: The Cyrpress Harbour is a part of the Marriott Vacation Club network. We exchanged part of our villa in Ko-Olina, Hawaii for a week. The villa was very spacious and had a balcony overlooking a lake. The villa is not new but very clean and everything functioned well. We shared the 2 bedroom villa with another couple and were never in each other's way. The pool area was outstanding with a large pool and several spas of varying temperatures. There was also a kiddie pool that the really young children enjoyed. Water temperature was excellent and there was a buuble area that was stimulating. The Club had a small marketplace for emergency stuff and a small restaurant for pizza and other quick type meals and not outrageous prices in either. Conceirge service for theme parks was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DevonfamilyBL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks in January as an exchange through Interval International. Had a two bedroom villa with a view of the golf course. The villa is spacious and caters for up to 6 people - crockery,cutlery etc.Our unit was well maintained and we got a complimentary clean through at the end of the first week. The unit had all the equipment you need for a vacation, including a huge fridge freezer,microwave, washer and dryer. The photographs of the unit don't really do it justice - it really is lovely! The resort is fabulous - 3 pools, all heated, spa, gym, bikes for hire, boats to rent, golf course, pitch and putt and plenty more activities available - too many to list. There is a full entertainment programme provided by the resort and you can get involved as much or as little as you want to. All of the staff are polite and helpful. Great resort for couples or families. You do need to have transport as although the main attractions are close - this is America and everywhere is a drive away. Ideal location for visiting outlet shops too. Only 10 miles from Orlando International airport - 10 min drive. Would highly recommend this resort - hopefully will be back again next year

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wheelzofsteel
Reviews.Content: I have been a Marriott Vacation Club member for many years. I'm a Platinum Rewards Member for there hotels too! There Cypress Harbour resort is truely amazing! It is beautiful and well maintained. The villas are all 2 bedrooms. Full kitchen and 2 baths. The activities department is award winning. Great for everyone from young kids to adults. From craft activities, bingo, poker, wine tasting, scavenger hunts, pool games, basketball, table tennis,, chess, mini race car building and racing to my favorite s'mores and campfire music. They do a wonderful Luau every Thursday night. I've been to it a million times and still enjoy it. Go there every year now for 10 years and have never been disappointed. The General Manager there in Pam Folliet and she and her staff are amazing. Just when I thought I couldn't like the place any better they added a wonderful new workout facility and a world class spa. I can't say enough about the new spa. I'm an avid spa person and have tried spas all over the country. This one is top notch. Very relaxing and all the personnel are very professional. Going back again in a month and can't wait. Have made many friends there as it seems that the same guests come back the same time each year. See you in March Paula

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Destination for Families”
Reviews.Author: GolfTravelHost
Reviews.Content: I have discovered a hidden gem in Orlando, home to thousands of hotels for sure, but I cant say I have ever stayed in a perfect location, but now I can with Marriott Cypress Harbour. They have it all for singles to families for company retreats, it was wonderful. I stayed in a two bedroom suite and it was one of the best rooms I have ever stayed in. I was attending a show near the convention center which was only about a half mile down the road. From the golf course, to the spa, to the planned activites each week there on property for the guests, it is the place to stay while in Orlando. Marriott Cypress Harbour is at the top of my list for staying there again when I visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Sea World”
Reviews.Author: JnDRader
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel. We have been very pleased each time. The staff has always been friednly and efficient. The rooms have always been well maintained. They are quiet. We've never heard a sound from another suite. We have never taken advantage of any of the ameneties on site as we tend to spend the entire day at Sea World or Downtown Disney. The location is perfect for visiting Sea World and is an easy drive to any other theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great week with the family”
Reviews.Author: bug3012
Reviews.Content: Marriott at its best !! Great location .Large clean two bedroon with a great master bedroom and master bath .Could not have asked for anything more was nicer then my home .The staff was great and .lots for the kids too do and the fishing at the lake was so much fun .. We eat at the grill at dinner a few nights and the food was great and the price was good . Would go back anytime .

Reviews.Title: “Great Orlando Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: BostonVacation
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week in January with an Interval International exchange. This is a modern, clean, comfortable property for a great Orlando vacation. Comparable to the Marriott Grande Vista. Our 2-bedroom condo was exactly as pictured on the hotel's website with well furnished kitchen, large living room with flat screen TV and DVD player, master bedroom with king size bed and large jacuzzi tub, second bedroom with queen bed, standard bath and small pull-out sofa, and screened in veranda overlooking the water. Bedroom televisions were not flat screen and did not include DVD players, however. The unit and hotel grounds were clean and well kept. Parking was free. Excellent location within 5 minutes of International Drive, 10 minutes to the Orlando Premium Outlets and Downtown Disney, 5 minutes to Sea World and Aquatica, 10 minutes to Disney parks, and 20 minutes to Downtown Orlando. Very easy access to I-4. Grocery stores within 5 minutes drive for stocking our kitchen. The resort's 3 swimming pools were well heated for January and we swam even with mediocre 65 degree weather. Plenty of pool seating and a very relaxing atmosphere. Plenty of activities for families including playgrounds, basketball courts, small miniature golf course, small soccer field, shuffleboard, bocci ball, well equipped gym, pool volleyball, and tennis court. Basic bar food and pizza available within the resort but no fine dining. A great resort if you are looking for a relaxing home base during a fun-filled Orlando vacation. We'll be back! Only complaint: the free wireless internet coverage was very poor. Don't plan on working from your condo.

Reviews.Title: “CHECK LOCATION OF VILLA”
Reviews.Author: A55
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent a week the first of December. A car is a must as this property is near Sea World but not within walking distance. Disney and restaurants are a few of miles away. We do not have children and like a quiet property, this fit the bill. Before arriving we checked the internet and requested a building away from the recreation areas and asked for a recently refurbished villa. Our request was granted and had a wonderful stay. The grounds are well maintained and the staff very helpful. All villas are 2 Bdr W/full kitchen and all have screened balconies with patio furniture. We cooked several simple meals. A Publix and Walmart are close by for groceries. Will return next winter.

Reviews.Title: “100%”
Reviews.Author: martin f
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on the first week of September 2011 & were so impressed we are 100% certain we are going back. Very close (1mile aprox.) to Sea World & Discovery Cove which we love, the unit we stayed in was beautiful (I believe they are all the same) very spacious clean & modern & with two kids my wife loved the in unit laundry rm. Very clean all around, loved the pools & pool bar, this was a great place for my wife & I to relax & watch the kids playing in the pool.Check out the web site it is loaded with photos of the resort

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location, yet close to everything”
Reviews.Author: bls60
Reviews.Content: Marriott timeshares are typically nice and this was no exception.. 2BDR unit was comfortable for family of four (incl. 2 college students). Stayed Jan. 9th-14th which was after holiday rush, resort felt maybe 20% occupied. Nice fitness center, great lake view, and staff was friendly. 10 minutes to Universal, 10 minutes to Disney , and 5 minutes to vast variety of restaurants on International Drive. ( Sea World next door). No complaints, would use it as "base camp" again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite MVC sites”
Reviews.Author: Travelgrl911
Reviews.Content: I own MVC Aruba and love to stay here whenever we come to Orlando. The place is huge and they are always very accommodating to my requests. They had a bunch of activities for kids throughout the day, and over Christmas they hosted a big party (fee) that was a blast!!! The boat driver is a great guy and you can move around the lake easily if you jump on the boat . Great location to get to Disney and CBS is right around the corner. I love that there is actually a laundry room rather than just a closet as in grande vista.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay for many reasons”
Reviews.Author: good_page
Reviews.Content: Let me count the ways: 1) I called several times to request a certain building because I read report of bugs in some on trip advisor. I arrived and even though they accommodated my request, I wanted to see two units in two different buildings. The wonderful man behind the counter wanted to make sure I was happy with my accomodations (This would never happen in Grande Vista... they tell you owners have preference). We stayed Dec 10-17 and had the top floor unit right next to the clubhouse! The place was immaculate. I could not imagine seeing bugs here. I spoke to the front desk about this and he said people must tell them, and they would take care of it. We did have some flying bugs outside the door but I called right down to the front desk and they took care of it immediately. 2) This place had a plunger in the unit. Even though we did not have to use it, I hate having to ask for one so that was a nice touch. 3 )They had a broom in the closet if you needed to tidy up and the laundry room was huge! 4) The luau was excellent. Sitting by the pool with your feet in the water and watching the show was ideal. 5) Most importantly, I left my purse in the safe. They mailed it back to me, and sent me a check for the cash in it. I have stayed at several hotels and they always say they never found something I left. This place is great and more than accomodating. 6) The swim towels are in your room, not at the pool. We went down to the hot tub and it started to poor. Our towels were soaked. The bartender went to the front desk and brought us new ones. We did not have a chance to use the amenities or even see the property as we went to Sea World each day, but you can bet that we will be back here next year. Never before have I seen such excellent service by everyone I met there. We have stayed at Marriott Sabal Palms, Grand Vista, Harbour here in Orlando and I say hands down this is the best. My husband likes Sabal Palms more because it had a bigger living room. I rated this place higher because the step in sabal palms was a worry. We never had any trouble, but with two small kids, I still worried.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeafl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here December 29 to January 5 and had a great time. The 2-bedroom villa had a nicely equipped kitchen and plenty of room to spread out. The master bedroom had a very comfortable bed and a large 2-person whirlpool tub. The second bedroom was a little tight when the sofa bed was being used, but really not a problem. The full size washer and dryer came in very handy during our week, although only one load of detergent was included. If you have more than one load to do you must get your own detergent. We only used the pool one day and it was fine. We also rented the 4-person bike, but we were limited as to where we could ride it. You were pretty much limited to the parking lot area which was disappointing. I believe it was $14 rental fee for half an hour of use, but I may be wrong. The location was convenient to Disney, and since that it what we were down there for, we did not take advantage of any of the scheduled activities at the resort. Parking was very convenient and we never had a problem finding a close-by spot, even when we returned home late at night. We ordered from the on site Pizza Hut and it was delivered fast and hot. They only have 2 sizes, medium and personal. The medium is $13.99, and if you bought two mediums you got a free 2 liter of pop. We are not owners, but exchanged our time share for the Cypress Harbour. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to spend Christmas week with Family”
Reviews.Author: ivorysnowgirl
Reviews.Content: We (party of 4 adults and 2 teens checked in 12/26. The facility is very clean, neat, well kept and the staff are personable, helful and friendly. We enjoyed visiting theme parks nearby and resting by pool. Teens enjoyed the activity center with basketball courts, boats and bike rentals. Activities are well organized and varied. 2 people in our party had no trouble getting same day tee time at nearby golf course. Unit was clean and short walk to almost everything if you used the foot bridge. WE were in building 66 nice location backs to golf course and putting green short walk to field and pool. Full kitchen and Walmart nearby is great savings for breakfast and lunch. We ordered in from onsite galley restaraunt and pizza hut and both were good, fast and reasonable. Great resort for families or fun loving adults. Close to Sea World and Disney

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort minutes from Disney, around the corner from SeaWorld.”
Reviews.Author: captainjake77
Reviews.Content: My parents (in their 60's), my wife & I, and our two year old and three year old just spent a week at Cypress Harbour. Cypress Harbour is a Marriott Vacation Club resort so the rooms are like condo units with full kitchens, laundry, screened-in porch, etc... The pools are heated and we swam with our small children even though Mother Nature wasn't cooperating and gave us cold temperatures. The staff were all helpful. The entire property is clean and very safe. The units are two bedroom, two bath. Ours was spacious and recently renovated. During our stay we visited the Disney parks at least twice per day using our rented minivan. The longest drive was maybe eighteen minutes. The airport (MCO) was even closer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, if only you were able to control the room thermostat.”
Reviews.Author: vgcr
Reviews.Content: Staying there right now, and although I agree with other reviewers ( great place, great location, good value and comfortable rooms) and I personally love having a kitchen (especially for breakfast, it saves time and money), I do have one and only complaint: that no matter what we did the room got awfully warm at night. We tried lowering the thermostat and it would still be warm. The hotel serviceman came and told us that if we lowered it under 64 degrees it would reset itself to 75, which defeats the whole purpose of having a thermostat in the first place. No matter what temperature we put in, it would still be too warm to sleep comfortably, and this is in January, with 50 degrees outside! Really an inconvenience. Otherwise, it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...but I prefer Harbor Lake across the street”
Reviews.Author: Lois-Lynn D
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Ask for one of the renovated units...they have some in most of the older buildings, in the 50s and 60s. Look at a map of the property...some of the buildings are really far, a healthy walk or drive, and might be an issue if you are schlepping stuff and kids to the pool. There are three pools...heated, but I think they should be a little warmer especially on some of the cooler December days. The main pool has jets in one section...and that is kind of cool. The renovated units have decent finishes, color coordinated paints, linens, try ceilings, ss appliances, granite counters...but I'm really not looking for decor as my best feature in a one week timeshare exchange. I liked that the master suite had an air tub rather than a jacuzzi which is much more hygienic. The second bedroom has a queen bed and then a sleeper sofa...very crowded and awkward arrangement. The units are narrower and smaller overall than Marriott's Harbour Lake across the street. I liked that there were 2 small hot tubs at each pool, so that if one was out of order or not working, you could use an alternate. Some other reviewers have said that this is the largest timeshare they've stayed at inOrlando...I would disagree and say that there are several other properties with larger units. The unit was tidy but not perfectly clean; the carpet was new but needed a cleaning and the master shower had some mold that bleach would have taken care of easily. The grounds are beautiful and there are a number of activities at the activity center, e.g. Crafts, races, etc...if this is your thing. If you have kids, definitely stay at Harbour Lake. We needed some business services that any regular hotel with business travellers would have accomodated, but they dropped the ball for us...i am not really surprised or disappointed because this is a timeshare resort, but it was a little frustrating that day. We arrived 2 hours before check in at 1pm, and they were able to accomodate us early...very unexpected. This was a nice property, but I wasn't blown away by the resort. Maybe my expectations were a little too high based on other reviews, but I think I will try a different propert when we return to Orlando in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “The best resort in orlando”
Reviews.Author: TNewby
Reviews.Content: Lovely grounds, great service, comphy beds chairs and sofa, cute color sceme. Lots of activities for kids and adults from boating to crafts to firewalkers! Many great pool and hot tubs, and no idiocies about pool towel checkout. Minor kitchen repair was the only fly in perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: 3LilBears
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the 2-bedroom villa at the Marriott Cypress Harbour during Christmas week. It was our first stay here and our first visit in Orlando in December. We usually stay at the Marriott Grande Vista whenever we visit. But we didn't regret our Christmas trip to Cypress Harbour. We made sure that this time we took advantage of the resort this time around. We were glad that we did. There are 3 pools at the resort. We used the Island pool and the kids loved it. It was rarely crowded and the water was nice. We made a daily trip to the pool. The resort team dressed in elf costume delivered stockings for the kids. The stockings were not free, but it was a nice touch to have that Christmas spirit being away from home. My daughter kept saying, "I knew Santa would find us!" There were also many activities around the resort and lots of playgrounds for the kids to use. The resort was courteous about getting our supplies replenished upon request. Cleaning was not included with our stay. But they gave us plenty of cleaning supplies within the villa. We also enjoyed the full size washer and dryer. The Marriott Grande Vista had the two-in-one units in their villas. The only downside was that our villa (Building 72) was far away from the main attractions of the resort. With a toddler, we had to drive to the pool. But that didn't ruin our trip whatsoever. The resort is also close to Publix, Sea World, and Disney theme parks. We also made a trip to Legoland, which was 45 minutes from the resort. It was a nice stay. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week”
Reviews.Author: peonyrose
Reviews.Content: Cypress Harbour is the place to go if you want relaxing yet elegant accommodations in the Orlando area. All there units are 2 bedroom and so spacious and lovely. The views over the lake are restful and serene. The pool near the Activity room has been very quiet and so nice for the older crowd.

Reviews.Title: “40th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Pearl G
Reviews.Content: Upon entering Marriott Cypress Harbour with all the beautiful Christmas lights and decorations I knew we picture the perfect resort the celebrate our 40th Wedding Anniversary! So very pretty! The unit was amazing,I told my husband I don't care if we go anywhere this week I am perfectly happy just to stay right here! It was perfect. The staff are the nicest we ever had the pleasure to meet,they are always smiling and waving. The staff at the gate welcome you back each time with smiles and their was one I referred to as two thumbs up guy he always gave everyone two thumbs up for making it back. We spent our anniversary at Disney on a beautiful day and rest of the week at the resort. Great vacation at a beautiful resort!!! We will be back actually planning to be back in the spring. Marriott Cypress Harbour you should be very proud! Especially of you staff great friendly bunch! The Galleys from NovaScotia.

Reviews.Title: “Great timeshare with lots of room”
Reviews.Author: HeritageSoftail14843
Reviews.Content: 2 adult couples stayed at this location and found the rooms to be spacious and nicely spaced apart so you had your own "space" in the unit. The master has a king bed, the other room has a queen bed. The beds are nice but not very soft. The amenities in the room are great although if you are in a room not on the top floor you can experience noise from the tenants above you. There are multiple pools including one that has adult only hours in the a.m. and p.m. which is nice if you want a little peace and quiet while you relax by the pool. There are lots of activities including boats and bicycles that can be rented for a nominal charge.

Reviews.Title: “Never look a gift horse inthe mouth....”
Reviews.Author: ImATravelinFool
Reviews.Content: I was invited to be a guest of an old buddy and his wife to share a week in a time share they had in this Marriott property. Bringing the little woman on a short, pre-Christmas, inexpensive vacation, I scored some points. While the ladies enjoyed all of the amenities of the resort property, my buddy and I enjoyed some local golf courses. I found the suites to be fully appointed, clean and well laid out. From what I personally experience and from what the ladies reported, all of the facilities were excellent: pools, game area, restaurant, etc. The only minor complaint regarding my experience at Cypress Harbour was that the bed in the guest room was a little stiff for my liking but you might enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “SOOOO much room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: patihalt
Reviews.Content: Our family decided to try one suite here instead of the two connecting rooms we would typically get every year at an on-site Disney Hotel and we were SO happy with our choice!!! First, the room was essentially half of what we would have paid for the two rooms elsewhere. The proximity to Disney World, specifically Epcot, was WONDERFUL (I think it was 3 exits!) Lastly -- there were 7 of us -- we could easily have gotten a few friends in (I think it officially sleeps 8!) The main room was very spacious with a wraparound couch where both my sons spent the night. It was so comfy that they didn't even bother, though they could have pulled it out into a bed. The master bedroom was GIANT with a HUGE jetted tub. The second bedroom had a queen sized bed and a queen sized sofa sleeper. Though we only stayed one night, there was a full kitchen if we had been staying longer (we DID utilize the on-site Pizza Hut and Starbucks!) The entire place was spotless. There were also lots of on-site activities (a luau, paddle boats, craft classes, etc.) in case you are worn out from days at the parks and just need a day to chill by the pool/lake! We will DEFINITELY be making another trip to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hsqos
Reviews.Content: I have been to Orlando on a number of occasions and try to stay at a different hotel each visit. Based on Trip Advisor reviews we booked this hotel. We stayed here for 3 nights the rooms were large 2 beds, big bathroom and we had a balcony with view over golf course. We used the gym which was clean and had a variety of equipment. There was a shop which was well stocked with groceries postcards and teeshirts. It was located near Seaworld and the Premium Outlet Mall. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Only one regret...”
Reviews.Author: cherylwalt
Reviews.Content: Our family recently spent a week at the Marriott Cypress Harbour. We enjoyed absolutely everything about the experience. The reservation desk was located in a lobby decorated with a large, beautiful Christmas tree. The rooms (small apartments) were beautiful and spacious. We had enough room for our entire family to gather together and have meals around the dining room table. The units were clean and quiet, with a beautiful view of the lake. We were able to sit on our screened in balcony and enjoy the beautiful view while we had our breakfast. We had pizza delivered from the Pizza Hut on property. The delivery was fast and the pizza delicious. We were visiting with our 3 1/2 year old grandson and were able to visit the activity center one morning for "Bubble Fun" and for our grandson it was lots of fun. We also took a paddle boat out onto the lake, played miniature golf and went swimming in one of the beautiful swimming pools. The primary purpose for our trip was to visit Walt Disney World. Our only regret is that our vacation was only a week long. We all decided that we really needed more time to enjoy the resort and we all wished that we had at least another 3 days to just hang at Cypress Harbour. Next time we visit it will be for at least 10 days!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite off-site Disney timeshare in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: MedfordMama
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. This time it was five of us--Mom Dad, teenager, kindergartener, and preschooler. The pool is wonderful. The proximity to Disney is terrific. Our room was a 2 bedroom unit with a kitchen and washer/dryer and a lovely balcony. The convenience store on-site is terrific and has a lot more than you would expect. They offer room service for the pizza hut as well as some salads and it comes quickly and conveniently at the end of a day running around at the parks. The timeshare is close enough to the restaurants on the main drag to be convenient as well. They have lots of kids activities which we did not use this time but did use last time and enjoyed. They have a cute playground and you can rent boats and bikes.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: katherineiris
Reviews.Content: I visited this resort for Thanksgiving 2011. I say resort rather than hotel because it has many amenities for kids so the whole family will be entertained and happy! Its private and very cozy feels like a second home. Staff is very helpful and accommodate every need very fast. The rooms are very large with washer and dryer in the room for long stays that is such a great feature came in handy for our stay. A full new kitchen was great for cooking meals.The property sits on a lake where paddle boats and fishing fun are available. Also, 3 large pools, arcade, basketball court, miniature golf and huge golf course for expert players. Overall it is great for families especially for kids!

Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious 1st Class Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JenEady
Reviews.Content: I was working at the IAPAA trade show this year and stayed at this hotel for the 1st time and loved it!!! I got a 2 bedroom suite and it did not disapoint!! The masterbathroom was HUGE and the guest bathroom and bedroom was very spacious! The entire room was very spacious and clean and a perfect place to stay while in Orlando! Lots of onsite activities available and great food places to choose from!! I will definitely be staying there again when in town!!

Reviews.Title: “Good family place”
Reviews.Author: anneez
Reviews.Content: We are here on a big family get together and this is great place to do exactly that. We've been really comfortable in the two bedroom villas, nice kitchens, etc. The grounds are well maintained and have a little something for everyone. My kids are 10 and 11 and are thrilled with the activity center - pool tables, arcade, basketball, boating, mini golf, all kinds of stuff to keep them busy. The location is nice, about 15-20 min. From Disney and Universal so out of the fray but accessible. I just had a massage at the spa, Eva was awesome! The Grill is ok, good for lunch not great for dinner though. Overall a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “"Family of 5 wished we had planned for more time here!""”
Reviews.Author: LaVue2
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous in every way! Stayed 4 nights in a 2 bed/2 bath condo that was luxurious. The master bedroom couldn't have been better; it was huge, nice furniture, great TV, whirlpool tub that the kids enjoyed daily, twin sinks, nice closet, and great shower. A queen-size bed and full-size sofabed was in the guest bedroom. A little tight to maneuver around but preferred to use the one in the bedroom so others in the family could continue to enjoy the living room. There was also a sofabed in the living room so the villa could actually sleep 8. The full kitchen was very nice with granite countertops and was outfitted well except no coffee, if I remember correctly. We walked over to the marketplace to get good coffee. We stayed near the Clubhouse Pool in the Big Pine Key area and that location is fantastic since we were right by the main clubhouse, marketplace, pizza, Krispy Kreme doughnuts, concierge, and a fantastic pool that had hot-tub-type bubbles in one area of it that the kids loved. Loved the screened patio with a beautiful view. We only got to see a few of the many amenities it offered. Daily activities were offered, many more pools, a nature walk, and other features that we did not get to enjoy since theme parks were our priority. Wonderful location if going to both Universal, Disney World, and Downtown Disney. Good directions were given and a map was provided which we used as our primary map. The WiFi worked quickly and easily with good connection speed. Great to have a washer & dryer in the villa too. The grounds were absolutely beautiful. This was a bit pricier than we usually spend but would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family, friends or couples vacation”
Reviews.Author: mlascaris
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. I stayed there during a business trip but will definitely come back, highly recommended. There's fast food delivery available on property at super reasonable prices. I had a two bedroom villa with hot tub, awesome. One complaint though, housekeeping were a bother on my last day, they kept calling calling my room and hovering outside my villa door long before checkout time.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families or couples”
Reviews.Author: FL_songbird
Reviews.Content: 2 bd/2 bath unit with living room, fully equipped kitchen and screened in patio is a real breath of fresh air instead of pricey hotel rooms and meals out. The pools are large and relaxing. The grounds are lovely. Little market shop w/ food items and sundries. Cafe with meals, lounge bar. Can even have dine-in service if you don't want to walk down to the cafe. Parks are all nearby or within 15 minute drive. Game room, arcade, bike rentals, golf, tennis, putt-putt golf for kids and activities. It is really an all round nice place to visit!. Been there three times already and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: mssee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Feb. as we were going to Seaworld & Discovery Cove for my sons 40th B'day. We usually stay @ Marriott Renassisance which is directly across the street from Seaworld. It is a beautiful hotel but it was completely booked. Marriott Cypress Harbour was really close & the suite a 2bedroom/2bath was REALLY big & clean & beautiful! We were on the top floor of a reburished building. The suite was decorated beautifully. A lovely screened in balcony w/table & chairs. I loved sitting out there in the early morning w/my two grandsons. I had my coffee, they had their breakfast, we enjoyed the birds singing & the nice breeze, while my hubby & their parents slept. The bedrooms were seperated by the kitchen & living room. The bathroom was right outside the one bedroom & the other was in the master bedroom. made for nice privavcy. We never heard a sound when the kids were in the living room. Three big flat screen TV's. Granite counters S/S appliances, coffee pot, full fridge...couldn't ask for more! Buy your coffee, cream & sugar @ the Walgreens or CVS...Bottled water & snacks too. Hotel store is expensive. Only thing I'm afraid of cats & they were walking around the buildings if you went out @ night. They didn.t bother you, I'm just afraid of them. Big beautiful pools but a little chilly for me even though they were heated. Nice childrens pool & playgrounds . Lots of activities. LOTS of walking, as the property is very large. Washer & dryer too. They have nice towels & give you plenty. Would definately stay here again. It would be great just to spend a week @ this location & do no parks. Staff is excellent as well. I believe this to be a true Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Consider this”
Reviews.Author: BBB051
Reviews.Content: We got to this because of the exchange of our timeshar. The appartment has 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a pullout coach in the livingroom. The vieuw was not the greatest, but there are apps available with a vieuw on a lake. The resort has excellent security. Also very well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun at Cypress Harbour”
Reviews.Author: 24Beckie24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort 10/1-108 and all I can say is I would definitely come back if ever in the Orlando area again. The kids (ages 6, 7 & 8) enjoyed the pools and activities so much, it was hard to leave for the Disney parks. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in building 63, which was very convenient to the actitivies center and a short walk to the pools. The rooms were clean with plenty of space for everyone. The only drawback, beware of the large bugs lurking in dark places. During our weeklong stay, we only saw two, but that was two too many!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient with homey feel..”
Reviews.Author: roadlesstraveld
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot to explore the theme parks and enjoy family activities. Condo was updated with granite countertops and stainless steel appliances. Full size washer/dryer made for ease in packing. We stayed in buliding 63, adjacent to the bayside activities center. The kids loved the mini pontoon boats, mini golf, fishing and the boat taxi. Both pools were nicely heated. Many planned activities to choose from...including s'more making with excellent live music, luau night, etc. Grounds are immaculate, pride of ownership is apparent from all staff. Had pizza hut at main pool one night and it was very good. The market place had all grocery items you might need. The guy who ran the pontoon boat was extremely friendly, making a fun experience excellent for the children. We did the Vacation Club viewing and were offered an excellent deal on Universal tickets which I highly recommend. The park tickets allowed for an hour early entry to Harry Potter, well worth taking the tour. (With our early entry, we were able to ride Forbidden Journey twice....if we had come later in day would have been a 50 minute wait!) The location of this resort is great, direct route to I-4. There's a reason why this beats out the other Marriott Vacation properties in Orlando...its very family friendly, beatuiful and staff aim to please. Despite having 6 days of park tickets, our kids were just as happy to spend time at the resort. Don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “A happy week in orlando”
Reviews.Author: wizrick
Reviews.Content: stayed a week and couldn't have asked for more.(except that it wasn't on Disney property,and therefore didn't have the Disney "magic"). Given that,it was clean,roomy with a washer and dryer and a nice screened porch with a view of a lake,comfy bed and generally good vibe. The staff were friendly and helpful,the pool was nice,the food was pretty good and we always felt glad when we came "home" after a day at the parks. I would stay there again with no qualms.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel T
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a family hotel this is one of your best options. The rooms feature a fully equipped kitchen as well as laundry facilities. All rooms are the same so no options other than floor and resort location. You have a few restaurants to choose from but nothing special it has a wide range of facilities to spend your time, like 3 swimming pools golf course various sports etc. But the majority of the people visiting come for the theme parks. Make sure you have a car if you plan to visit the theme parks as well as pre book your tickets son you don't loose time waiting at the long lines at the ticket booths. Please also mind that although the came and clean everyday they do not change the linen or do a thorough cleaning service. To summarize it if you are a family with kids it's one of your best option for a value stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: G5P5S
Reviews.Content: Close to SeaWorld and all major attractions. Excellent service and amenities. Works very well with families with children as well as couples.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ang1111
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 nights here earlier this month with our 24 year old son. Set up was great as he had his own room & bathroom and the living space/kitchen was huge. It would have certainly easily accomodated a much bigger family. Having a washer & dryer was useful too. Even though we didn't pay extra for housekeeping we got a daily tidy up, beds made, dishwasher loaded and towel change which was great. There was plenty to do on site, my husband and son fished in the well stocked lake most days and were never disappointed. We didn't take advantage but seem to be organised stuff for kids and evening entertainment too. Pools were very nice. The location was perfect - just off International Drive very close to Sea World and only 10-15 minutes away from either Disney area or Universal Staff were all very friendly and when we did have a question or need some help they knew their stuff! If you don't want a 'time-share' appointment just don't respond to the answer machine messages - we were bothered no more than that! Certainly best place we've stayed in Florida and I'm sure we'll be back, especially with the very attractive rates they offer in Autumn! Take note of their direction sheet - details how to get to & back from most area attractions and we found it useful - we know the area and wouldn't have always chosen these routes but they were very direct! The only thing it lacked was a good restaurant on site but there were plenty close by and suppose they are self catering condos!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great!”
Reviews.Author: Momofmandm
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to find this time share property so well kept and comfortable. The staff did a great job helping us without being over bearing and we never had to deal with sales pitches, the location, about 15 minutes to Disney and 3 minutes to SeaWorld, was perfect. Lots to do on property and even a great staff for kids night out to give the parents some time to themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mimistar1987
Reviews.Content: Wow!! I could not Fault Marriott Cypress Harbour. Arrived back on 8th October 2011 from a two week stay. Accommodation was fab, I loved it nice and clean, nice decor, everythink you would want and more. They had about 3 0r 4 pool areas in this complex, I could not believe the size of the complex it was massive, all the staff ride around on golf buggies it is so big!! The surroundings are so pretty and very clean too. We had a great 2 bedroom apartment looking on to the lake not far from the spa, the view was lovely!! There is so much to do here a lot more than the other 5 places I have stayed in Florida. They have day activites, some night time entertainment, Boat Hire, Golf Range, Bike Hire, Kids club. For me this is one of the best places to be situated, you could walk to sea world or even get on the I trolley outside the complex for $1.25!!! Universal was not far either, you could catch the I trolley for just $1.25!!! Not too sure how long that would take maybe about 40 - 60 mins. Disney was not far, you could also jump on Lynx bus (At the end of the drive by the Chemist/Shop) No 50 to Down Town Disney ($16.00 in Taxi) or Magic Kingdom it only took me about 15 minutes at the cost of $2.00 !!! I will mention to you that you should buy your park tickets before you go as you won’t ever get good deals in Florida like we do in England. If you pay per day Disney Parks are around £57 + Tax and on top of that parking is about $15.00 (Wow now we know how they make their money) From Cypress Harbour you could catch the I trolley to the Premium outlet. This is like 10 minutes ride. There is another premium outlet not far from universal which is a bit bigger than the other outlet. I spent an Hour on a Lynx bus to get to Florida Mall!! For me this was a total let down and would not go there again, I wish I had gone to Mall at Millennia as it looks great. If you fancy a night out with music and entertainment go to Disney Board walk - Jellie Roles with Duelling pianos - check the website out it is $10.00 to get in (about $28.00 there in taxi from Complex) Universal City walk (Blue Martini) is meant to be a good night out but did not get the chance to enjoy that. There is a Chemist/shop (Fairly Big) just at the end of the drive at the most a 10 minute walk. For a big shop it is just a 10 minute drive away and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Always Our Favorite in Orlando!!!”
Reviews.Author: mom-2-4boyz
Reviews.Content: We've been staying here for over 10 years and it's still our favorite! Customer service is always top notch, the property is always so beautiful and the units are perfect! They have so many activities for the kids...example...it's POURING outside today, so we're off to the activities center!!! LOVE LOVE this tinmeshare!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and great views.”
Reviews.Author: W2965
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here recently with extended family and Marriott's Cypress Harbour was our base of operations for hanging out with family and visiting the area theme parks. Our two bedroom unit was very clean and had a beautiful view of the lake and fountains. Near our rooms we could walk to a recreation and activity area for kids and adults plus there are pools for kids and adults as well. Each unit has a full kitchen so we were also able to save $$ by purchasing our food at the nearby grocery store and eating home cooked meals. We have stayed here two times now in the past ten years and it looked just as nice both times.

Reviews.Title: “Dock up to this Harbour!!!”
Reviews.Author: AMB852
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful 2BR/2Bath suite for 5 people (2 of which were under age 5). Has everything you need inside and outside of your unit. Comes complete with a full kitchen (and full-size refrigerator), washer and dryer and screened in balcony to enjoy the view and breezes without any insects. They have an outside elevator, which helps with luggage and wheelchairs. Resort has 3 pools, game room and activities for the kids in the activity center as wells as games and prizes at the pool. They have basketball, multi-passenger bikes to ride around, paddle boats and a little miniature golf. They don't leave the adults out either. We saw an Hawaiian show and a couple of us ladies even took a belly-dancing class at the activity center. Lot of fun and laughs. I recommended this resort to others and have even booked my daughter and her family here in December. Everyone was really nice and helpful at the office too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort close to Seaworld & Universal”
Reviews.Author: Caryjames
Reviews.Content: My nephew and I had a 2-bedroom suite that was fantastic. The grounds are gorgeous and there is so much to do right on-site, if you need a break from the parks and crowds. They also have the most polite and friendly staff I've seen - everyone of them waves whenever you pass by. You will not be disappointed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A definate do again!”
Reviews.Author: bossguy
Reviews.Content: We travelled to this property with 4 adults in our party. As many have noted before this is a very peaceful location to get some R&R. None of us could believe an entire week passed, we would have loved to stay another week! We were in building 50, Key Largo, and found it close to everything buy not so close we feltany others were nearby. The villas are amazing and we practically had the small pool to ouselves, at most 3 others were there with us. Obviously we weren't there during peak season; middle of September. The staff was exceptional and we are eager to return to this property. I-4 access was nearby ad was Publix and CVS. As the title says we will definately be back. I would suggest a Lake View room as well as requesting a renovated unit. We did and were very happy they accomodated both requests.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: uptownlady
Reviews.Content: Was here 2nd week January 2011 - adult only vacation. Cypress Harbour in in a good location for the various attraction. Our main thing was to go to Universal for Harry Potter and one day at Disney. We had a two bedroom suite with full kitchen that came in handy for breakfast and a couple of dinners. The room was clean but you have to pay extra for housekeeping - we exchanged our timeshare. If you rent as regular hotel suite you do not have to pay for housekeeping. We had no problem taking out our trash and you could get fresh towels and linens if you wanted. They have a starbucks or maybe just their coffee on site and a small shop. We never use since we were out early and back late. Staff very friendly and front desk check-in and out no problem. They will ask if you want to take a tour for the timeshare but you can pass. Harry Potter is a must even if you are not a fan. I was amazed at how much it looks like the description in the book. Going through the school was like being in the movies.

Reviews.Title: “Simply for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: DeeMax01
Reviews.Content: Hi Folks, My hubby and I just finished up our annual vacation at Cypress Harbour on September 19, 2011. As usual we had the time of our lives!! We stayed the normal time which was 1 week and I can say Cypress Harbour is still a nice, comfortable and clean place to stay. The only complaint we would like to mention was the large amount of the big roaches that were running around the property and 1 in our villa. I guess a little more use of an exterminator is needed.Also, it takes too long for the water in the bathrooms to heat up. Other than that we had no other problems or concerns. I think we chosed a really good week because it seemed like there were mostly adults staying on the property unlike the day we were leaving there were plenty of families with children checking in. We will return next year if it's in Gods will and we will continue to recommend Cypress Harbour to our friends. Kudos to the boat driver Pablo!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: sholix
Reviews.Content: traded my timeshare wonderful place the 2 bedroom was huge jacuzzi in masterbedroom, full kitchen and laundry room with bigscreen tv in living room, nice pool quite area i cant wait to get back there

Reviews.Title: “Great escape with great location”
Reviews.Author: theatermomMaryland
Reviews.Content: This Marriott vacation resort is a great option for families who wish to visit the theme parks, but also have a peaceful, pretty, place to relax. The resort is well situated between Disney and Universal, near a less populated part of International Drive. The units are all 2 bedroom, 2 bath and very comfortable. All parts are perfectly maintained. Our unit in bldg.72, was pretty far to walk to the fitness center and pools, so I would not recommend that spot for families with small children in tow. Plenty of buildings are close to the 3 pool areas and activity center (basketball, shuffleboard, video games, mini golf, etc.) There are nearby shopping centers for groceries and non-chain meals (we particularly liked Fama's a family run Italian in the Williamsburg shopping center with the Publix grocery store) It was a less than 10 minute drive to Universal, and also close to Disney. This is a timeshare resort, but we were only contacted one time to hear their presentation. Reminder, this is almost like renting an apartment, everything you need is there, just no maid service unless you pay extra.

Reviews.Title: “Don't want to go home!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline M
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely brilliant! We have been to Orlando a couple of times before and stayed in very nice 'Vacation Homes' - as this time it was only for a week, we thought we'd try something different. Can't praise the place enough .... the staff are really friendly, the accommodation is great (we're in one of the refurbished blocks, so don't know what the others are like, but this one is very nice), facilities within the apartment are second to none - the kitchen area is very well appointed (including a coffee maker and FREE coffee!) and the utility area with a washer/dryer is better than we've got at home! There is a choice of pool areas, we've only used the main one but really can't fault it. The shop is adequate and food is readily available (as are cocktails!). We haven't really taken full advantage of the activities but if the weather hadn't been so brilliant, we probably would've done. The beds are really comfy, the jacuzzi bath is spectacular and 3 flat screen tv's have gone down very well with us and our teenage kids. Free wifi is useful too! Location-wise, we're not really into Disney but the parks aren't that far away, for us the proximity to Sea World, Discovery Cove, International Drive and shopping malls make it ideal. Alas, our week is drawing to an end and in 48 hours we'll be on our way home .... it's definitely on our list to return to some day though!

Reviews.Title: “Half good half bad”
Reviews.Author: priscilla c
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our room which I found quite shabby. I did not want to spoil the vacation by complaining so I decided to try to muscle through. The longer I stayed in the room the more I saw how truly filthy it was. There were food crumbs under all the cushions in the living room. There was what appeared to be coffee splattered up and down the shutters inside the master bedroom. As I lay in bed one night I looked up at the air conditioning vents which were so full of mold I knew then why we were having trouble sleeping. The final moment came when I looked in the jacuzzi and saw a used piece of soap stuck to the top edge where some left it. This unit was obviously not being cleaned at all. I finally called the front desk by Thursday morning and told them how dirty my unit was. The manager said she would find me another unit. She called back to say she had a unit and I went to meet her to inspect it. It was stunning. I then told her I was taking her to my unit to see. She was SHOCKED by the condition. After we moved everything was very pleasant at the resort. I just wish I had known there are two different kinds of units. Original filthy units and updated beautiful units. I do think Marriott should stop and update all the units before running the risk of getting a bad rap.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away for two”
Reviews.Author: Burg
Reviews.Content: This was a timeshare exchange for us. We were very pleased with the accommodations. We had the two bedroom/two bath unit. We had a lake view villa which was very nice in the mornings for breakfast and sunsets at the end of the day. There were many activities even though it was not their busy season. We rented a boat and fished. We used one of the three swimming pools. We took advantage of their spa. We especially liked the location as it was close to everything we had planned to do. Our unit was immaculate. We do plan to return again with our adult children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation place”
Reviews.Author: nrlaker
Reviews.Content: Beginning with check-in, everyone was very helpful and accommodating. The unit I stayed in was very convenient to a pool and was overlooking a lake. There was also a very nice walking path around the complex. The interior was very roomy and comfortable with nice up to date furnishings. Would definitely stay there again. Was very convenient to all attractions, restaurants, and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Another Marvellous Holiday”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd week of a two week holiday in Florida, My wife and I are owners at Harbour Lake but we love Cypress Harbour also and this was our 3rd time exchanging to this resort. We requested a lake view villa as its so relaxing having breakfast overlooking the lake. Our week commenced 3rd September so it was quite busy for the Labour Day Weekend but quiet thereafter. My wife and I just wanted to relax,soak up the Sun and enjoy the heat and this resort allows you to do both. We found the staff to be very courteous and helpful, as on previous stays. The resort is situated close to good restaurants, supermarkets and Shopping Outlets and Seaworld is just round the corner with the rest of the Theme Parks within easy reach. The Villas (Apartments) themselves can sleep 8 but are probably ideal for 4-6 with the master bedroom being huge to incorporate a large jaccuzi tub, brilliant! The fast food facility on site is a boon and while it is not cheap what you get is nice. Would I recommend to family and friends? Certainly would and have! We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: cberry135
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cypress Harbour over spring break. The location was very convenient to reach Disney, Universal Studios and the airport. Sea World is almost within walking distance. As with all the Marriott Vacation Club places I have stayed the accommodations were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Accomodation in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: dramaqueenk
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this place-have been going to Orlando every year since i was 3 years old and have stayed in a variety of places, but this has it all. The decor is beautiful, with balconies that overlook the lake, great size pool with plenty of sunbeds in lots of different places around the pool, well quipped gym, outdoor BBQ areas-cannot praise this place enough. The one and only small downfall is the lift, which is a bit slow and there is only one per apartment block. But this is me being ultra picky. Been going here for the last 5 years and will keep going back. Great for all ages!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic family holiday!”
Reviews.Author: dhsurrey
Reviews.Content: Well! What can you say about this resort!. First and foremost it is excellent for families. As anyone who reads some of my reviews will know, I spend a significant proportion of my year in hotels and have a high bar, in terms of quality. This definitely meets that. As a hotel, for a vacation, is not always holiday! I like to get away and relax and not have to think about the little things that will niggle, in terms of “quality” and “service”. This Marriot resort delivers on both levels. I’d booked this trip as a special 2 week vacation for my family (my wife and young son). Upon arrival the check-in staff were very courteous. After a long-haul flight, that was very welcome. They showed me the apartment I would be staying in on a map, in relation to the entire resort. As I had a young son with me, it was not close to either of the 2 pools, so I asked to move closer to a pool and they accommodated the request, without hesitation. On that point, the resort does have 2 pools. The main pool at the resort entrance and a smaller satellite pool off to the left of the lake, by the kids club. This is a quieter pool, without pool bar.
