But for those of you who do not favour so much “noise and activity” it is a better place to be. However, the main pool is better for the older kids. We stayed in a 2 bed apartment. It was “very big”. The kitchen area had a double sink, dishwasher, oven & microwave. There was a separate washing room with washing machine and tumble dryer with ironing board and iron. The dining room was significant, leading into the lounge area with a modern TV with cable TV and a very large L-shaped sofa and chairs to seat all the family very comfortably. Each bedroom has king sized beds (very comfortable matrasses) with plenty of wardrobe space and the master bedroom had and double sink, shower and hot tub. Even better was the hot-tub was positioned next to the bed so you could actually watch TV in the TUB – a nice touch! Outside was a screened veranda with fan which overlooked the golf course, which was well used of an evening…. The on-site store was adequate but priced at a premium, as you might expect. But it catered for all the basics you need to get you started or for the snacks, should you not want to go off site. In addition there was an onsite Pizza Hut which was of a very good quality. Evening entertainment was also provided both in the clubhouse and by the pool bar. There was also a Kids Club which was a very good standard and ran during the day and some evenings until 9:30p.m. It was well supervised and the smaller children were very well looked after. This was an excellent service, again well used for a rest bite! During the holiday, but ensure you have your mobile/cell phone as they will want it for the evening kids club service, in case you leave your room and go to the bar, for example, to stop being mum and dad and re-engage in being husband and wife for a few hours!?!. The facilities on site were generally of a very high standard and the staff service was of the best I have seen and I have travelled the world, on business for the past 20 year staying in hotels. This resort REALLY DELIVERS! We did have a couple of very minor issues during our stay and we called resort maintenance. Each time, within 15 minutes, a very polite maintenance man arrived at the door and sorted the problem, followed by a call to check everything had been resolved to our satisfaction. You can’t really ask for more than that, if you have a problem (apart from the problem not being there in the first place, of course, but…) the service was very good in solving it. Finally, the location of the resort is very well placed. It is just 1 minute from SeaWorld, 5 minutes’ drive from DownTime Disney and 10 minutes from the Disney resorts and the Universal resorts. There is also a pharmacy 1 minute away from the resort, too, for all you mum’s and dad’s and Wal-Mart is 2 miles away for a food shop. So, overall. A “fantastic place for a family vacation”, an excellent location and 5 star service! Overall, I’d definitely go back!....

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back bugs in room!”
Reviews.Author: 2kidsmom28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay here as we are loyal Marriott rewards customers. Upon entering the villa I noticed it was dates. The walls were dirty and one of the yellow chairs is stained. I didn't want to upset my husband and start our trip off by complaining so I just covered the couch and chair with the extra sheets provided. I checked the bed and found no bed bugs. The shower had mold and squashed dead gnats on the ceiling and bathroom walls in the master bathroom. Later, I went to use the bathroom and there was a bug about the size of a roach in there. I got upset and we killed it. Not wanting to gripe and complain I know sometimes bugs get in so I let it go. The next day there was one at the base of bedroom carpet dead. Ok this is getting bad. I am starting to get upset because we used over 120,000 points to stay in a dump. Trying to make the best of our trip and enjoy our time away I am trying to be nice and remain calm. Well, we woke up this morning to find a bug crawling on the mater bath sink. I have had enough and called the front desk. They sent someone up to our room with ant and roach spray. He sprayed the bug and the entire sink with the spray. The bathroom and the bedroom carpets. However, the guy used it like it was Lysol spray and sprayed the air so now our room stinks so bad. It is our last night here in this dump and we have to have headaches from the smell of the spray. Not to mention. The sink is now covered in bug spray and we are to brush our teeth and put our personal things here. I don't think so. I decided to go to the smaller room in the villa but didn't do any good now guess what's in there? Yep another bug! This place is not up to Marriott standards. We stayed in May and June at Harbour lake directly across the street it was great and clean. But free from bugs! I am really worried about carrying bugs home with us. We will not be back to this property nor would I recommend it to any of our family or friends. The only nice thing about this place is the landscaping. Stay away from here and the BUGS! Feel free to contact me,I normally don't write reviews but this has put a damper on our anniversary and I am very upset.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place - Amazing”
Reviews.Author: mainelydmj
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this place that has not already been said. Cypress Harbour by Marriott continues to be one of my favorite places to stay while in Florida. While my kids are adults - the activities for the younger kids are abundant. I did wish there was more the 18-20 year old range. The pool area is lovely. We could see Sea World's fireworks from our balcony every night. Having 2 bedrooms and 2 baths were great. Plus having 3 tvs was great too. Often people debate whether to stay on or off site while visiting Disney - the time to all the parks we visited sure was better than taking Disney transportation. It took us 45 minutes on a Disney bus from Downtown Disney to visit the Boardwalk Hotel. Knowing the Boardwalk is less than 10 mins from DTD, we were shocked at how long it took to get to this hotel. It took us 30 minutes on the bus to return to DTD. Next time will would just take our car. From all other Disney parks, it took us 12-15 minutes to get back to Cypress Harbour once we were in our car. This made taking a mid-afternoon break from the parks very easy to do. There is nothing negative I can say. The front line staff were great too - especially Zak.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: Escalade5
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to Marriott's Cypress Harbour (MCH) in several years and read the reviews for it on TripAdvisor prior to my trip so that I would know exactly what to request. When MCH sent me an email asking for my vacation preferences in advance, I asked for a unit in buildings 51, 52, 63 or 64. It was most important to me to receive an updated unit. Upon arrival with two other adults and kids ages 18, 12 and 9, the front desk acknowledged the preferences I sent them without my having to produce a copy of it and assigned me unit 6312. The accommodations were the most modern I've seen between MCH and its sister property nearby (Marriott's Grande Vista) and had a lakefront view. We had a minor issue with the bathtub drain in the smaller of the two bathrooms, but it was promptly resolved. The master bedroom had amazing high-end fixtures! Also, I was very appreciative that we were placed in a unit on the ground floor as that made transporting luggage and groceries so much easier!! Although I would have liked for them to have cleaned the screened-in patio prior to our checking in, the accommodations overall exceeded my expectations and the property staff were very friendly, always greeting guests with a wave and a smile.

Reviews.Title: “5 out of 5 ******'s AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Funfolks
Reviews.Content: There's a good reason why Marriott's Cypress Harbour consistently receives 5 of 5 stars from guests who vacation there -- This is simply a great place to stay -- with family, friends, kids, adults or grandparents -- and in any combination! A close hop to all attractions, a putt away from championship golf, a few forks away from great restaurants, a credit card away from discount outlets, a briquette away from several outdoor grills, and with so much to do on site, you're just a smile away from pools, fun, waterfalls, new luxurious spa, whirlpools, an island oasis (complete with sauna) and the I ride trolley stop! They even have an active marina with a shuttle boat to ferry you across the lake! This resort is celebrating its 21st anniversary, but you'd never know it. The General Manager, Pam, and her staffs (notables are: Audra, Andrea and Matt) are continually upgrading the accommodations, and environs to keep it fresh and inviting, pleasurable and unique, safe and cozy. The villas are very spacious and feature 2-bedrooms and 2 baths and are completely equipped to assure the most discriminating travelers of every desired amenity. Each villa also has a large, screened in lanai for al fresco enjoyment. Many of the local attractions and their nightly fireworks displays are visible from some units. We enjoy the nature walk and picnicking at one of the gazebos or secluded hide-a-ways. This resort has it all. The only thing you won't find here is disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hnguyen062001
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Orlando, where we stayed at Marriott Cypress Habour. This hotel was nice, especially inside the unit. We stayed in the two-bedroom unit that was very nice with jacuzzi in the master bedroom. The hotel provide a lot of kids' activities and the pools are so cool. The hotel located in a pretty convenient place that was closed to most major theme parks like Disney World, Universal Studio... The only thing that we feel not really interested was that the hotel's outside color. It was gray. To us, it was so depressed color for vacationers. :(. We hope that it would have new color scheme some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite for a fantastic price”
Reviews.Author: Feudalord7
Reviews.Content: If you're going to stay near the attractions, especially SeaWorld, this is a fantastic option for a family. I got a suite with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen, dining area and large living room for less than you'd pay for a normal hotel room. It was clean, spacious and it definitely felt like staying at a resort. (jacuzzi spa in the master bedroom!). I'd recommend Cypress Harbour to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and spacious enough”
Reviews.Author: rew88
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week with our two teenagers this August. I had read mixed reviews here, and was a little worried. So, I called ahead and asked that we get a newly renovated unit. The unit we got in building 56 (ground floor) was new(ish) and clean. The funiture and fittings were all well done, and functioning. They layout of all units at this resort is evidently the same or very similar. Basically, 1 very large master BR with jacuzzi, 1 pretty small second bedroom, and a long living room/dining/kitchen area. Not a great layout or use of space, but certainly functional for a week. What was a little wierd (being picky) is the shower area which was cheap aluminum and plastic construction frequently found in 3 star hotels. Not a big deal, but it seemed out of place in an otherwise nicely appointed place. The only other complaint was the very slow internet, since which made checking in to corporate email now and agaain a real pain (maybe a blessing, maybe a curse).The staff, from the guard at the front gate, to the reception staff, to the housekeeping staff were all very friendly and helpful. Check in and check out were efficient and friendly. The gym was modern with good quality equipment and was well kept and clean. Overall, a very nice place and 4-5 stars is the right rating.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place!”
Reviews.Author: Gwendra1961
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place - from the hot tub in the bedroom to the bug meshed balcony and the whole villa! Absolutely wonderful resort - the facilities are first class, the staff all very friendly and helpful (with perhaps one exception in the shop - a little abrupt and without the smile!). The villa has everything you need, including large washing machine and tumble dryer, dish washer and waste disposal. Can't wait to go back again. Very well situated for the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Our second trip --this place is great”
Reviews.Author: TG2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2009 and returned this year for another week. The accommodations are very nice, our unit was recently renovated -- and now includes 3 TVs. We have been to Orlando 10 times in the last 15 years, staying on and off Disney properties. This location is excellent it is hard to see what anyone could find fault with. Also went to the spa -- nice equipment and great treatment by Jeannette.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay!”
Reviews.Author: LadyTC
Reviews.Content: I agree with the bulk of the positive reviews. I'll add that the exercise instructors for the 9a classes are excellent, the best I've experienced. I participated in 5 classes - aqua aerobics, pilates and kickboxing, and mat yoga and pilates. None had more than 5 participants except when I dragged my family along. I'll reiterate that the location is great, convenient to everything. The staff and facilities are very good. One of our spa tubs did not work and was not fixed in two visits, but no big deal. Bring a nightlight for the master bath so you don't wake up your partner. the units are perfect. I traveled with 10 family members in two units, 2 seniors, 2 small children. The sofa beds are not for anyone but children. The bug screens are full of bugs - ick - but clearly necessary. Internet service is pitifully slow and unacceptable. For folks who want to purchase park tickets or get directions or upload photos, the internet speed was ridiculous, simply inexcusable. I didn't eat or drink resort fare. We shopped and cooked or ate out. Everything, I mean everything, is convenient to this resort. I never caught sight of the alligator in the lake - darn! We encountered two tolls right by the airport totaling $1.75 so skip the pass offered by the rental companies for $24.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - not great but not bad”
Reviews.Author: monaco7
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a two bedroom villa with my teenage daughter, and all in all I'd say it was an ok stay, nothing spectacular but ok. The rooms are spacious but a little dated and tired. Kitchen and large living area, master bedroom with (gimmicky) jaccuzi and the extra room which is quite large. Both have en suite bathrooms, and the beds themselves were very comfortable. Air Con works well (essential in Florida over the summer) and you are never left feeling too humid. The food is not up to much, even though it's a Pizza Hut ours was warm at best and fairly soggy. We were quoted one-and-a-half hours for delivery so went to pick up ourselves. The hotel make little savings here and there which is a bit off-putting. Bedding wasn't changed all week, I reported a stain on daughters bed and they cut it out of the sheet, I kid you not, only one pack of coffee for the coffee maker, asked for more then seen the note saying I had to buy it, however, even if all you use is one cup and a plate housekeeping put the dishwasher on. Save money on dishwashers and give me more coffee!!! On the plus side, wifi is free and kudos to the hotel for that, I get really annoyed at chargeable internet. Oh, parking is free too of course given you park right at the building. Asked for late check out to be told I could stay 'till 11:00 instead of 10:00, and had to get boarding passes printed....both these interactions with the staff weren't handled brilliantly, but then I guess there is little 'excellent' about this hotel, it is fairly average, and to be fair, we only paid an average price. Location is great for the Universal end of town and is only 15 minutes from Disney. Be aware, everything at the resort is FAR as it is a large resort, there is very little within walking distance so don't choose this hotel if you don't have a car. All in all I'd rate this as a great hotel for those with large families who can take advantage of the ample bedding, but it is a little dark and old fashioned, I stayed at the Hilton Parc Soleil last year and rate that considerably higher, their property is newer, better pool, food & restaurant is a lot better and the service is excellent - and we paid a very average price to stay there last time, so if you can get a 2 bed at the Hilton, take it!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: beachfam94
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at Cypress Harbour. The room was spacious, with two bathrooms. There are three pools on the property, plus small playgrounds dotted through out. Watch the activities for each day. We were able to get in on a family paddle boat race, which is free to participants. Lots of fun and it lasted about 5 minutes. They also have a game room where you can play video games (50 cents -$1 each), and board games. You can also check out the board games over night for your room. There is also a Pizza Hut on the grounds with actual Pizza Hut prices. Not inflated vacation prices. Very nice for a day/night in. Overall the staff was very nice and easy to find. There are grills available, should you want one. They have one by every building, and by the pool. The resort is within easy access to the interstate for visiting the theme parks. We really did enjoy ourselves and would go back, if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for early checkout!”
Reviews.Author: noclue99
Reviews.Content: This is a nice resort, but expect to be treated like any other time share person there, even if you are paying twice their nightly rate. Check out is at 10:00 a.m. and was non-negotiable, and not very nice at the front desk about it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It, and have re-booked for next year.”
Reviews.Author: Canadiangirl2008
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and Grand Accommodations, had everything in the rooms you could possibly need. We had a 2 bedroom unit with our own laundry facilities, full kitchen and screened in patio. Golf course on the grounds, although we didn't use it. There was: A Nature walking trail, fishing, mini golf, paddle boats, mini race car track for the kids, volley ball, arcade, basketball, arts and crafts room, library, 6 seater bike rentals, 3 playgrounds for the kids, bbq pits & propane bbqs at each building. Grounds are well groomed, with lots of adult entertainment and activities for the kids. We had a brand new renovated building, others were being done while we were there. 3 pools, 8+ hot tubs, water boat shuttle across the resort, affordable prices in the convenience store and take out food area. A Grocery store is near by, and its close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: JoeJoeOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: Marriott Resorts never fail to please! This one is very comfortable, lots of amenities, and a fun place for all ages. Yes, even teenagers. The resort is built around a large lake, with 2 big pool areas, game room, tennis courts, golf course, basketball court, store and fast food place on-site. It even has a Nature Preserve on one corner of the lake. Plus the whole property is surround by forest. It's practically secluded from all the area's attractions. It's close to everything too. Sea World is only 1 mile away! Universal is about 4 miles away, and Disney World is about 8 miles away. The only down side is the 2nd bedroom: it will sleep 2 comfortably, but the fold out sofa will make 4 uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort with few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: dlee_salem
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with family at this resort. We had two two-bedroom villas on the first level of building 53. The villas were OK but I found that the second bedroom was far too small to make use of the sleep sofa in there. This room is far too small to sleep 4 but a 3rd person can sleep on the sofa without pulling it out. (Pulled out, you would have about 1 foot between the bed and sofabed. These furnishings are at an angle so anyone with less agility than a young one may have trouble. We did find 2 "unwanted" guests (Roaches) in the villa. I reported this to the front desk and someone did come down to spray. The downfall was that he used you standard can of Raid so the odor wasn't the most pleasant. I was quite disturbed with this but in reality, I don't think this was an issue of cleanliness but more of being on the 1st level / end unit of an area that is prone to these. Definately recommend a higher level villa - 1st floors are generally a no-no in Florida. The resort was very crowded (April Vacation) so pool service was a bit of a challenge. The grounds were very well maintained and the staff was very curteous and friendly. They also had "Easter Bunny" services which I found quite fun for the kids. The location is very convenient to Seaworld, Universal, International Drive, Disney. One thing that really impressed me with this resort was that there is apparently a small group of ferrel cats on the premesis. The staff at this resort takes care of them and feed them at night. They seems to be genuinely concerned with the well being of these cats (Very young cats, I may add). I didn't see them at all during the day and when I saw a few of them at night, they pretty much stay a distance away but were quite adorable and timid. To think that the resort staff also cares about the well being of these animals was quite impressive. If I hadn't been talking to someone about my pets, I probably would never of known they were even there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Donnalee357
Reviews.Content: Came down to do the Disney thing - what a great location - no more than 15 min on the road to any of the major parks. Beautiful grounds - great pools - boating right on the premises. Definitely would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Outstanding We Loved It and We'll Be Back''''''''''”
Reviews.Author: bigfella7Bhm
Reviews.Content: Staff couldn't been freindlier ,profressional,and people persons,and very courtous . Everything from the entrance onto the property into going inside the extra large spacios room was mouth opening in awe. The pools,entertainment center were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Resort”
Reviews.Author: Spedteach1991
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a visit to Cypress Harbour. We stayed in Villa #65 and it was a perfect choice. You are very close to the smaller Island Pool, but also within easy walking distance of the Main pool and Boathouse. The kids loved renting boats, playing in the sports areas, and many of the entertainment events. You are close to everything, but don't feel like you are right on top of the crowds and craziness outside of the resort. We also liked our villa location, as we had a high floor villa, with a great view of the lake...especially during one of Florida's great thunder and lightning storms. It should be noted that some of the villas are already renovated. Villa #65 has not been, as of yet, but it did not effect our experience.

Reviews.Title: “FOURTH VISIT AND STILL LOVE THE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: doonhamer
Reviews.Content: 2011 was out fourth visit and all I can say is that this place ticks all the boxes. Very friendly staff, well kept property and you fell that you are in a differnt world away from the hustle and bustle. We stayed in a refurbisehd apartment this year. We can find little to fault - maybe the Gally grill and shop is a little expensive but it is on site and there is a supermarket nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation resort”
Reviews.Author: wichitajayhawkfan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation at this resort and loved it. We were located in building 63 close to a playground and not far from the Island Pool and Activities center which was great for our 7 and 5 year old kids. The staff members at the Activities center were terrific. We did several of the activities and really enjoyed our time at the resort. We loved the pool!! We ate at the Marketplace and Pizza Hut and thought the food was good. We even won a raffle for free scuba diving lessons, free picture package and drinks so could not be more satisfied with our stay. The free pictures were an extra bonus to help us remember our great vacation at Cypress Harbour. The location was great as it is right next to Sea World where we spent some time. We could even see the nightly fireworks from our building. It is also easy access to and from the airport. We ate most of our breakfast and lunches in our room so it was nice having the kitchen. And the laundry room was great to have so that we could wash thiings and not pack as many clothes to lessen the baggage costs from the airlines. We did eat out at Pointe Orlando one night and chose Taverna Opa from the Marriott's bartnender's suggestions. It was fun. It was very loud and lively. Our kids loved the belly dancer and dancing on the tables and throwing napkins. Overall a great trip and would gladly go back and stay on a future vacation.

Reviews.Title: “"Can't give it enough praise"”
Reviews.Author: Titusaduxus
Reviews.Content: just love this place its our home from home....Tried other Marriott properties but always come back home to Cypress H. Villas always clean and tidy and they keep renewing the decor and furniture to a very high standard. Pools clean and kept immaculate with a good mix of quiet " down" time as well as games and entertainment for the whole family. We love to play tennis and table tennis so it is a little disappointing that there is now only 1 tennis court and the table tennis tables are not maintained that well.....Oh well C'est la vie...if thats all we can find to complain about that's not too bad. Plan to return again and again if God spares us!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: vegas005
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Grand Vista last year and was extremely disappointed with the staff and conditions of the property. This property, the Marriott Cypress Harbour is well managed, clean and the rooms are fantastic. Had a two bedroom with a huge master, super full size kitchen and plasma TV’s throughout the rooms. The pools were clean, the children areas clean and the whole property was well maintained. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Siciliangal
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Marriott Cypress Harbour Resort as part of an exchange with our Hyatt timeshare. We had a two bedroom condo and there were six of us. I have Hyatt timeshare standards, but i was pleasantly surprised. The condo was clean and our unit was very convenient to getting around the property. Inside, we found really everything one would need, particularly if you have stayed in condos before. Enough bedding and towels. The master bedroom was very large, however, the big jacuzzi tub was really a waste of space and the only negative about this unit was that the master bath is really part of the master bedroom which makes it difficult for one to sleep in if the other partner is getting showered and dressed. Aside from this, we found the beds comfortable in all rooms. In the second bedroom, there was a queen bed as well as a small sleeper sofa. When the sleeper sofa was opened, you really could not get to the dresser, but that really was not a big deal for us. There was a screened in porch with table and chairs and it was nice to sit outside and watch our kids play on the volleyball court. Two pools, both of which were great in the heat. We were also able to take advantage of the high speed internet in the room, which my kids loved for their ITOUCHs and me for my computer. I chose not to have maid service for the additional charge,but instead, washed a load of clothes and towels during the trip. Worked out fine. This property is very convenient to Disney and Universal. About a fifteen minute drive to both.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Orlando before our Disney Dream cruise and had the pleasure of staying at Marriott’s Cypress Harbour. We have nothing but praise to say about the place and we are very happy with the accommodations. The 2 bedroom unit (7131) that we stayed in was very comfortable and spacious. The kitchen was well appointed with everything needed for our party and we loved the full size washer and dryer in the unit. There was a flat screen tv in the living room as well as other televisions in each bedroom. The unit was very clean, modern and well designed. We are extremely sensitive to noise and are light sleepers and I can say that our unit with families above us was amazingly quiet. We were on the 3rd floor in an end unit, so natural lighting and windows were abundant. The pool and recreation facilities were very nice as well. Everything worked well including internet services. The only reason why we’re not giving this place a 5 star instead of 4 is that daily room service and cleaning was not available. It was only about a 10 minute drive to Disney and Harry Potter World and there was plenty of parking. It’s unlikely that we will go to Orlando again, but we recommend this place for those that do

Reviews.Title: “Resort focus in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: hugo0001
Reviews.Content: I am staying in a villa with 2 bedrooms that claim to accomodate up to eight people, we are 4 adults And 2 kids and that is the max, several pools, some little boat, bike, etc rentals. Location is convenient to parks, the rooms are updated with a large flat screen in the living room

Reviews.Title: “Restored sanity to orlando”
Reviews.Author: famlyplanner
Reviews.Content: I swore I'd never return to Orlando after 3 prior stays over the past 15 years . . . but then they built the Wizarding World of Harry Potter and we had to make one more journey back to the land of crowds and crazy. But . . . if I were promised that I could stay at Marriott's Cypress Harbour, I could handle the hustle and bustle of the town again. It's an oasis of pleasantness with an accommodating staff that treats you like a 5 star guest. It's conveniently located, just minutes from Sea World and 10 minutes from Universal Theme park. The front desk was very helpful, allowing us to check in early and, given their limitations, providing a way for us to use the resort during the day due to a late night flight out of town, at no extra charge. If you have older kids, I'd recommend requesting buildings 64 or 65, which are right by the favorite pool used by our gang of teens. Given that we were with a bunch of friends, we were in 3 different rooms, and other than one little palmetto bug, I didn't see any pests that would annoy or bother anyone. Bedding is fine - they provide foam pillows upon request if the down pillows are too large or uncomfortable. The kitchens are updated with granite (or granite-like) counters and a full stock of dishes and pans to allow meal preparation. There is room for a family of 6 if they all get along (!), though a family of 3, 4 or 5 would be more comfortable. The pentagon-shaped screened porches are a nice touch, making it a nice place to have your morning muffin and coffee. We used the pontoon boat to head over the lake to the grill and pizza restaurants, where there was a hearty game of bingo and pool volleyball for the more social playful types. This is a wonderful resort. I highly recommend it for all types of visitors - couples, families, or older folk.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time and going back again soon”
Reviews.Author: Sabersmom
Reviews.Content: I'm a little behind with this review - as we stayed here in October 2010.. My husband and I stayed in Building 63 (lake view) for the 3rd time and everything was perfect as always. The front desk staff are always pleasant and the grounds are spotless. The entertainment around the pool area (by the lobby) is always a nice treat. We are heading back this October for another week. This is also a great place for families with the 2 bedroom units - plenty of space, having the full kitchen is great to have meals 'in-house'.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoneJackers
Reviews.Content: We liked the resort grounds very much. It was well landscaped and the resort itself is very nice. The rooms were spacious and the washer/dryer in the room is a nice addition. The bed was not very comfy however and the pillows that they provide will absolutely kill your neck. The only other problem that we encountered was that there were no trash cans close to the 3rd floor so, you had to lug your trash down three flights of stairs each time to dispose of it. The employees were nice and they seemed to always wave hello to you and they were always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ziggytraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa overlooking the lake. It has a large master bedroom with a round jacuzzi in it. The second bedroom was small with a queen size bed and a sofabed (no room to move if you open it up). The kitchen was fully equipped and there is also a full size washer and dryer. We had a great view of the lake from the screened balcony. The only thing we didn't like were the lake midges -- hundreds of little flies stuck on the screen which attracted lots of spiders. There are lots of activities on site (boating, basketball, miniature golf, shuffleboard, quadricycling, spa, golf) if you don't want to spend a lot of money at the theme parks. If you have time and want discount tickets to Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure ($85 per person for a 7-day park hopper ticket), you'll have to attend a 3 to 4 hour (not 90 minute) presentation for the Marriott Vacation Club. The discount tickets to Disney were not much of a discount, but again, you'll have to attend the presentation for the discount. Overall, this is a very nice place to stay and the staff is really friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, definately will come back”
Reviews.Author: StephsFavs
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to bring the family. They have plenty of on-site activities and it felt like we were on a private island.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: krazykake
Reviews.Content: The property is very convenient to all of the parks. It is very clean and the upkeep of the property is great.

Reviews.Title: “Quality stay”
Reviews.Author: JLouisNy
Reviews.Content: Great value with marriot quality. I was not disappointed . Cypress harbor met all my expectations for my first time visit. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Weekend at Cypress Harbour”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMac
Reviews.Content: We just spent Memorial weekend at Cypress Harbour with a large group of friends and family ranging in ages from 7 to 47. I've got to tell you that every person (group of 15) had a GREAT time! There was plenty of activities to keep the kids busy: activity center, fun boats, family bikes, pool parties, mini golf, playgrounds, the maze race track...we did it all! The staff was always friendly and helpful and went out of their way to ensure a good time for all of us. The villas were very clean and though it initially seemed like a very far distance from our villa (67) to the pools...once we actually walked it and found the bridge...we could literally make it to the other side of the resort in 2-5 minutes. The kids had a GREAT time on the water taxi that would take you from the activity center to the main pool area. I did the aqua bootcamp one morning and wished they would have had it every day I was there, it was AWESOME! The only complaint we heard from anyone was when it was time to pack up and leave...everyone complained that we didn't stay long enough. We had a great time and can't wait to go back...we're already planning another return trip. We've stayed at many resorts in Orlando, and this is by far our favorite becuase it's way less crowded and the prices seem way more reasonable and the amount of activities (including a lot of free activities for the kids) were perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Buggin' Out!”
Reviews.Author: ShaykeINTL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the CYPRESS HARBOUR and I must say that the place was pleasing for the most part. We were a party of 5 staying in a 2-bd suite with a nice view of the lake. Honestly, the place would have been tops in my book IF IT WASN'T FOR THE COCKROACHES (or the gentler name, Palmetto Bug)!!! Oh yeah. They were ALL OVER OUR SUITE. In the laundry room, the foyer, both bedrooms, under living room chairs....even climbing up walls. The women in our group were freaking out everytime we came back to our suite or switched on a light in the middle of the night. And these things were BIG. Not mutant big but large enough to be compared to your BIG TOE! Honestly, I stomped (hope I don't offend anyone) a couple myself but my Dad killed about 5 or so. The manager (J. Munas) told me that they are common in the area but that is horsecrap in my opinion. No guest should have to deal with insect infestation like this for a week. THEY EVEN SENT A GUY TO COME "spray" THE ROOM. We left for the day and came back to two waiting for us RIGHT INSIDE THE ROOM!!! I paid for 5 guests in my suite....not 11! I shook out all my clothes before I left because I had better not have brought one of these COCKROACHES back home with me. On a positive note, the manager said that I would be contacted about the issue shortly. I'll post what they respond to my complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place would go back in the blink of an eye!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: christina41
Reviews.Content: Went to Cypress Harbour with friends. The resort was really lovely and so well maintained!! There were allways staff around cleaning and gardening. Our villa was fabulous and had everything we could think of. It was spotless and in lovely condition. The master bedroom was amazing with a kingsize bed and double whirlpool bath!!!! The grounds were well kept and the pools were lovely too, they had a adult only pool and we spent a lot of time there as we had no children with us. The location was great we were only 10 mins by car from International Drive and ate there every night, so much choice and soooo cheap. On the whole had a great time and were allreadyy booking to go back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property!!!”
Reviews.Author: donhol27
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an eight night stay at Cypress Harbour and we LOVED it! My husband and I stayed in the 2 bedroom villa with our two children ages 4 and 2. The villa was very spacious with a large living room/dining area, a smaller bedroom in the front with a queen bed and a pull out sofa and a bath with tub. There was a door that could close off the bedroom and bath making it it's own mini suite. The master had a king bed, whirlpool tub, double vanity and shower. There was also a laundry room w/ full size washer and dryer and there was a screened balcony. The beds were super comfy! We were in building #64 and the location could not have been better. It was right between the activity center and the bridge to the island pool. The full kitchen is great for preparing meals for the family. Everything you need is right there. A Publix grocery store is 5 minutes away, so stocking up is a breeze. The resort has a Pizza Hut express on site, which is nice for a quick snack when you are pool side and there was a restaurant called the Galley Grill that was very good as well. My husband loved the buffalo wings and ordered them quite a few times. The Marketplace store was great in the mornings for Starbucks coffee and Krispy Kreme donuts. They also sold all types of snacks, pool toys etc. The poolside bar was great as were the bartenders. The pools were very clean. There were three separate pool areas, the island pool, the clubhouse pool and the bayside pool. We never used the bayside pool, but it looked nice when we walked past. We spent our time at the other two pools and had a great time doing so. Our kids had a blast meeting other kids and playing in the pool. The grounds of the resort were so beautiful. I spent a lot of time walking around and exploring. It is situated on 48 acres and they are well cared for and manicured. There is an actual nature preserve on the property as well as an abundance of wildlife. We saw many different types of birds, lizards, and even spotted one of the resident gators who make the lake home. We did go on a nature tour given by the resort. Our guide, Justin, was very knowledgeable. The resort offers lots of activities to take part in. I took my 2 year old to toddler time, my husband and son took part in the fishing derby and we went to see the Royal Polynesian Show. These are only a few of the things they offer. You get an activity schedule when you check in, so you can plan what you want to do. Campfire smores was fun too!! The resort is located less than 5 minutes from Seaworld and less than 15 from Universal.. There is a trolley stop right in front of the resort, outside the main gate. We have stayed at the Harbour Lake resort across the street twice before, and decided to mix it up and stay at this property and were so glad we did!! We will be back next year for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Orlando Resort For Families”
Reviews.Author: jarakus
Reviews.Content: Cypress Harbor is typical wonderful Marriott timeshare units around the typical Florida lake setting....not as great as Grande Vista (about 1 mile away), but still a great timeshare resort. Clean pools, activities, spacious grounds between buildings, scenic lake with boats and a bridge across it, gorgeous, huge rooms, and a constant hum from all the people working on the grounds and buildings. Buildings are not new anymore (the resort must be pushing 20 by now), but the constant updating and renovating make it seem new. The only shortcomings are: no onsite restaurants except pizza and a quickie grill, no food service at all at the secondary pool, no restaurants in the immediate area (you have to drive 2 miles), and a very tranquil nightime scene. PERFECT for a family day tripping to the theme parks. Note: second bedroom is NOT 2 beds.....a queen and a pullout couch, and it's pretty small when the couch is pulled out. Safe, secure grounds you and your kids can wander about. Magnificent new fitness center. Avoid the units farthest from the lake...you will feel too remote. There is putt putt golf, tennis, basketball, paddle boats, arcade, teen center, spa, sauna, bicycles and surreys, and lots of other activites. The I-drive trolley stops directly in front of the resort, and can get you to Sea World in 3 minutes, and all the other shopping and restaurants on International drive in a longer ride. A great alternative to the standard hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect resort for families”
Reviews.Author: cincytraveler123
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Cypress Harbour. We brought our two kids (2 and 4) and my wife's parents. The villa has a two bedrooms, a full kitchen, living room, dining area, washer/dryer, and screened-in balcony with a table and chairs. It's huge. Everything was very clean and in good shape. The resort has 3 swimming pools, sport courts, boat rentals, mini golf, playground equipment, and a bunch of other stuff for the kids. If you're traveling with kids this is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: joyhiggs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week before Easter 2011. The villas are all two bedroom, two baths with full kitchens, living rooms and porches. The porch was screened in which was wonderful for keeping bugs out and my kids toys in! The grounds are well cared for and mature, there is plenty of shade. There were lots of playgrounds and three nice pools. We stayed in building 63, which has been recently renovated. It was beautiful. This building is also near the activity center and a playground so it was perfect for our family. We rented a duck shaped paddle boat (which our 3 year old loooved) and we also rented a surrey style bike that fit both parents and 2 tots- lots of fun! It was about a 15 or 20 minute drive to Disney which was fine for us, we only went one day anyway. The location is nice and quiet, but still convenient. We shopped at the nearby publix and CVS and ate most of our meals in, which saved us a lot of money and headaches (restaurants with a 2 and 3 year old are not fun). There is Pizza Hut on the grounds and we did order pizza one night which was nice. We took advantage of the resort photography and had some nice outdoor pictures taken of the children and us.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Los Gatos, CA - Northern California - Bay Area
Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Big, Lots of Activites, Good Swimming Pools”
Reviews.Author: afgam
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place! This place has so many activites and things to do. So, if you need a break from the amusement parks, it is a great way to go. One key thing to remember is check-in is at 4 p.m. and check-out is at 10 a.m. Parking is so convenient and free. There is enough parking space in front of every four-story villa. We had the two bed-room villa with a full kitchen. The master bedroom was absolutely wonderful with a big jacuzzi tub. There's a two sink wash area. Lots of storage space. Lots of windows. Outdoor patio which is screened off and lights. You can have dinner out there. The living room is huge. Full dining room set. Breakfast table over the kitchen area. Full utensils, kitchen ware, dishes, cups, mugs, dishwasher, stove, oven, fridge, freezer. There's also a full washer and dryer. Remember to buy or bring detergent and fabric softener. The second bedroom has a queen bed and sofa couch. All the rooms had flat-screen tvs. What a treat! Quiet and never heard our neighbors. We shopped at the Target down the street from Gatorland. We also went to Whole Foods which is on Turkey Lake Road. We purchased our tickets from the Orlando AAA office for Disneyworld, Gatorland, and Universal Studio's Island of Adventures. This cuts down the cost for eating out and waiting in line for tickets. The pools were amazing. Ideal for families. The children could be seen at the activities center where they have giant chess pieces, regular chess, checkers, pinball machines, arcade games, hoops, bicycles (bring your own helmets), quadcycles, tandem cycles, miniature golf, playground, karaoke, daycare, etc. There's a gas BBQ pit which we used for dinner one night. Safe deposit box. We would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: chrisman48
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, I began to relax. The ambience makes you feel like you are in a tropical paradise. It is just so conducive to being at peace, to thinking, to just being. The staff is fantastic. I can't say enough superlatives about this exceptional place

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful experience - why we love it here.”
Reviews.Author: leowinnipeg
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Cypress Harbour, and we still loved our time there. This time we got an excellent deal by booking through redweek.com rather than the Marriott directly - highly recommend this process. Hopefully the following comments will help you decide whether you want to choose this resort. We have been to Orlando 10 times and have seen many of the properties that are available there - we have also stayed at a variety of hotels ranging from a La Quinta level to Westin and JW Marriott level properties. What we love about this resort over other Orlando timeshare resort options: 1. Location, location, location - what we love about the location is not it's proximity to anything in particular (although it is very close to the outlet mall, sea world and several nice restaurants), but rather how the property is situated in such a secluded and quiet location - it is nowhere near any busy roads or interstates as are MANY of the other vacation club properties - it is surrounded by other resorts or golf course. We find this seclusion very relaxing especially in such a busy place like Orlando. We love not being able to see a highway or road from anywhere on the property. 2. Landscaping and villa views - we also love the lush mature landscaping - many many palm trees, immaculately cared for grounds. Also, very important to us is that there are NO units that overlook a parking lot, road or worse a highway. All units have a view of the golf course or lake. We have always requested a villa on the main lake and have always received what we requested. Maps of the property are available online and I encourage you to look at one and send in a building request prior to your visit. Some of the buildings are far away from the pools - I am happy we have not been in any of those. We were in building 64 and we loved the location. What may be a problem for you: 1. The layout of the villa - the second bedroom is VERY small - only one queen size bed and a sofa bed - but it is so cramped that you would not be able to walk around in the room if the sofa bed were open - our kids (boy and girl teenager) cannot sleep in the same bed so our now 17 year old 6 foot son had to sleep on the sofa bed in the living room - he found the bed very uncomfortable this time - last time he like it but of course he was much smaller then - (2 years ago). So this may be a problem for you if your situation is similar. Unfortunately we likely would not be able to stay here again because of this. 2. Travel to Disney world - we do not visit Disney world while we are staying at this resort - we stay on Disney property - however if you are visiting these parks you may find the traffic and travel time consuming depending on what time of year you are visiting. But, it is no farther than many of the time share resorts in this area. 3. The need for a rental car - or the use of a taxi - there is no way to get to restaurants, grocery stores, shopping or them parks without the use of either a taxi or rental car - we always get a rental car - but if you planned carefully - a few taxi rides to select destinations may be cheaper. 4. No on site restaurant - we have a rental car so it doesn't matter to us- but it would be nice to be able to eat at the resort once or twice - the only options are "fast food" items or pizza hut. This is not enough of an issue to prevent us from staying here. Hope this helps you decide. A few other miscellaneous info: 1. There is a new gym - it is beautiful and very well equipped - we used it everyday - unfortunately they removed one of the tennis courts to build the gym so if you are really into tennis you may want to stay elsewhere - there is only one court left and it is well used. 2. There is also a brand new spa - it was not open yet when we were there but is open now - maybe that's important to you. 3. We purchased our park passes from Maple Leaf Tickets (on line or in Kissimmee) - we saved almost $100 on Disney passes and $50 on Universal tickets over Marriott or Disney prices. 4. There is a brand new Super Walmart on Turkey Lake Road - very easy access from resort - less than a 10 minute drive. 5. We ordered pizza from Flipper's Pizza - yummy and also less than a 10 minute drive. Happy vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Marroitt does it again !”
Reviews.Author: skinnyskier
Reviews.Content: We stayed a wonderul week here at cypress Harbour. Everything was great. We stayed in building 64. The unit was perfect. we are vacation club owners but this was our first visit to CH and it lives up to the vacation club tradition of excellence !!! get to this resort !

Reviews.Title: “Roomy apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: slpond
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip. The location is great if you are going to sea world. There is a Publix and Walmart nearby. Check in was quick and easy and we were given a room in a quiet building on the golf course. Our two bedroom suite was very nice and in good condition. Roomy living room and kitchen, loved the washer/dryer. The beds were the comfortable marriott beds I have come to expect. We were only there for one night but will return.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: masuret_baloun
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip back to Cypress Harbour and we were once again pleased with the entire experience. The hotel staff are great and included many of the same faces as last year - - always a good sign. The units are very large, clean and nicely decorated which is great for our group of six. The kitchen is equiped with everything you could possibly need in terms of applicances, pot, dishes and utensils. There are also gas BBQ grills outside every building that we made very good use of. The cleaning staff is very thourogh and willing to work around your schedule. Towels (for kitchen, bath and pool) are readily available and never is short supply. The resort runs activities for all ages all day. The resort is very safe and secure which is nice for our 9 and 10 year olds. The food at the restaurant is so-so. They have added a pontoon boat to ferry folks beck and forth from activities center and main pool. It runs every 5 minutes! The thing I like best about this resort is the vast space and numerous places to sit and take in a gorgeous view. Even if the hotel is crowded there is plenty of open space to enjoy. The price has been going up streadily, but they have a very good overall 'product'.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: mntravelr
Reviews.Content: We are long-time Marriott resorters and own a Marriott timeshare as well. We've stayed in many resorts over the years and we would call the Cypress Harbour average. Our biggest complaint is that it is VERY spread out. It felt like our family was separated the entire time, and we found ourselves constantly on cells phones and texting to figure out where everyone was at any given time. It also meant a lot of walking. We were in building 70 so nothing was close by. Walking, walking and more walking. Not a big deal normally, but if you've been to resorts where things are more centralized and somewhat consolidated, it's just far more convenient. It also didn't help that we had asked for a room near the pools and were told it was highly likely we would get it, but then we didn't. One thing we found irritating as well was the amount of nickel and diming at this resort. Everything has a fee. You want to ride a bike around the grounds? $10 You want to go fishing in the lake? $$ You want to play poolside bingo? $5 per card. And the list goes on. I guess that's the Orlando model, but when you are paying the kind of money you do at the Cypress Harbour, it seems reasonable to expect that the kids could play bingo by the pool without having to bring the wallet. Drinks at the pool area bar are also very expensive. Other things that I would put under the category of "corner cutters" and minor irritants included the undersized basketball courts with bald, lop-sided balls, sand all over the greens on the mini-golf course, undersized towels that don't cover even half of your lounge chair by the pool, completely absent housekeeping, staff golf carts taking up all the best parking spots in front of the buildings, rock hard beds, very small second bedroom, and horribly uncomfortable pull-out beds for the kids. If you are in Orlando for the parks and are looking for a convenient location with decent amenities, Cypress Harbour may be ok for you. If you've been there done that with the parks and are just looking for a nice resort to spend time with the family, you could probably do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “probably won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: shawnla
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this resort. Our first time (2009) was great. On this visit, I noticed things had gone downhill. We were in the exact same building as our first visit (6000 - Bahia Honda), over looking the volleyball court and small pool. Nice location. Housekeeping was very poor. I had to actually pull sheets / pillowcases off the bed in order to get the maid to change them out occasionally. Some of them were obviously dirty and needed to be changed. Vacuuming didn't occur the entire week, we were dodging food on the floor the whole time. Toilet in master bath ran constantly; windows in master bedroom didn't have hand cranks on them so couldn't be shut properly. The room itself is nice and large, with washer, dryer, refirgerator, etc.... Probably would look for somewhere else to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Even a Nature Trail”
Reviews.Author: swan0299
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at a Marriott Vacation Club property. This resort's second bedroom was much smaller than the one we had at Grande Vista. And, the beds are firm; not the plush Marriott beds we expect. Other than that, the room was excellent: clean, large, nice view. Our biggest surprise was the nature preserve. It's very small, but a neat place to explore the outdoors away from the parks. We enjoyed looking for the alligators. We never did find one, but hope to look again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Resort”
Reviews.Author: Islandfamily
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Cypress Harbour, having stayed there about 6 years ago. I cannot say enough good about this place. I am very picky about accommodations and this exceeded my expectations. I had asked while booking with my travel agent for a recently renovated room and was disappointed when I called the Cypress Harbour on the morning of our check-in to learn that this request had not been passed on to them. Despite this, the resort was able to accommodate us in a suite which had been renovated a few weeks prior !! It was amazing.....the carpet had barely been walked on. The only thing I would have changed was the location...our last visit we overlooked the central area which was beautiful at night. This time we overlooked a tie off on the golf course and a small stream. However, I was not prepared to give up the immaculate suite !! The service was excellent....we did not see one staff person who was not super friendly. We had pizza from the on site pizza hut one evening and found it very inexpensive and good. I would return in a heart beat !!

Reviews.Title: “Central park location, great amenities, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: DGStravels
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location if you plan on going to both Disney and Universal or if you are only going to one of them. It's about a 15 minute drive to Universal. Great shopping center right around the corner with a Publix and great Pizza place. I'd advise getting their phone number before you leave for the park and then call in an order when you get in your call at the park. It will be ready when you arrive and hot when you get back to the Resort. We did not use any of the amenities this time, but did the last time we were there. The pools are nice as are the sports facilities. Loved the huge jacuzzi tub in the Master.

Reviews.Title: “Better then a Disney Resort!”
Reviews.Author: netflyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa for 2 nights and also stayed 2 nights at a Disney property. For the money we spent for a 2 bedroom condo at Disney we could of stayed another 2 nights at the Marriott. This Marriott is just wonderful! The rooms are very spacious, I like the fact that one bedroom is when you walk in and the other is off of the family room. We stayed by the island pool which we just loved and yet we could still walk across the walkway to the main pool. If you have little ones, which we didn't, this is a great place. Plenty of activites for them plus they have bike rentals, boat rentals, basketball courts, shuffle board, putt putt, and a remote control car race track and plenty of playgrounds. Some of the paddle boats are like swans, ducks and flamingos. There are grills, swings for the grown ups around the lake and some hammocks. They have a great little general store, a pizza hut and a cafe type grille. The grounds are beautiful, they even have a small soccer field. In the evening we would always take a walk to the store for some Starbucks, ice cream and at the end of the day you can pick up some Krispy Kreme doughnuts buy one get one free for breakfast the following morning or with your coffee on the walk back! We just wished we had more time here. Disney is not far and you can take the boat over to Disney Village!

Reviews.Title: “Great space and location!”
Reviews.Author: stich45
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on numerous trips to the Orlando area. The villas are large and allow us to each have our own space during vacation. We love breakfast on the screened in balcony and sometimes an evening cocktail to unwind. I've stayed on Disney property and this is so much nicer and affords a break from the crazy park mentality. Also, the kitchen allows you to have breakfast more economically and without rushing off in the morning. The rooms are very quiet - seldom have I heard my neighbors unless on the balcony. The pools are terrific and there are always plenty of lounge chairs available. The staff is very friendly and helpful with great tips on beating the crowds. Tons of activities to please any age.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious villas in great condition, great grounds, staff and facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Blindref
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in March 2011 w/spouse, 17 & 20 yr-olds. Wanted plenty of room so we weren't on top of each other. Booked 2 Bdrm Suite. .This provided that and more.Could have slept 7-8 easily, with the quality pullout sofas. Real clean. Full kitchen w/cookware and utensils. Nice Super Walmart nearby for groceries if desired. Nice quick ride to Disney World & Universal. Views of the water were fabulous right off screened patio. Golfing, boating, activities. Can't say enough about how pleased we were. Used the AAA rates. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stacdew
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our stay. The condo was really spacious and comfortable. Loved being in a condo with a kitchen, w and d, and plenty of sleeping space. The cleaning service was great. The location was good for getting to the various parks. There is also a lot to do on the property. We were tremendously pleased with our stay and we would definitely stay there again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “An Incredible resort where you know your children are safe and having fun!”
Reviews.Author: JulieC19
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort many times over the years and are never dissapointed. They have an incredible activities center great for kids of all ages. The staff is great, very friendly and make your kids feel very welcome. The pools are always fabulous and clean; as are the villas. We have encountered some minor problems over the years and they have always been taken care of very quickly. Close and convenient to all major attractions without staying "on attraction property". Villas are extremely spacious and private. 2 families can all stay together and feel they have private areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: sararoyal
Reviews.Content: We have been very impressed with Marriott Vacation Club properties. Having 3 kids under the age of 5, we will only now go to hotels/properties where we can have 2 bedrooms and a kitchen. We stayed at Harbour Lake last year and they were both nice. The biggest differences were the pools (basic pools at Cypress while there was a pirate themed pool at Harbour lake). Harbour Lake seemed more like a place for little kids, but my kids still enjoyed the pool at Cypress Harbour. The major difference in the rooms was that the 2nd bedroom at Cypress had a pull out couch and one bed, while the 2nd bedroom at Harbour Lake had 2 actual beds. My 4 yo didn't mind the pull out couch, but it made it a bit more cramped (had to put it up to access the dresser). Granite counter tops were also found at Cypress Harbour, but other than that, I didn't see much difference in the overall quality of the room. As many have said, the location is great to access theme parks and restaurants. The size of the unit is wonderful (makes it ok to hang out in the room when you have 6 people staying). Love having a kitchen and laundry facilities. We listed to the MVCI pitch to get a cheaper deal, and while we were tempted, opted not to sign up. We will stay at MVCI places in the future, however.

Reviews.Title: “Homey space away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: GermanGemini
Reviews.Content: Marriott Cypress Harbour lives up to the Marriott quality for their vacation club properties - large rooms, multiple pools, beautiful landscaping, daily activities, and amenities like in-room laundry, full kitchen, and a spacious workout room. (In fact, the new workout room looks great! It wasn't quite open yet.) The resort is pricey - but all rooms are two-bedroom suites with lots of space. The master bedroom includes a 2-person jacuzzi which was treat after long days in the Disney parks on your feet. (And there was plenty of hot water!) There is also a screened-in porch with a table big enough for 4 (or even 6) where we had several of our meals as it overlooked the pond and had a nice breeze. There's a nice TV in every room, the wi-fi was free and fast. It was silly to have to pay to print out our boarding passes in the "business center", which is just 2 computers and a printer. Everything was very clean and the staff was friendly. We didn't get much interaction with the staff, but when we couldn't attend the vacation club presentation there wasn't any hassle at all about it and they were still very helpful. We bought our Disney tickets there at the concierge desk and got recent maps and up to date calendars for the shows. The location to the parks is very convenient. Your only about a mile or so off of I-4 that takes you right to the parks. You're only about 25 minutes from the airport. I loved that we could stay with our 2 children - age 21 and 16 - everyone have their own sleeping area, and still have lots of space. The pull-out couch is not nearly as comfortable as the beds, though! The laundry machines are full size in the rooms which was great and we saved lots by cooking meals in the room. The kitchen was fully stocked with all needed utensils. There's a Pizza Hut on property - YUM! as well as a Starbucks and small food store with many items, slightly overpriced. There was a restaurant and nice pool-side bar, but we didn't use them. I would have liked a bit bigger pool near us and the hot tub closest to us wasn't bubbling, but those were minor bumps in the road. We had one rather large bug in the room, but "welcome to Florida" - we saw nothing to suggest bedbugs or other nasty critters. I thought that this was an excellent resort for families with kids of any age, couples, and older couples. You'd have no problem putting 6 people in these rooms. We plan to return to this property when we come back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Rental Although Wouldn't Want for Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: Appliancejunky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and I would high recommend it for vacationers. It's very convenient to the Orlando attractions and clean. However, I would not recommend buying it for a timeshare investment. Why? The location is noisy as it's too close to the highway and you notice this when sitting on the porch. Granite counter-tops are nice but be aware of fake laminate wood cabinets, cheap Hotpoint appliances including a noisy dishwasher and microwave installed too low. Basic laundry pair. Windows are not well insulated and totally fog up with condensation on only a 45 degree evening and window coverings are way too much and block the view. In bathroom, shower door glass hits toilet when opening...I wonder how many show doors have shattered? This is a safety issue. Finally, the exercise facility is way too small for the size of the property and it looks like it was designed as an afterthought. As I timeshare, you can do better. For a hotel it's pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay with your family in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: PaschoalPipolo
Reviews.Content: Choose a place to stay in Orlando is always a difficult because there are so many options and comparing them it is not an easy task. On our last trip to Orlando in January/February 2011 we have choosen the Cypress Harbour. Marriot`s Cypress Harbour is really a good choice : lots of space (2 bedrooms, 2 full bathromms, living/dinnig room, fully equiped kitchen, washing and dryer machine in the room) very clean, good service and convenient located in a calm place but very close to all shop and attractions. All reservations were done through Marriot`s site at competive prices when compared to Expedia and similars. Reading Trip Advisor I also choose to buy discounted tickets from Mapple Leaf and everything worked fine. I ordered 2 days in advance and picked up at their place. I strongly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST PLACE WE EVER STAYED!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: raci3633
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have a 7 year old daughter and we have stayed here 2 years in a row now and have a stay booked for June of this year. We love this place!!! They have three pools each with a hot pool as my daughter calls it. The rooms are big and beautiful, 2 bedrooms, hot tub in the master, full kitchen, huge living room and all rooms have a screened in sun porch. The beds have pillow top mattresses that could not be any more comfortable to sleep on. We always try to spend a couple of our days at the resort relaxing and doing some of the daily activities they have planned. If you ever have a chance to stay at this place I highly recommend this place. Enjoy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and loved the accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: AussieFamily67
Reviews.Content: We came from Australia and had a great time. Loved the facilities, in particular the large pool and spa areas. The apartment we stayed had great kitchen with almost everything we needed. Large main bedroom with big spa. Our 2 young boys had thier own room with ensuite. T.V in each room (not that we had much time to watch them). 10 mins to Disney World and approx 50 miniutes to Kennedy Space Centre. Lots of play areas through-out and things to do. It was clean and well kept. Service was friendly except at the area that hires out the paddle boats and rafts on the small lake (Pond).

Reviews.Title: “Place where Dreams happen.”
Reviews.Author: 499248Mike12345
Reviews.Content: What would i do without this place warm friendly sunny good food good people and lot's of time spent together with family..i would recommend Marriot to anyone who is looking for a good time ..

Reviews.Title: “Great Marriott's experience.”
Reviews.Author: Scamp44
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare owners and consequently, were able to exchange our resort for this one.The accomodation was fantastic as is usually the case with Marriotts. The apartment was huge with a king size bed and whirlpool in the main bedroom and a queen size bed and sofa bed in the second bedroom. Our only criticism was that, because of the location of our apartment, it was quite a walk to get to the children's clubhouse - on the plus side though, it meant our location was nice and quiet. There are two main pool areas to choose from with different depths to suit swimmers and non-swimmers alike, all immaculately clean. There is also a pizza hut on site and a small, but pricey shop. The location is very convenient for all the local attractions particularly aquatica and seaworld. We loved it so much, we are going back this year!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent family resort”
Reviews.Author: DaiBell
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with many of the other reviews that this is an excellent resort ideal for a family. We stayed via timeshare swap in a two-bedroom apartment. The apartment was clean, spacious and had all the facilities you need a for a stay. The laundry room was very useful. The site is beautifully landscaped, very clean and tidy with a host of friendly staff. There are many games, sports & fun facilties. The resort is a very short drive away from Sea World (do go there) and International Drive with it's large choice of restaurants. The large Jacuzzi in the main bedroom was quite unnecessary and resulted ina waste of space in the apartment i..e the 2nd bedroom could have been larger without it. A third toilet would also be useful if you had more than 4 people staying. Sadly the TV had no real news channels so be prepared to get out of touch with world news during your stay. Despite these negatives, the resort is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel next to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: lucycan
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. I had a 2 bedroom unit that looked very fresh (even though the resort is 20+ years old) on the top floor. It had a great screened porch. Lots of room. A full size washer and dryer. You could easily sleep 4-6 people with the pull out couch. Id bring my family back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous as always”
Reviews.Author: tcmorse6570
Reviews.Content: You just can't beat the location, size of units, resort amenities or friendliness of staff for the price. Check out their AAA prices. We're Disney freaks and after staying at other places, we've decided this is the only place to stay while near the parks. The unit we had this time was super quiet, right next to the island pool and was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for this Marriott Vacation Club property”
Reviews.Author: mj0470
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay. The Marriott grounds are lush. The common facilities are extensive and very nice. The condo is a typical Marriott Vacation Club unit but not as well appointed or spacious as other Marriott Vacation Club properties. The building exterior and elevator in our villa was slightly run down. TripAdvisor reviewer 'zilphap' did an excellent job reviewing this hotel. We did not experience any problems with the heat in our condo because the outdoor temperatures were moderate. We stayed at this Marriott property at a discounted rate after agreeing to attend a Marriott Vacation Club sales presentation. We did not purchase a MVC time share unit.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: Icon_Fly
Reviews.Content: As this was our first time in America we used this Hotel as a base whilst we explored the surrounding theme parks. When I say surrounding, we only had a week there and managed to get to Universal, Seaworld and Busch Gardens. Universal Studios and Seaworld are both within spitting distance of the Hotel so getting there in our hire car was a breeze but I digress. The apartment that we stayed in was fabulous. Maybe I have led a sheltered life but I've never seen a jacuzzi hot tub in the bedroom before. There was plenty of space for the four of us and a friend who joined us later. The kitchen is well laid out with all the amenities you could wish for, oven, microwave, fridge freezer, dishwasher, etc etc. We had two bedrooms, both ensuite and later in the week, our guest used the bed settee in the lounge area. The is a laundry room with a washing machine and a drier and the hotel provided sufficient cleaning products (dishwasher tablets and washing powder) for the week. The balcony of our room overlooked one of many lakes in Cypress Harbour and the whole thing is screened to stop the locals nibbling you to pieces. There is a pool with several jacuzzis built around it and views out to the main lake. Onsite there is a small shop and a Pizza Hut who deliver to your room if you so wish. Apparently January is winter to the Orlandians but I was more than comfortable in shorts and tshirt for most of the week. The staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. Nothing was a bother to them. I would definitely recommend this to a family. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: luvtravlinround
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here based on reviews from this website for our wedding anniversary. The rooms were wonderful and huge. Not only was there more than enough space, the entire room was spotless! I am a germ freak and am constantly looking for dirt, and I must admit, for such an abondant amount of space the rooms were very clean-- top to bottom; and believe me, I checked! We enjoyed the jacuzzi and relaxed to the music from the T.V. The kitchen supplied us with everything you could need (including a corkscrew for our wine). It was a little cold outside and when we adjusted the heater, we couldn't even tell if it was working at first because it was so QUIET. (It was working afterall). The grounds were beautiful as we had a view of the golf course on our private balcony. There is a nice boardwalk to walk across the lake. We felt so satisfied with our stay and couldn't ask for anything more. We really enjoyed our night, that we tried to book another night and bring our kids. The lady at the front desk tried her best to accomodate us, being the resort was entirely booked, and she managed to so. Thank you so much! The next day when we had our kids (age 6 and 2) and the activities were countless. There was sooooo much for them to do! There were boat rides, playgrounds, bikes, kiddie pools, game rooms, basketball courts, mini golf, children activity center and more. It was beyond belief! This resort is a place for all ages and is so worth every penny. This will definetly be a traditional vacation stay for us!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 2 Bedroom Villa”
Reviews.Author: diane&4girls
Reviews.Content: My 3 daughters (27, 21, and 19), my mom and one of my daughter's friends just spent a wonderful week at this resort. We travel together 6-8 times a year and like 5 star accommodations. This was even better than 5 stars. It was like being at home, but close to all of the attractions and shopping! From the moment we checked in until check out, everything was perfect! The property is clean and is in a perfect, quiet location. We requested a ground floor unit, which was room 5711. We were able to park the cars just outside of the living room window. The Wi-Fi was a bit slow but we were on vacation, so it wasn't a real problem. The beds were extremely comfortable. The kitchen setup had all of the comforts of home! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but could be better, especially with some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Moxiefe1
Reviews.Content: The property is pretty and pleasant. The price was good and the space very workable for a family with one child. We've just returned from our week there - we were mostly out of the villa at Disney which is convenient by car. Our villa, in Bldg 67, could stand upgrading. The couch cushions are saggy. Glasses had chips, cracks, etc. After using the whirlpool tub, we were surprised to find a brown residue that we couldn't explain. The TV remote and toilets needed service calls. I had difficulty printing our boarding passes (the designated computer for this in the lobby wasn't working - they're "waiting for parts") and the front desk staff struggled to help me get my passes printed (slow process...glad we weren't in a hurry). This was surprising...I expected better from Marriott on this now 'standard' level of service for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE-CAN NOT WAIT TO GO BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: larzy26
