Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now with my fiance, and i can not fault it!! The rooms are massive. Both times we have stayed we have had a two bedroom apartment which is great as we use one room just for all our shopping!! I love having a washing machine and dryer as its lovely to get home with no washing to do-the rooms are kept very clean and tidy. We had a massive jacuzzi type bath in the main bedroom both times, which my fiance loved and you could not get in out evry night after long days in the parks and shopping it was great just to relax. It has a kitchen where you can make your own food, which is nice sometimes just to stay in and relax. The i-ride bus stops right outside the hotel and takes you to all the shops and attractions. The hotel security is great and they are very friendly and helpful-they stop everyone coming into the resort so it makes you feel very safe. There are two different pools, a fully equiped gym, a golf course entertainment and little boats you can go on across the lake. There is also a little park for the kids to play in and hammocks to laze on. There is a small shop that you can get food/drinks ect from, but there is a massive supermarket a couple of bus stops away which is alot cheaper and has more variety. The pizza hut and restaurant are great and they even deliver which we had a couple of times. The pasta portions are massive and they kept us going for two nights!! I love Orlando and can not wait to go back hopefully next year and we will definatly be syating here!! I could go on and go about this hotel as it really was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot but would prefer Harbour Lake”
Reviews.Author: wheeliefun
Reviews.Content: We were down to Orlando for a week Vacation to WDW, 11.8.10 -11.15.10. Having stayed at Cypress Harbour once in 2001, and having stayed at Harbour Lake the sister property across the street in 2008, 2009, we bought the week getaway advertised through Interval. We were in a building near the rear of the property 57. Maybe their are newer buildings, but some of the exterior and elevator and grounds seemed to be getting run down. The unit itself has a nice screened porch, full kitchen, HD tv mounted in the living area, master suite with Jacuzzi Tub. The second bathroom has a full and a pull out couch which makes for close quarters for a unit occuppying 6 which we were. An onsite Pizza Hut and Galley Grill add some overpriced dining options without going offsite. I noticed the rec staff, concierge, main desk staff and maintenance/housekeeping folks rather kept to themselves and didn't seem to initiate contact or seem overfriendly. No rude experiences although building 57 sits by the Houskeeping garage area and it gets LOUD come break time in the afternoon. Several ongoing rec aactivities and several pools that we couldn't take advantage of, with the exception of renting a surrey bike. The splash Pad and 2 pool selection with waterslide acrosss the street at Harbour Lake seem to be better options, although the pools are maintained nicely. The location to Interstate 4 gets you to and from Disney Maingate in 5-10 min and to the Parks in 15-20min and Universal is about 10 min up Turkey Lake Rd, you can spit to Seaworld. Also a Dunkin Donuts at the intersection of Westwood and International Drive and a back entrance to The Orlando Premium Outlets and Publix, making the location unbeatable. Overall, a nice place to spend a week, but it seems to me this property is beginning to decline compared to it's sister resorts and several other II resorts that I have frequented.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Cypress Harbour was a beautiful, well maintained place to stay with my family”
Reviews.Author: mb01_10
Reviews.Content: When we checked in to the Marriott Cypress Harbour they put us into a room early, which was great. They were very accomodating when we needed something. The room was spacious and clean, the beds very comfortable. The whole resort was well maintained and they always had activities for the whole family. You would not even have to leave this resort to find something to do, the daily activity calendar was full of crafts, exercise classes, nightly entertainment. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space”
Reviews.Author: travel6727
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days after staying in a one room hotel and loved teh space of this place. We were able to give the baby his own room which allowed him to sleep better. We had lots of room for the baby to crawl around and the property had lots oc activities. the weather was not great so we did not try out the pools but we saw all three. This was about 10-15 minutes from Disney and about 2 minutes from Sea World so a great location. We also noticed an outlet mall very close as well. I would recomend this to any traveling family looking for lots of room. Thye don't clean the room durring the stay (unless you pay extra) but we had a short stay so that was not an issue. One bad thing I can think of is checkout is at 10:00 and that seemed very early and they would not let us stay more than 30 minutes later. They also try to get you to go to a timeshare presentation but only asked once.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: JrzMick24
Reviews.Content: This vacation villa was great! I am not a vacation club member, but received a great rate -- and got no hassles of purchasing a time share while we were there. I had requested a renovated unit, upper level (there are 4 floors in each building) and my request was honored. The only negative is that our unit (72) was at the back of the property and just outside of the comfort zone for walking to the Activity Center, morning coffee at the shop, hotel lobby, etc. Or maybe we were just lazy! The renovated unit was clean, updated, spacious! The utensils and dishes were new and we used the full kitchen for breakfast each day. I also did 3 loads of laundry in the full size washer/dryer. Daily housekeeping was nothing special...just the bare basics, but was not an issue for us. The property is centrally located with a short drive to I-4, SeaWorld, outlet shopping, restaurants, convenient stores; yet it is very quiet and tucked away for privacy. The grounds are well kept and the staff was courteous. There are 3 pool areas and plenty of hot tubs. The activity center provided some fun for our kids (ages 13 and 10); however, we did not spend a lot of leisure time at the resort since we were so busy at the theme parks. After we left, my daughter realized she forgot her cell phone and I called to see if it was found. Marriott mailed it back to us the next day !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: muchachona
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort at 3 am and check-in was really fast. Only problem was the key machine wasnt working, so the very nice front desk guy asked security to open the villa for us so that we could rest. The villa had everything we needed to feel confortable: 2 rooms with their own bathrooms, 2-people jacuzzi in maser bedroom, fully equiped kitchen, living room, 6-chair dining room, balcony with table and chairs, laundry room, even pool towels. I was especially impressed with how well the kitchen was equipped: dishwasher, full fridge, microwave, oven/stovetop, toaster, coffee machine (with coffee included), 8-person silverware and dining ware, wine glasses, mixer, etc. The grounds are beautiful and eventhough we did not use the resort pool or recreation activities, they had a bunch of activities scheduled every day from morning to night. Their security is excellent and always felt safe. We had a problem with our remote control and our telephone in the villa and they fixed them. Beautiful resort for families with children of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay here for a week for a family vacation in October and I can report that all seven people who stayed were delighted with this resort. We would definitely go back again and recommend it to others. Staff: Check in was very quick and efficient. The crew at the gatehouse was very friendly and on my daily runs would even open the gate for me so I could run through it (rather than around it). The housekeeping staff was courteous and efficient and the groundscrew were great. My nephew and I even got a ride back from the pool to our room one day in one of the little carts they have and he thought that was awesome! The staff members at the café by the pool were a little slow and disorganized at times, but the people who led the games like bingo were a lot of fun. Facilities: The grounds of the place were really lovely. Very neatly maintained and right by a golf course, so plenty of grass, trees and native plants. There was a lake area behind the buildings which was pretty and had some nice fountains in it. There was an activity area on the north side of the complex (it’s a big complex, so you could easily walk a quarter mile going from one area to another) which had bocce ball and things like that. The pools were very nice and there were plenty of chairs, of course we were there in October and it wasn’t that crowded and I imagine it would get very packed during the peak season. The units were great. We had two, two-bedroom units that were mirror images of each other. There was plenty of room for all of us and each unit had laundry, a kitchen, dining area and large living room area. There were two separate bathrooms, which was nice. The smaller bedroom was still a good size but the master bedroom was very large with a huge Jacuzzi tub in the middle and a separate toilet and shower area. The master bedroom also had two sinks which made getting ready in the morning easy. The rooms all had big screen televisions and free internet. I’m a big fan of free internet. Beds and pillows were very comfortable and I slept soundly each night. Shades are very good so you can really keep the room dark and block the Florida sun in the morning! Highlights: I loved the area of the big pool that had lots of bubbles and jets. There were a few separate Jacuzzi-type tubs as well, but the little area of the large pool with the jets was very relaxing and the cool pool water was very refreshing. Having the kitchen was great. It was so much easier to eat a little something in the morning and head to the parks rather than trying to coordinate a sit down breakfast at a restaurant for seven people. The screened in back porches were great for having coffee in the morning. There are plenty of activities to participate in at the resort if you have an off day from the parks. I needed two “recharge” days and sitting by the pool with a beer and a book was awesome. Also, I like to run and it was easy to find great areas to run around the complex as well as outside on Westwood Blvd and on International Drive. Oh, and there were grills outside the units so if you wanted to make hamburgers and hot dogs and have a picnic, you could do that. This was a cool touch. Areas for improvement: The service at the café by the pool is incredibly slow. It took 20 minutes to get a hamburger and I saw one couple who had ordered two sandwiches sit for almost 25 minutes while other people ordered after them and got their food before them. It’s convenient to just walk up from the pool to get the food but I don’t understand why it took so long. Additionally, although I liked the big master suite, you couldn’t use the sink, shower or toilet without casting a big beam of light on whoever was still asleep. There was no wall or anything separating the bed from the sink and the shower wall was opaque glass that shined light right onto the bed. It would have been nice to let the other person sleep while getting ready. Also, one of our rooms was not ready until 6:30 pm (check in was supposed to be at 4:00 pm), which seems a bit late and checkout was at 10:00 am, which is early. Location: It took us about 15 minutes to get to the various Disney parks. Seaworld is a mile away; it is very walkable if you want to save on parking. The location is 20 minutes from the airport and close to the restaurants near the Convention Center and by Lake Buena Vista. There are grocery stores and drug stores conveniently located. Overall impression: Everyone really liked this place. It was comfortable, convenient and clean. The units were nicely decorated and so spacious that we didn’t feel like we were on top of one another (which was good after spending 10 hours attached to each other at a theme park). It could get crowded when there are more people there, but definitely in the “shoulder” season, I would not hesitate to recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Tobyjug111
Reviews.Content: We have been exchanging for Cypress Harbour for the past 8 years and we are always delighted with the quality of accomodation and the care and attention of the staff. We love the Conche area as it is quiet, has its own pool and gets the sun all day long. We're coming abck in November for yet another week. If you have never been to the resort then I promise you that it will live up to your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “"Plush and Welcoming"”
Reviews.Author: wandeayo
Reviews.Content: The front office was excellent. Very warm and knowledgeable staff members. The apartment was crisp, warm and the view of the lake and the gulf course from our balcony was stunning. The location was excellent for us. Right off International drive, Premium outlet mall, Publix, CVS and many other shopping malls and restaurant. The theme parks are also close enough. There are so many things i like about Cypress Harbour, best of all is the calm and quiet. Yet there are so many activities for solo travelers, couples and families to enjoy. We enjoyed it so much, we extended our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Human Hair in the Bed Ruined a Promising Stay at this Resort”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer333
Reviews.Content: I was all set to give this property an "Excellent" - when I checked in and went to my villa - more like an upscale apartment complex, my jaw dropped at how large and spacious it was (2-br villa), the lovely decor, great full kitchen, huge master suite with giant jacuzzi tub, spacious balcony overlooking the golf course, living room with extra-large sectional. But when I went to go to bed and turned down the sheets on the king bed in the master suite, I found it full of dark human hair in it, along with a number of other "particles" that looked like sand or something. Obviously the bed was not changed when the previous guests checked out of that unit. My theretofore great impression - and thoughts of coming back for a longer stay with my wife - went down the toilet. I ended up sleeping in the smaller 2nd bedroom with a full bed - after a thorough examination of the sheets. When I reported this to the young cuties at the front desk they told me an "outside company" cleans all of their units. I asked to have their housekeeping manager call me later that day to confirm that the sheets/bedding were changed in the master king bed - and, of course, no such call ever came. Beware the property calls you way too much and leaves voice mails about all kinds of insignificant things at the resort - 5 times in 2 days for me, which borders on annoying. They have 2 computers in the front lobby - but not free, you pay as you go, something like 20 cents a minute and can only be done with a credit card - not very friendly. They do have free wifi in the villas. The location is beautiful, next to Sea World and convenient to everything in Orlando. But wow, in my hundreds of hotel nights I have never, ever found human hair - and so much of it - in any bed in any room I've stayed at. And after that, I doubt I would want to come back here, nice as the rest of the place was.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely appartment, not backed up by amenities”
Reviews.Author: roykaren
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong we had an enjoyable time. Our appartment was spacious, comfortable and decked out very nicely, the pool was perfect for our young children and us and of course there are theme parks galore . However we were underwhelmed by a few things that I'd consider to be important in a resort. The on-site dining options are feable to say the least, there is only fast food available and the one mini-market on site is mostly filled with cheap trinkets rather than a sensible offering of food, drinks, etc. The fact that any maid/room clean service is only available if you paid extra also seemed inappropriate given the standard of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: tasha0415
Reviews.Content: We stayed at MCH for a week and just loved it..It was very well kept and the pools were great for a swim!! They were always warm. Very centrally located and lots of activities on site. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, great choice for Orlando”
Reviews.Author: LynnDB
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 spent 4 nights at this Marriott. Actually, this is not a hotel; it is a timeshare property so the accommodations are apartments. Our apartment was a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom and it was a great value. We paid $160 US per night and it was wonderful to have so much room. The master bedroom has a king, the other bedroom has a queen bed with a double sleeper sofa, and the living room has a large wrap-around sofa which part of it pulls out to a queen bed. All the beds, including the sleeper sofas, were very comfortable (no springs poking you in the back on the sleeper sofas). We did not rent a car. We took taxis everywhere. If you are thinking of doing this, here are some one-way prices: airport to Marriott- $40 Marriott to Harry Potter (Universal Studios) $21 Marriott to Discovery Cove $8 Marriott to Premium Outlets $15 Marriott to Prime Outlets $6 It is very easy to get a taxi van that can carry up to 7 passengers. There is a sign on the vans that advertise that the cost is the same no matter how many passengers they transport. The swimming pool and jacuzzi at the Marriott were very nice. There are also tennis courts, basketball courts, a small soccer field with goals, a covered pavillion with a ping pong table, and some type of shuffle board playing area. Overall, a relaxing stay. I think this is a great place to spend a relaxing vacation with easy access to the parks and shopping. There is no proper restaurant. Only a grill cafe by the pool that sells fast foods. There is a little 7-11 type store to buy some basic staples, sandwiches and Krispy Kreme doughnuts. Be sure to either stock-up on groceries or plan on eating all meals outside of the Marriot because your choices on-site are very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed hotel within 10min of every Orlando Attraction.”
Reviews.Author: Cassandrap83
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gated access, which we weren't prepared for! Have your confirmation # ready when you go to pull in. The location of this hotel was great! It was less than 10min to drive to any of the Disney parks! At the end of the road, there was easy highway access. Also, there was a Walmart*, Whole Foods, & Target super-close. International drive is only minutes away. The rooms here were great! The main bedroom had a giant bathtub that was literally the size of a hot tub, and a separate shower & toilet area. It had double sinks & a huge closet. The dresser was adequate. The king-size bed was SOO comfortable. In the 2nd bedroom there was a double bed & a pull out sofa. When the sofa was open, there was just enough room. Both bathrooms were private in-suite. The kitchen was very well equipped, and had just about everything you could possibly need for a week. We spent a lot of time at the Clubhouse pool area which had 3 hot tubs which were EXTREMELY HOT, a large central pool (part of this pool was bubbling) & a kiddie pool. There was nothing special about the kiddie pool, but it was SHADED which was a huge plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: hondacrvguy
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay! We were in building 51 - excellent location within the resort. We were talking to the Activities Center and a member of the Activities staff offered to stop and pick us up..WOW! The Villa was extremely clean. The only negative is that it's "lovebug" season in Florida which made lounging by the pool impossible. Other than that, an awesome property and will be the only resort we stay at whenever we return to Orlando. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, would come back here”
Reviews.Author: LesleySheffield
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in August. The photos on its website do not do it justice, the rooms are very large and well furnished to a high standard. It was very clean with a well equipped kitchen nd two bathrooms. The master bedroom has an ensuite bathroom with a jacuzzi in the bedroom. Each apartment also has its own laundry room with washer and dryer. The bed in the master bedroon waskingsize and very comfortable. There is a balcony which has insect screens all around but it was too hot to sit outside. The staff at the resort were organised and efficient. Our block was next to the swiming pool - this was the warmest outdoor pool I've ever been in. We ordered room service a couple of nights from the Pizza Hut on site and that was good. The hotel is on the same block as Discovery Cove and next to Sea World and Aquatica although you still need a car to get around. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort with Great Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: jensbad
Reviews.Content: This resort was very nice and the staff was great however, there were just a few things that bothered me. When we first arrived to our door it was covered in knats. We tried to run in as quickly as possible but some still got in. We spent 20 minutes trying to kill them all. I know this isn't the resorts fault, but I do feel they should have sprayed before we arrived. So I called the front desk and they sent someone right away to spray, and that made them stay away for about 4 days. The rooms were great, very spacious. I was alittle disapointed with the lack of cookware in the kitchen. There was no frying pans or pizza pans or pots, or cookie sheet. So you basically couldn't cook anything. There is also no cleaning done at all unless you want to pay for it which is between 30-40 bucks. I do think there should be a midweek cleaning for free. Those were the few things wrong with the resort but overall it was great, the staff was super friendly. There is also a bus and trolley stop right in front of the resort which will take you many different places which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: harddogg2000
Reviews.Content: Juat return from Cypress Harbour on the 26th with my wife. It had to be one of the best vacation we had in a long time. The villas were very clean and spacious. Cypress Harbour is centraly located to the theme parks in the area. If you like shopping like my wife, ladies only 15 minutes from loosing your mind. Great family oriented resort., recommend it to anyone. If you like golf beautiful course that surrounds the villas. Can't go wrong with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say? Perfect for family holidays and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Bombiribi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my family and we enjoyed evry bit of the day. Plenty activities to participate. SeaWorld nearby and very close to both shopping outlets and Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: MattyBsouL
Reviews.Content: I have been to this resort close to 15 times and am pleased at how the continue to upgrade and improve this resort. The staff was extremely friendly, our rooms very clean with flat screen tv's in every room, and it is always quiet and peaceful thanks to its great location. My wife and I stayed there for a week and rarely left the resort because of how relaxing it is and there is always something to do there.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay with children”
Reviews.Author: MomOfThing1Thing2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cypress harbour for a week, with 2 kids - toddler and preschooler. Our goal was to tour the parks - Disney, Universal and Seaworld, and this resort is centrally located to all. Disney is a little further but we were not park hopping. For one park a day it was great. The 2 bedrooms are convenient. The master bed had a hot tub which was great. Our unit in the 1600's was close to the 2nd pool, and kids activity center, which was nice. The resort "marketplace" shop is well equipped, and reasonably priced (compared to the trip it saves). The pool was very nice for swimming with kids - maximum depth was 5'. We used the complimentary ferry across to the main pool as a fun excursion. There aren't too many restaurants around, but this place has a wonderful kitchen. We had bought pancake mix, canned corn, beans, cheese etc and could whip up a meal soon. Being vegetarians and with fussy kids, it was a bonus to have a kitchen. Since we went through vacation exchange, there was no free room service but you could pay for visits. The Harbour Lake resort opposite is supposed to have better children's activities, but since our goal was to see the theme parks, we wouldnt have used those features much. We loved our stay here. It was a nicely furnished, comfortable place to come back to at night and soon felt like home. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: Francesca-DM
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I with our 21-month-old son and my parents) stopped one day in Orlando on our way back from Hilton Head Island to Fort Myers. We booked one villa directly from the Marriott web site for the price of 189 USD ++. Although having not a very good experience at check in (we are Gold Member and will be Platinum in 2 nights, but the girl at the reception, named Cristal if I remember well, did not care at all), we were amazed by the resort and the villa. We stayed in the building “Key West” which overlooked the nice resort lake from the living room. The villa was amazing, I loved its style and the blue color everywhere. The main bedroom had an amazing oversized whirlpool. I really wish we could have stayed longer! I would sure go back and stay for at least one entire week at Cypress Harbour!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Lorrl
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Marriott Cypress Harbour from Aug 21-28th, 2010. We had a fantastic stay. The villa was spacious and had everything you need if you are traveling with young children. We have a three year old and a one year old. There is a full size washer/dryer and a full kitchen. Publix was just around the corner. The front desk provided us with gps/driving directions when we checked in letting us know how to get to anywhere we would need to go. The resort is just down the street from Sea World and just a couple exits away from Disney. We could not have been happier. The staff was very nice and accommodating. We were able to get an early check in which was great. We were worried we might be nagged about attending a sales presentation (we are not owners, were just renting) and we were not. The grounds were beautiful, they had daily activities for the kids. My son enjoyed the 3pm ice cream social a couple of times. We will definitely stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ksr444
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here from August 22nd to 28th. We arrived at noon, and I thought I would just see if our room was ready - and it was! We were in a few minutes later and loved it. The master bedroom and bath was great. My daughter loved the second bedroom. My only complaint was that the jacuzzi tub was very loud, which they came and tried to fix, and we left a few crumbs on the counter one day and then there were a few ants. But it was very clean with lots of towels. I loved the separate laundry room area as well. All the staff were very nice. I agree it did not have a ton of activities, but if you took advantage of what they had, it was a lot for a small resort. We loved the main pool at the clubhouse which had a large jacuzzi section which we referred to as the "bubbles." The girls working at the activity center were very nice as well. It was super close to Disney parks and Sea World. In fact, we only used 8 gallons of gas the whole time we were there. Overall, I loved it and cannot wait to go back. I used a bonus week through Interval International and thought this was a great value. The other Marriott resorts near there, Grande Vista and Harbour Lake, only offered an efficiency for the bonus week. Having a 2 bedroom is so much better. One thing I want to add is that if you go here and are not interested in obtaining any discounts or anything for going to a time share - do not bother with your "gift" at checkin. They send you to the concierge who tries to sign you up to attend something to get a discount. If you are not interested, no need to go over. They were very nice though and not pushy, it is just not worth standing and waiting for if there are other people already there. They did help us later in the week though and were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong With Marriott”
Reviews.Author: vavalou
Reviews.Content: Great location! Very close to everything: restaurants, parks, and necessities too (i.e., Publix, Walmart, CVS, banks, etc.). The staff was really awesome and I was pleasantly surprised that the food & drinks by the pool were pretty good. The best feature was the cold whirlpool - the main Clubhouse Pool had a section with jets, giving it the effect of a large hot tub, except it wasn't hot - what a great idea! I love the feel of the jets but usually can't tolerate the heat more than 10 minutes - a cold jacuzzi was the perfect solution! The grounds were very well maintained and the entire facilty was super clean. The villas were extremely comfortable. I'd also like to add that the Marketplace (on site grocery store) was pretty well stocked (I've stayed at other Marriotts where the Marketplace is just a tiny little stand selling candy & water). My only suggestion is to add more adult activities. I had fun watching all the kids participate in an endless array of fun (karaoke, hoola hoop competitions, survivor challenges, etc.) but for the adults there was usually only 1 poolside activity per day (Family Feud, The Not So Newlywed Game, for example), which neither I nor my friends could really participate in since we were neither family nor married to each other and we all came without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ajhdmb
Reviews.Content: We rented a two bedroom villa August 21st through 27th and enjoyed our stay. The villa was clean, well maintained and reasonably updated. One legitimate beef and a few nits... There's a flat screen TV in the livingroom that had terrible reception. We didn't spend much time watching TV so it wasn't a big issue for us, but it could be for some. The kitchen was a mixed bag - granite counters, but the cheap veneer was peeling off the cabinet doors. The recreational facilities were adequate, but I've seen better at other resorts. The clubhouse has a pool / play area, a small grill / snackbar, a very small indoor/outdoor bar that wasn't open inside when we were there, and a typical market. It was pretty dead when we went. In fact, the only thing happening in the clubhouse when we went was a meeting of the resort management - and we got a few looks that suggested that we were interrupting their meeting by entering the clubhouse. The single tennis court is a disaster - clearly not maintained at all. I know I've focused on the negatives, but it really worked for us. We did not expect to spend any time at the resort, so the poor TV reception and lacking amenities didn't really matter to us. The villa was spacious enough, clean, and well equipped and a reasonable value. That said, if you're looking to spend a day or two at the resort during your stay there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “roomy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 12go2wdw
Reviews.Content: Clean and well maintained hotel. Always saw people working on the upkeep of the property. I had made several request regarding room location and the request were filled. Accommodating front desk staff. Quiet resort. Room had new decor and furnishings.If I had to complain about anything it would be the tv's poor picture quality, but that didn't impact our stay in the least. Easy drive to either Universal or Disneyworld. Very close to Seaworld. In the morning we would see golfers from our patio as we ate breakfast. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: creativetraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week stay and absolutely loved it. The apartments were spacious with everything we needed. The pools were beautiful, but the gym was always packed - apparently they are building a new spa and gym. At first we thought, "What are we going to do here for 2 weeks?" But when we left, there was so much that we still had not done.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort, First Class”
Reviews.Author: ThemeParkKid14
Reviews.Content: What a great resort. It had been 15 years since we have been back. Have tried the others, still the best. Comfortable rooms, great service, prime location, near parks and shopping. Great pools, pristine grounds, friendly service. No time share pressure. Currently building a spa building for more benefits. Great for families with kids, three pools, fishing, mini golf, basketball. Hot tub in master bedroom. Reneovations have improved facility. Only drawback is only one ful bed in 2nd bedroom with pullout sofa. Two twins would have been moe to our needs. Overall, fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationmomof3kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and this is the best place to stay! The rooms are clean and very roomy! Beds were comfortable, kitchen was well stocked with anything we would need to cook with. Had a full size washer and dryer, the bathrooms were very roomy as well. Had a screened in porch with a ceiling fan and light outside. The entrance of the resort had a security guard that checked everyone coming in. We felt completely safe here! We were on the 3rd floor and they have a elevator so you don't have to climb the stairs. It was very quite in the rooms too, we had people all around us but didn't hear them. There was also a safe in the room that was no extra charge for use. Front desk was very friendly and gave us directions to anything we would need in the area, like a pharmacy, doctor clinic, hospital and theme parks. Our first night there the refrigerator was making a odd sound so we called them and due to us arriving late (8 or 9pm) I didn't think they would be able to look at it until the morning but they sent someone right over and he was super nice and polite and fixed it. It took 30 minutes from the time we called until he fixed it completely! They have a concierge service for buying tickets to the parks and seemed to be a cheaper deal that we found online they also offered suggestions with our tickets which was very helpful. We were asked to listen to the talk about a time share but we didn't do that and they didn't bug us about it. This resort had activities every night to do we went to the Polynesian show and it was very good and entertaining for all ages. You can rent paddle boats for a small fee and bikes that 2 or 4 people can ride. The pool was clean and large. You could stay at the resort for a week and not leave and still be entertained. The resort is about 4 or 5 miles from Disney and very close to Sea World. If I could give it a higher rating than 5, I would!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: 123SamGirl
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel to stay at. The rooms were very good and fairly clean. I traveled with my family and my cousins and we had two villas. Each villa had 2 bedrooms and 2 restrooms. There was a TV in the main room and 2 smaller ones in each bedroom. There was a nice spacious kitchen too. The outdoor patio was also very nice. They had nice activites there while we stayed. The pool was very nice and big. This hotel was rather old but was nice nonetheless. There were a few cockroaches outside the villas and I stepped on one myself. Also, we found a dirty tissue in the coffee machine. Also, I see this tabby cat all the time outside our villas walking around (patroling should I say) so make sure to keep look at for it. ;) It was a very nice stay and I recomend it to anybody. There's really nothing else to say!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: rocker18
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Cypress Harbour- great location- just around the corner from Sea World (watched their fireworks display from screened in balcony every night)-close to grocery store, shopping and highway- about 20 minutes from Orlando airport. Had previously stayed at the Mariott Grande Vista up the street- Cypress Harbour smaller, much less populated property made up of several buildings- most with four stories and four units per floor- staff very friendly-service excellent. No pressure to attend timeshare presentations (were asked upon registration if we would like to preview a new property- and indicated "no"). Three pools- the main pool is the biggest- has daily activities. Lots of chairs and tables. Other pools less crowded. There is a small launch that runs during the day to ferry guests between the main pool and the activity centre as well as buildings on the other side of the resort. Onsite Pizza Hut and convenience store with Starbucks Coffee (a little pricey as these places tend to be at resorts). Lots to do- programmes and activities for children-some at nominal cost (build a bear, t-shirts, building/racing cars, fishing derby and a kids night out package twice a week (approx. 3 hours- includes mini golf, pizza and activitities for about $25). Units are spacious with laundry facilities in unit. Free wireless internet included with stay. As typical with timeshare, there is no cleaning service included (although may be arranged for extra charge). Private screened in balconies with ceiling fans are great for eating dinner or relaxing when the sun gets too hot. The resort was recommended by friends who had previously stayed there. Would recommend for families on business or vacation and would definitely make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC PLACE TO STAY IN ORLANDO, FLORIDA!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelvernon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort through my timeshare exchange program and all I can say is "WOW" what a FABULOUS place this is to stay at if you're in the Orlando area. Front desk service staff was wonderful in honoring any & all requests immediately upon arrival, (example of requests: bldg. and floor choice, highchair, play yard, housekeeping service). We also called for refrigerator maintenance (it seemed to be a little warm after running for a few hours) & they arrived with-in minutes of calling. The condo itself was beautifully decorated and spacious, the living room had a sectional sofa that was also a sleeper. It easily accommodated our extended family of 5 and myself & my husband. The master bedroom, all I can say is "WOW" how beautiful and large it was!! Separate shower, double sinks & vanity, large Jacuzzi tub. The kitchen & dining area, the same, absolutely beautiful! Marriott Cypress Harbour location- perfect to get to all the attractions that Orlando has to offer, Disney, Sea world, Universal, etc. Just minutes away.. When I return to the Orlando I will definitely try to stay here again. I have stayed in other Orlando condo's/hotels and this by far is the nicest one yet!!!!! Consider this property if visiting the Orlando area, I promise you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “A Gerat Getaway”
Reviews.Author: haithgirl
Reviews.Content: When you travel for business, it's nice if you can find a place that makes you feel like your down time is a vacation as well. The Cypress Harbour was just that. Only a few miles away from the Convention Center, it's convenient, but also provides a nice break from the typical business trip type of hotel. I enjoyed my stay here and would happily stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: capegirardeau22
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough that my wife's father let us use his time share at this location for our family vacation. I cannot say enough good about this location. We had two minor issues on arrival and within an hour they were taken care of. The staff was always nice, courteous and willing to help out. We had a great time. Kids loved the big pool just outside registration. Smaller pool was nice as well. The paddle boats were fun except the one that sprung a leak and almost sunk! My wife and I set a new speed record on the lake getting it back to the dock. LOL. Seriously the young lady there was awesome. She made sure we were taken care of and that everything went as expected. We liked the place so much we are looking into buying a timeshare with Marriot. This place is great. The bar also makes some incredible drinks. I would really reccomend this location for anyone who wants to visit Orlando and have great facilities to use when not going to parks or seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, engaging staff”
Reviews.Author: sandrajfb
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Resort amenities at resort prices. The kids barely wanted to leave to get to the parks. Resort staff kept the kids busy with activities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family vacation”
Reviews.Author: jeffrun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cypress Harbour during a family vacation to the Disney parks as well as other things in the area. The hotels location away from Hwy 4 helped it stay nice and quiet. At the same time the staff REALLY tried to accomodate. I was able to use Marriott points and requested a newly renovated room that was feather free near one of the main pools. They really tried to meet my requests. If I have a bad thing to say about the place, it would be the concierge. The young lady seemed to be on the payroll of a couple of restaraunts in the area, because she suggested them for every type of food and every type of budget ( I saw the menu, it wasn't what I was asking for). Otherwise the place was great. Rooms were nice sized, pools were nice, the whole place was clean, and the location was about as centrally located as you could ask for. If we chose not to go out for the day or leave the parks early, they had plenty of things to do at the resort. We look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Friendly Property”
Reviews.Author: mickshrimpton
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one week at Cypress Harbour. We were in a renovated unit with a nice view of the lake and the nightly fireworks from Sea World. Unit was spacious, beds were great, not a single complaint. Everything at this property is geared to the convenience of families. We did not receive a single time share solicitation. We ate lunch on a regular basis at the poolside establishment and found the food to be fresh and reasonably priced. Good drinks and service from the poolside main bar. The pools were all nicely kept and refreshing. Great service from the activities team (e.g. boat rentals). Two minor complaints: (1) they should advise up front that daily cleaning is not included when you book a weekly rate; and (2) the 10:00 am checkout time is unreasonable. Property was very secure and an easy drive (10-15 mins) to the Disney parks. Would definitely stay again with the family although would look elsewhere if traveling without children.

Reviews.Title: “rather shabby, prefer grande vista!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegirl41
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, May 30th - June 5th. We have on 2 previous occasions stayed at Grande Vista, which we absolutely loved, but they were fully booked. So we saw that Cypress Harbour is rated so high so we thought we would try it. The reception area is very tacky, the curtains looked as if they had seen better days, circa 1970!! Anyway, our apartment was very nice, nice view, very clean, but after arriving we received no more cleaning the whole week, asked and was told we would have to pay for it. I do not wish to clean on my holiday thank you very much, and was not going to pay out for it!! The pools were okay, but filled up quite early, so you were lucky to get a lounger. We had a lovely visitor to our apartment, a huge cockroach!! We ran reception and they were not at all bothered, said they would come and spray our apartment the next day, but we never saw anyone and left 2 days later. The market place was very expensive, we stocked up at Publix and Walmart. Happy Hour at the bar was a $1 off cocktails, nothing to go mad about!! We own in Paris, France and at Cypress Harbour they asked us to go to a presentation at Marriott's Lakeshore Reserve, which we thought would be interesting, as we like to see what's going on in the vacation club. However, the 90 minutes that they said it would last turned into 2 and 1/2 hours and we wanted to get out of there, we felt the salesman was very pushy, something we had not come across before in previous presentations. When we said no, definately no! they guy went out and another guy came in, with another offer. We still refused, and got out!! Another thing, there is no restaurant at Cypress Harbour, there is just a fast food place, which is very over-priced.. I would not return to Cypress Harbour, my advice is to go to Grande Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mr.Wade
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Marriott Cypress Harbour June 4th - June 11th. Our traveling party included two adults and two 14 year old girls. First of all, we were impressed with how spacious and how clean the rooms were. In addition, the room had a screened patio with a great view of the lake. There were various swimming pools throughout the grounds, and recreational activities for the whole family. Thirdly, this hotel was situated close to all amusement parks and restaurants. In all, the Marriott Cypress Habour Hotel is the perfect family destination.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL property, great location”
Reviews.Author: JimmySquirrel
Reviews.Content: Took a holiday to Orlando and stayed at the Marriott Cypress Harbour and all I can say is the property and villa/ apartments were WONDERFUL!! The location is within a short distance of everything, the pool area is beautiful and the amenities are beyond expectations!! We seriously considered buying into their time share options!! Would have posted more pictures but the kiddos are in them all : ) Sorry....

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mpdneal
Reviews.Content: This property was fabulous. Our 3 year old son got very sick on our first day of vacation with a super high fever, and he was down for about 4 days from it. It was so nice having the type of room that we had to deal with a sick child all day and all night. The rooms were great - so nice to have 2 good-sized bedrooms...2 awesome bathrooms...and a nice full kitchen. The screened-in porch was also one of our favorites! We don't have a bad thing to report. Everything was great. The pools were awesome! We only wish we had more time to enjoy all of the wonderful amenities on site. I highly recommend! All the parks were easy to access from where we were too! Less of the hustle and bustle too!

Reviews.Title: “Could have stayed at the hotel the entire weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Farrahtravels
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at this hotel, I was in awe of the beautiful landscape. It was truly like an oasis. The hotel has music, hula dancers and fire twirlers on Thursday evenings. This is truly a treat for all ages. My children are ages 8 and 14. We ordered sandwiches and salads from the bar and enjoyed the evening by the pool. The hotel has activities going on everyday and we could have stayed there all weekend and enjoyed the beautiful landscape and planned events. We rented a 2BR villa and everyone had their own space. Soaking in the huge jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom was nice after days of walking the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “4th Visit, still the best, wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: lexgjackson
Reviews.Content: Exceptional staff, rooms clean, and very large. All 3 pools are warm and clean. Plenty of towels, etc. Our 4th visit, to this resort, because it is the best. (stayed at about 15 resorts) Treat yourself...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Toupie269
Reviews.Content: I was staying here with friend who got a really good deal here because of his time share. When we walked into the room, it looked great!! We stayed in a 2 bedroom and it had more than enough space for 4 of us. The furniture and curtains were a bit ugly, but, gave the room some character. The kitchen had everything that we needed including a dishwasher that was great. We stayed in room 6641 and did not have much of a view outside off the balcony. It was nice to see that the balcony was screened in, especially since we were there for the start of love bug season. (Mid to late May). The jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom was great but, make sure you don't put too much bubble bath in before turning on the jets, you may have an overflow of bubbles. The pool that was close to our room was nice and the waterfall that came off of the top of the sauna was great for a back massage. The hot tub was really hot and almost too hot to get into. The drinks from the bar at the pool across the way were a bit expensive $26 for 3 pina coldas. The marketplace was reasonably priced, we did most of our shopping at wal-mart though. Great location to all amusement parks, seaworld was just down the road along with Universal and Wet and Wild. Our main reason for going was to see the Space Shuttle Launch from Kennedy Space Centre, only 2 left, I would highly recommend checking one of them out. We did purchase a time share at a different location though, it is right in the middle of Disney and we are looking forward to our first stay there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Property”
Reviews.Author: sweetatr
Reviews.Content: At check-in, we were very happy to learn our request for water view room had been granted. We decided to stay at this property because we were traveling without children and were told this was one of the more "quiet" locations. Had a wonderful two bedroom villa on the top floor overlooking the pond and water feature. Short walk to the pool, hot tub, and activities. Easy drive to the amusement parks and lots of dining choices nearby. However, the concierge was another story; not friendly and never seemed to know anything about local dining. Although the staff changed, they all seemed to be the same and not very helpful. When we needed dining suggestions, we called the front desk and spoke to the clerks; they were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “OMG....FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: Familytrip906
Reviews.Content: This resort was wonderful. The staff was helpful and friendly. Plenty to do and shopping were close by. No complaints here and looking forward to future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favourite Orlando resort!”
Reviews.Author: nortoang
Reviews.Content: We have exchanged into Marriott Grande Vista for a number of years and really liked staying there except for some of the rooms becoming slightly tired and old fashioned tv's. After a bit of research we decided to try a different Marriott resort and Cypress Harbour sounded like the one for us - we were so glad we did! Prior to arrival we had requested a refurbished room near to the main pool and on a top floor - full marks for all requests granted and lovely friendly staff. We loved the refurbished rooms, everything in them seemed new and it was very clean and well set out. We only marked the sleep quality down to 4/5 as we never seem to get on that well with Marriott pillows - the bed was lovely and comfortable. We stayed for 2 1/2 lovely relaxing weeks and felt right at home despite the stressful outbound journey (we flew out on the 22nd, only the 2nd day of flights resuming)and wondering if we were actually going to fly or not by the end we were quite disappointed that the ash cloud hadnt come back and delayed our return! Overall we found Cypress Harbour to be a bit more relaxing than Grande Vista and less busy and noisy around the pools, even the main one and liked the rooms better. We will definitely be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: bhattara
Reviews.Content: You know I am actually a tough grader. I think this is first time I rated a five. This place has so much to offer what can you say Room- It is huge. I mean it is bigger than the apartments I stayed in during graduate school. It is so big is that we had a small baby and we were worried we were not going to hear the baby cry. Not to mention the big boy Jacuzzi, you have your family in that one. Facility location- Very well kept no problems. A lot of money and people are needed to keep this complex in good shape. Right next to Sea world and not very far from Disney. Food- I cant say. There is a marketplace here but I am not sure if we are going to use it. Activities-Plenty of activities for the family and great pool. It also peaceful at least in May. I am not sure what I would change. We did an exchange for our timeshare and it really went well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: reorante
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in our visit to Disney, lots of things to do, very nice lagoons, I requested a renovated room after reading some reviews and it was beautiful, full kitchen with appliances, free internet, small supermarket and friendly staff, I even made bought through internet and they held the pack in the frontdesk for me, a little expensive but it´s worth it. The hotel is close to every attraction, very close to Sea World, Disney, Aquatica, Shopping Malls and Outlet.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, better than Grande Vista and Harbour Lake resorts”
Reviews.Author: Caniac
Reviews.Content: This year we thought we'd try Cypress Harbour Resort since we have already been twice to Grande Vista and once to Harbour Lake (Horizons), which is across the road. What makes this resort better is that it is totally secluded with lush foliage and surrounded by the beautiful Grande Pines golf course. It's like a park and very quiet. (Grande Vista's buildings stick out like a sore thumb because the property has not yet matured. Harbour Lake is in a terrible location, right on the freeway with lots of noise.) The units surround a good sized lake with a water feature in the center. I like the circular screened in porches. However, you can look right into your next door neighbors' porches as well (no privacy out there) since they are circular and right next to each other. The views make up for that. The living rooms are good sized with large circular sofas that can seat 6 people. Others have written that the second bedroom is tiny. I thought it was an okay size, just as long as the sofa bed is not pulled out. One nice thing about the room is that it has an en suite bath of its own....not large, but with a tub/shower. The master suite is just like the photos show, roomy enough and we liked the shower room with the glass block wall surround. It is true that the beds are firm, but when I woke up in the mornings, no back ache..... If booking here, call up a month or so before your arrival and ask for a unit in a building near one of the main pools, high floor and most of all, newly refurbished.......you will get it...they try hard to please. The refurbished units have the new wall mounted flat screen HD LG tv's in the living and bedrooms...46 inch in the living and master, 36 inch in the 2nd bedroom.....stainless steel appliances and granite counters throughout....new carpets, drapes and furniture...all in a semi nautical theme with royal blues and golds...all beds have the crisp white duvets (European style). Pools are very nice...but are a bit tired compared to Grande Vista...Still, the setting is tropical and just so pleasant. We especially liked the main pool by the lobby and food venues. They have live music on some days out there and loved the open air bar overlooking the pool. We were in bldg. #52, which is right next to the lobby/pool...very short walk...If you go to the Marriott vacation Club website, you can view and print out the property map of the resort and select which building you prefer. The resort is well kept and looks like it just had a fresh coat of paint on all the buildings. It only needs some near future refreshing addressed to the pool areas...tiles and patio area surround......the trees tend to drop leaves and seeds so it can get splotchy looking. The strapped patio lounges will soon need replacing...other than that, it is a home run...can't complain. One year we stayed across the road at the Harbour Lake resort (Horizons)...although it gets very high reviews here at Tripadvisor...it all has to do with the kiddie pool features, and not the noisy freeway proximity or the units, which are not nearly on the same caliber as the Cypress Harbour or Grande Vista. One thing that Grande Vista has that we really like better is the 2nd bedroom being so much larger and has a lock off feature and its own balcony and kitchenette...when another couple comes with us, they really appreciate this..and also, their beds are much more comfortable...in a few years their property will be as lush at Cypress Harbour. Both have their good points. But we were so happy at Cypress Harbour on this trip. I also have to say that the front desk staff went out of their way to make us happy. Grande Vista and Harbor Lake did not, especially Harbour Lake. This is a great place to stay as long as you do not have adults or a couple using the 2nd bedroom., unless they don'r mind a queen bed. Also, the 2nd bedroom has a window overlooking the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Harbour amazing for young children!”
Reviews.Author: cubaloverOttawa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week stay at the Cypress Harbour. This is an amazing resort and a wonderful place to stay, especially if you have young children. A lot of people prefer the newer, more modern and much busier Mariott Grande Vista. My cousing was staying at the Grande at the same time so we saw both resorts and spent some time at Grande as well..Although it has more to do and more amenities, it also has a LOT more people. Lounge chairs disappear early, and there are kids everywhere, all the time, which is fine just means it's very noisy and busy. We are a family of five..a 5 year old, three year old and six month old. Cypress had two very large pools, and two kiddie pools, several playgrounds, and a lovely lake with pedal boats (cost about 12$/half hour). The days we didn't go to disney we stayed at the resort and had lots of fun. IT's only a five minute drive to seaworld and an hour to tampa for Busch gardens (which is worth the trip for the little ones and the new sesame street area, great fun!). IT's about 15 minutes to disney and five minutes to the premium outlets and a great Publix grocery store..all said very well located. The rooms are huge. They need some updating but who cares. They were clean, and we were pleased with the full size washer and dryer. The master bedroom has a bathtub you could fit five in, and it's a whirlpool. Screened in deck overlooks the lake. This resort is very quiet with large well maintained grounds. I suggest staying in building 64 since it's right between the pool and the activity center..if you have young children you'll know how important it is to not have a long walk in case you forget something. We had a wonderful two weeks here, and would recommend this place to anyone who is going to Orlando. It's so welll located, and the staff are unbeatable. Polite and helpful at every turn. ( Grande Vista was nice, don't get me wrong, but HUGE, so if your room is not the closest, you could have a very long walk to any activities..my cousin was far and it was not fun getting back and forth with the kids.) The fitness center is also amazing..up to date with personal tvs attached to the treadmills. I used it every two days and found it quiet and always a machine available. If you're flying from Canada I may recommend Westjet..amazing service with young children, we always fly them and have always had a great flight..not an easy task with three kids under the age of five! Good luck and enjoy if you're going..we miss it and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, responsive staff”
Reviews.Author: MDHMD
Reviews.Content: Although the accomodations need some updating, the rooms were spacious and clean. We did have a 5 year old jury rig the jacuzzi which sprayed water all over the room. Housekeeping was a bit unfriendly regarding this. The location is fine. The pools were fun. The double bikes were fun for the kids as well.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, okay.”
Reviews.Author: klsmedic10
Reviews.Content: Arrived a few hours before check-in and asked if our luggage could be stored while we spent the day at Sea World. We returned at 5 p.m. and told our luggage had been inadvertently locked in an office. We were also told we would receive complimentary tickets to Universal Studios. Our luggage was finally delivered ( at 8 p.m.) to our villa and we were informed the free ticket thing was a "mistake." The villa was clean, the property itself was well-kept, and the housekeeping staff was exceptional. I don't like being lied to secondary to a front-desk screw up. The tickets were promised, and therefore, should have been given.

Reviews.Title: “Great villa!”
Reviews.Author: susmis
Reviews.Content: We used our Marriott Reward points to stay for 5 nights in a two bedroom villa with our 5 month old son. The complex is huge but is spread across a vast area and so you don't feel that there are loads of people there. We absolutely loved the villa which was on the 4th (top) floor of the building adjacent to the reception. The staff were very welcoming on our arrival and helpful throughout our stay. There are a few facilities on site including a small shop which sells the basics (great to get you started until you can get to a supermarket) and a takeaway (which was welcome after a long flight from the uk!) but dont expect the same facilities as a full service hotel as the complex is really set up for self catering. The villa itself was huge, although there was just the three of us staying there (2 adults and a baby). I don't think I'd recommend the two bed villa for 8 people (the max occupancy) as the layout is: master bedroom with en suite, second bedroom with double bed and sofabed (very cramped with sofabed out), and a further sofabed in the living room. I think 4 people would be very comfortable. The master bedroom has a fabulous whirlpool which is a nice touch! The balcony gave us great views across the lake and was fully covered in insect netting keeping the villa pretty much insect free. Everything you would expect was provided in the kitchen including dishwasher detergent and the villa had its own washing machine and tumble drier (invaluable with a baby!). The Cypress Harbour is very close to Sea World, only a couple of minutes from I4 and an easy drive to the Disney theme parks so location was ideal. The closest Wal Mart was only 10 minutes drive away (the hotel give you a great list of directions) and if you don't fancy DIY breakfast then The Village Inn is only a 5 minute drive along the road.

Reviews.Title: “this vacation club lived up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: NIBobmar
Reviews.Content: This was the first the first time my husband and i had the opportunity to stay at our time share villa, and we were both very pleased with what we saw. The villa was spacious and beautifully appointed and of course, spotlessly clean. Staff were very friendly, courteous and helpful. The resort is well laid out and it was lovely being able to eat breakfast each morning looking out across the lake. There were plenty amenities on site to keep us occupied. However, just one minor flaw. At the pools other residents insisted on leaving towels on sunbeds to reserve them whilst were off doing something elsewhere, with the result that we were unable to find vacant beds for ourselves. The resort frowns on this practice as there was a sign asking that sunbeds should not be reserved in this way, and that staff would remove towels if not claimed within a 45 minute period. Unfortunately we did not see this policy being enforced at any time during our stay. Having said that, I would overall recommend this resort as a top place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I just LOVE this RESORT”
Reviews.Author: princessdavid
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Marriotts and this one is great for a vacation spot....the location and price was good...I loved the jacuzzi and the screened in pation....

Reviews.Title: “Just a Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: Quinnly
Reviews.Content: I had read almost all good things about this place and was so happy that the reviews were right. Very happy with this property. I had requested a room in either Building 50 or 51 (based on the site map, etc) and was given a nice 3rd floor in Building 50 which is the Key Largo Building. Great view of lake and boathouse area and not a far walk from the clubhouse pool or even the Bay Pool. The villa was great but for us, only minor issue was that second bedroom is snug and we had 3 people in that one. If just a couple or couple kids, it is fine. They never complained but we have had larger second bedrooms in other properties. But units looked refurbished with nice Plasma TVs, a nice kitchen and hugh living area. Very clean and well appointed. Very nice grounds, pools, huttubs, etc. We lucked out with weather so could enjoy pool a couple days. My husband and I also golfed at nearby Grande Pines which was convenient and nice and you get a discount -- either 15 or 20 percent. Good location. Not far from anything and especially close to Sea World. They did arrange some kids activities if needed, including a bon fire at night which looked like fun. Service was outstanding. They needed to fix our safe and a washer and immediately responded with friendliness and replaced both very quickly. They will try to get you to go to a presentation at the Grand Lakes property. If you can afford 90 minutes and you want either some Marriott money (100) or discounts off golf, etc, not a bad idea. I'm sure most folks can't afford the time (unless you are serious about buying there). It was pretty outstanding since it shares acres with JW Marriott and Ritz Carlton. I just have nothing negative to say about the place, other than the cozy second bedroom. Its good for adults and kids. When we went, there were more college age kids on spring break than smaller, but they were all great. Its not a party type atmosphere like a Fort Lauderdale. You will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation With Friends”
Reviews.Author: jstizy
Reviews.Content: Super place to stay in Orlando. Easy access to I4 and all the attractions. Great staff in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best Villa - Hotel for your money.”
Reviews.Author: cilemar
Reviews.Content: Huge Villa, Beautiful place, quiet, secure, affordable, Huge Master bed with an inside bedroom whirpool jacuzzi. it fits up to 8 persons, close to everything! great customer service A++++

Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious !”
Reviews.Author: HikerDave
Reviews.Content: Spent a Saturday & Sunday night recently sharing the 2 bedroom villa with another couple. My first impression when we walked in was to marvel at all how large and spread out the floor plan was. Since I had made the reservation, my wife and I got the master bedroom suite and it was huge! One of the largest I have ever stayed in. The beds were very comfortable and made for a great night's sleep. The living area had the most comfortable couches that I have sat on for awhile. The four of us were very relaxed and felt at home in the short time that we there. We all agreed that we would have loved to have spent a week there. The floor plan was large enough that even on a rainy day there was plenty of room to spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay, relax and get to the theme parks!”
Reviews.Author: tesmithjr
Reviews.Content: Perfect in every way. Clean, spacious rooms with all of the amenities you would need to enjoy and save money while in an area that can cost you a lot it allows for in room cooking and hanging out. Pool area is fabulous and the staff was wonderful. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property / amenties for price...”
Reviews.Author: AP_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Cypress Harbour from Jan 13 -18, 2010 with colleagues and was extremely pleased with the property. First, the room and property was unbelievable for the price. We received a special deal - pay for 3 nights, get 2 free so the total cost for 5 days was around $640. This was awesome for what you get. The condo was huge... a massive master suite with nice spa bathroom, 2nd bedroom and bathroom, laundry, living room, etc. The condo was essentially move in ready with all the amenities you could think of. I was with two other girlfriends but would be a great place for two couples to stay as well. It also had a nice screen in patio. The property was also great- plenty of activities for young children and the pools were awesome. Unfortunately it was too cold to go in when I was there. Re: location, you are really close to Sea World and a short drive from Universal. It was also right next to the Orlando Conference Center which is where I spent most of my days. I will definitely stay here again when I visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: PatrickNewJersey
Reviews.Content: stayed here 2/14-2/20... even with cool 60 degrees/ non-typical florida weather, the numerous hot tubs and teasing sun made for lots of time by pool and deck on perimeter of lake. Sights are and sounds are therapeutic to embattled residents of northeast winter and any other city. All Staff, including endearing recreation folks were a pleasure; Dave, boat operator was a real pleasure providing updated weather reports as we savored ride across lake (even thoughtful enough to go out of way to give my 6 year-old daughter a free birthday sunday)... folks at front desk likewise extended our 10 am departure to 1 pm to help us out ...overall a fantastic place, lots to do (solid gym including treadmills, dumbbells/ our 15 yr old would then take a boat ride to get protein shake, , especially if you don't plan on spending most time at parks (we went 3/7 days)... Finally, we spent $1,600 for 7 days plus were given a 350 dollar food voucher for a 1,350 sq ft. villa... great deal in current economy! Heck NJ shore is 3-4 k during summer week.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, great trip”
Reviews.Author: mpitkin
Reviews.Content: With the untimely cold weather that hit Orlando during our stay, we were extremely happy to be staying the CH. The accomodations are some of the best that we have experienced and we have traveled extensively as a family throughout the US and the Caribbean. The 2BR units are large and afford ample space for a family to relax and hang out. The Island Pool Area was our favorite with multiple hot tubs and a heated pool which was a saving grace for the week. The marketplace serves Starbucks coffee which was a must for us every morning. The location is great with minimal distance to travel to most attractions and restaurants. The staff was extremely friendly and delightful. My son loved the basketball courts and spent a great deal of time playing with other kids. Morning walks were also very enjoyable as the property is very well maintained and filled with tropical trees and plants. One week was not enough. We could have stayed at the CH for another week. From well seasoned travelers, take it from us, the CH is well worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: atravelagtfor25yrs
Reviews.Content: I like this resort and have stayed here before. We could have stayed at a hotel but this resort offers you two bedrooms, washer dryer and a full kitchen. We might not use it much but its nice to have more thatn a single bed to sit on when you come home from a long day . The property is clean and the staff friendly. I have done in the park, near the park, hotels and condo options and like this one the best. It feels like home and they even cleaned my dished when we ran out quickly one morning. I did not use much of the property either time but as I asid , the extra running room and space is a blessing. I did notice I had a headache after a few days and think the hotel might check for mold in the air vents but that would be my only complaint. The place was neat and clean and kept well Laurie J P travel

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: stay-home-mom-pa
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Marriott Cypress Harbour for a week vacation. This facility is a time share location. There are numerous buildings that are surrounded by a neighboring resorts golf course. The unit was older but still decently maintained. There were obvious signs of use in the living room and the showers had some paint peeling from moisture. Other than those minor details, I give this resort a thumbs up. We stayed in a 2 bed/2 bath unit. It was large and well appointed. Our family of 5 did not feel crowded. We used the tennis courts, swimming pools, basketball courts, pool tables, and playgrounds. We did not pay for any of the other resorts amenities which included fishing, boat rentals and miniature golf. We were contacted about a timeshare presentation but once told that we were not interested nothing further was said. The grounds are well maintained and are convenient to everything. We could have walked to Sea World if we had wanted. The only drawback we found was that the pools were not convenient to most of the outer units. It is very private and no one bothered you. If looking for a location to spend time with family, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “We just LOVE this place!!! Nadine at the front desk is the BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: crcorr
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here last year for a week and really loved it. We booked 2 weeks there this year and added a 3rd week while we were there. From the minute we checked in :) to the time we left :( the staff was working hard to ensure we had a wonderful stay. The 2 bedroom villas with full kitchen and fabulous jetted tub in master are very well appointed, extremely large (over 1300 sq ft) and comfortably furnished. The screened in balcony has a beautiful view of the well maintained grounds &/or golf course & is a great place for meals or just relaxing. The food at the onsite grill is good & the onsite market has a fairly good selection of items to hold you until a market trip. Cypress Harbour is VERY conveniently located to all of the parks with easy off & on to I-4 and International Drive with every restaurant you can think of! They are currently refurbishing the units one building at a time - can't wait to see them next year! We'll probably book 3 weeks straight! The pools are gorgeous with a nice mix of sun & shade, plenty of chaises & tables, whirlpools, a sauna & kids pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: bthrustr
Reviews.Content: We were vacationing with two other couples and Cypress Harbour was exactly what we were looking for. We had just come off a cruise and were looking for a relaxing day before hitting the theme parks. The grounds were quiet and well maintained and even featured a small nature trail. We had the option of cooking in our own kitchen and using gas or charcoal outdoor grills. There were three pools to choose from each with at least one hot tub. Why stay in a hotel room when you can have a condo with all these activity options? Splitting the cost among 3 couples brought the price down to less than the typical hotel room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Son hurt by hotel negligence”
Reviews.Author: kscalifornia2001
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel while on a trip to Disney World with my two children, ages 3 1/2 and 1 1/2. It was a two bedroom condo. In the smaller of the two bedrooms, there was a small, flimsy, two drawer dresser with a huge, heavy tv bolted to the top of it. My son (3 1/2) pulled out the bottom drawer, and the entire dresser and tv fell on him, pinning him underneath. After a trip in the ambulance to the hospital, it turns out that he was just bruised, but very, very lucky. He could have easily been killed, or very hurt. The dresser never should have had a tv on it, or at the very least been secured to the wall. The hotel was completely unapologetic, unhelpful, and did not even send anyone to the room afterwards to help put the dresser back in place! They did not even seem concerned that the next child might not be so lucky. Please be careful when staying in any hotel that this does not happen to you. There should be a law that hotels or time share associations must secure their furniture to the wall!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wombatkev
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Marriott, and it was a great one as always. The place is amazing, with the large lake and very lush grounds and plenty of privacy. Compared with other Orlando resorts, the crowd here is more geared towards adults, so it is more peaceful. The 2-bedroom units offer ample space and nice lake views, although the second room is a bit tight for more than 2 adults. If you do not have a car, ask for a room in the buildings nearer the lobby (we stayed in building 53) or it will be a long walk to the entrance and buses. The hotel is on the I-Ride line, so its an easy ride to the Premium Outlet Mall and dining on I-Drive. The onsite Market Place has provisions at very reasonable prices, plus starbucks , krispy creme and pizza hut options. All in, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a great place”
Reviews.Author: barclaycat
Reviews.Content: I am not easy to please and we usually stay at 5 star resorts. The Marriott Cypress Harbour was amzing. It far exceeded my expectations. From check in, location, even the mini market and food was great. Beautiful pool, just a great rtesort overall. Great golf course as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and very nice condo”
Reviews.Author: Jimboslice
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a Christmas vacation Dec 25-29 from this hotel and loved it. The condo was huge with a big living room, Dining room and kitchen. The bedrooms were nice and beds were comfortable. The smaller bedroom was a bit cramped when you pull out the sofa bed too but you're sleeping so its not like it gets in the way. The screened in balcony was a very nice feature too. The front desk staff and housekeeping were very welcoming and accomodating. If you are going to buy tickets for the parks, do it at the concierge desk in the main lobby, you get discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: lovebirds06
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to the Orlando area in May 2009 and were quite impressed with the last place we stayed in Orlando.
