Not expecting this place to surpass, we arrived and were blown away by this place. It'a in Orlando, one mile from Sea World yet you don't get that impression by staying here. Very quiet, and nice. The 2 bedroom suite was very spacious, with full kitchen, dining, living room, 2 full baths and a washer dryer, plus one of the largest jacuzzi tubs I have ever seen! Very cozy room, comfortable beds, and everything you need for the week for the most part. The grounds are beautiful, and if you plan to spend some time at the resort this is the place for you. If not, then you might not want to. The pools were very nice too. They offer boat rides, sporting rentals, have a few restaurants onsite and gift shop. Be aware of the flying bugs...At night there are many flying bugs and you have to run in your room pretty much or else they follow you in, they don't do anything other than be annoying, but the balcony has a screen to prevent them from coming in, so it is awesome to sit out on the balcony and have breakfast or dinner. Overall, if we return, we'll probably stay here. I'd recommend it, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Save your $ for another resort”
Reviews.Author: dazzlingdiamond
Reviews.Content: The first thing we noticed was an musky/moldy odor as we entered(Friday). The furniture is very worn(cushion compressions) and dated as you can see in the pictures. The floor had hair and dirt marks in the kitchen/bathtub was never cleaned before we got there.Nasty. and there were NO linens for the pull out beds. We turned the air to 70 before going to inquire about the room not being cleaned before we got it.The next morning it was still hot in the room ,cleaning service was a no show,and the toaster was broken.Called the front desk again. We were told that they would bring a toaster but fitted sheets are NOT provided for the pull out beds and they couldn't put us in another room! on SUNDAY ac guys showed up at 8pm. the air was on by Mon. am. What a joke!!!I wish we would have prolonged our visit by a few weeks to stay in a cleaner place w/ better service. I was embarrassed to have my in-laws stay with us. It was NOT worth the savings. BYW the view from one of our bedrooms was to the elevator where everyone got on and off ALL NIGHT LONG. It was more than a little annoying and we had to keep the blinds pulled the entire time. This bedroom had the pull out couch. As you can see you cannot get to the closet or use the dresser when the bed is opened. What a pain this was with kids. We had no privacy and with people walking next to your window all hours of the night we felt very uncomfortable and worried about our safety.

Reviews.Title: “Extended Family fun”
Reviews.Author: 1stclass88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Cypress Harbour during Thanksgiving week. Great location. Even though it's near Sea World(we could see a rollercoaster from our balcony.) park noise were barely audible from the balcony.Fully equipped kitchen,jacuzzi tub in the master suite, and twice daily housekeeping. My villa was one of the largest I've ever stayed at. Resort staff is top notch,responsive,friendly and of course very knowledgeable about what to do and where to go in the city of Orlando. Will stay again in future visits to Orlando,Fl.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB ACCOMODATION”
Reviews.Author: GLSA19
Reviews.Content: We booked this accomodation after reading numerous reviews on tripadvisor. The resort is exactly as descibed in the reviews. It is truly stunning. The villa was amazing. Two bedrooms and two bathrooms. Living area including dining table and a fully equipped kitchen. The villa also had a washer and dryer which was invaluable during our two week stay. The master bedroom had the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in excluding our own bed at home. The jacuzzi bath, which was part of the open plan ensuite bathroom for the master bedroom, was another stunning extra which helped to ease our aching muscles after a day spent walking round the parks. There was also a screened balcony from where we enjoyed watching the numerous squirrels playfully fighting each other and leaping from tree to tree on the nearby golf course. As previously reviewed, the staff at Cypress Harbour are very helpful and friendly. We had a very minor issue one morning but within half an hour there was somebody at the door to resolve the matter. I would most definitely recommend anybody to stop at this resort and can definitely see my family returning to the Cypress Harbour in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott always does the best!”
Reviews.Author: Mai-ImIt
Reviews.Content: Great stay even though we were not in a Disney property which would better since we went to Disney the whole time. But I could not asked for more because Cypress Harbour is quite, beautiful, and clean. Our room is facing the pond view and I heard it might be inhabited by some animals. It was not a big deal but unfortunately, we encountered some problems such as found few water bugs on bed, sofa, desk, and table. I don't really know about water bugs if there are harmful or not, but the good thing that it was not the bed bugs because those are really bad parasites. We informed the resort service staffs about this issue and they acted fast about it but did not entirely eliminate the problem. I hope they can do something about it. But I think they did when they put screens on all balconies in the resorts. I don't know where those identified water bugs come from and why they're able to get inside the room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved Our Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Yellowstonegal88
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Cypress Harbour for a week in October and had a wonderful experience. The grounds are beautiful and everything you would expect at a luxury resort. The rooms are very colorful and cheerful. Ours had just been renovated (we had a 2 bed/2 bath) and looked clean and new. The pools were beautiful! We came back from Disney each night and the kids had a great time cooling off at the waterfall pool. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location and large, modern units”
Reviews.Author: mdesquire
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a one week timeshare exchange and were delighted with our stay. We were in building 53 with a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit. Very colorful, modern units. Everything was clean, we did not opt for the additional charge of maid service. It was awesome to have a huge jacuzzi in the master bedroom (this was our 1 year wedding anniversary). The pools are great, it was a slow period during our November 7th stay, so we basically had the pools to ourselves. Great night swimming. The outside bar was a great convenience and we ended up there several nights before they closed (11pm). The bar staff, specifically Liz, was so friendly - in this regard everyone there was friendly- funny to waive to everyone on golf carts as if they knew us. Very well kept property. Seaworld was 2 minutes away, and I-Drive was 5 minutes away -so many restaurants to choose from. We were not disappointed with anything during our stay - which for us, as we are very picky, says a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tentex3Reston_Va
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 bed, 2 bath condo on the lake with screened deck. Condo was large, very clean, decor in good shape. Pretty decor. Would be very comfortable for 4-8 people. Property had pools, basketball courts, playgrounds etc. Very pretty landscaping. Peaceful location with stuff to do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lovely101
Reviews.Content: Lovely choice, excellent resort!!!!!!!! I am completely satisfied with my stay at Cypress Harbour. I would definatley stay there again. I have also stayed at The Grande Vista as well as Mystic Dunes. This is by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMka
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several days around son's wedding date, hosted an "after" party on rehearsal evening, everything was lovely. Was pleased to be able to invite out of town family to visit with us, who were staying at various other resorts close by .... everyone was very impressed with our accommodations. Amenities were superb, staff was very pleasant and helpful, location was actually much better than I had hoped! Beautiful grounds, clean, well kept. Well lit, felt secure.easy to find, convenient to grocery stores as well as to WalMart because you ALWAYS forget something important. Would definitely stay again, actually I would seek out this resort

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: itravelalotGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 56, which most of the buildings are about the same, ours had a golf course view. Its mandatory that you request a top floor unit, the pitter patter of little feet can be heard easily through floors. Our room was in good shape and clean, highly reccomend the location, its close to all the attractions and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical oasis in the middle of the attractions”
Reviews.Author: Ten_Hi
Reviews.Content: We booked the final week of September using an Interval International Get-Away and did some research to find a luxury condo for adults, but near the attractions since we were running in the Everest Expedition Challenge at Animal Kingdom. We ended up narrowing it down between Cypress Harbour and Grande Vista, and were very happy with choosing Cypress Harbour. The location is about 1 mile from SeaWorld and about 15 minutes from Disney. We were there to do Disney, Universal, Cocoa Beach and some shopping so we liked this location with easy access right off I-4 because it was in the center of things and extremely convenient. I have nothing bad to say about the Cypress Harbour at all. The staff was exceptional in all aspects. At check-in, the gal showed us the property map, explained the layout, and then let us choose any building we wanted. We got the normal pressure from the "concierge/timeshare host" but after telling them 'not interested' there was no further pressure; no calls to the room, etc. And the cleaning/maintenance staff has to be some of the hardest working that I've ever seen. Every day they were out there cleaning pooldecks, activity areas, sidewalks, etc. The property is just spotless. As for the condo itself, the rooms are very nice and spacious. Ours was a 2 BR with a decent sized kitchen, laundry room, and 2 nice bathrooms. If privacy is an issue the master bathroom can be a little odd. The jacuzzi tub is in the main bedroom, and the shower has a see-through, opaque glass wall to the bedroom. The interior design is a little dated (reminded us of The Golden Girls), but the furniture and fixtures were in very good condition so it seemed like this decor couldn't possibly be 20 years old. I wish we had used it more, but I loved the screened-in lanai also. Free internet in the condo, but it's not Wireless. So I saved the best for last: the property itself. I doubt you could find a property with more to do right on-site. 3 large pools - my favorite being the island pool, plus numerous small kiddie pools and hot tubs. Paddle boats, bike rentals, shuffleboard, basketball courts, outdoor ping pong and billiards, bocce ball, and the list goes on. Also included is one of the nicest workout facilities I've ever seen in a timeshare, with high-end equipment. We didn't have kids with us, but there is a kid activity area also and it appeared to be heavily used by families staying on property, so it told me that it wasn't just for show. There's also a golf course that winds itself through the property. I asked about it, but unfortunately didn't get time to play a round. The clubhouse is actually not on-site and is down the road a short ways. Green fees were $85, or $55 after 2pm. Overall, we'd go back. We might try one of the other properties for comparison, but Cypress Harbour will remain on our short-list of places to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay if you're spending a week or two at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Sinbad06
Reviews.Content: Check-in was very easy. The staff were very helpful and we were given a lot of good information to plan our stay. The location is perfect. Not more than a couple miles from Sea World and just 15 minutes to Disney World. The grounds were spotless and the rooms were very well kept. We were only in town for two days and recommend this location for a week or two stay. Tons of activities, including two pools, playgrounds and other activities. Bike rentals etc. etc. etc. There's no chance of getting bored.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ReenieOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband myself and my 5 year old just spent a week at this property and we were totally pleased. From the minute we arrived at check in everything was great. Problems and the staff was right there. We wished we had more time to spend at the resort, although we did enjoy the parks. The childrens activities were great for our daughter. We are definitely looking forward to future stays here.

Reviews.Title: “lush and peaceful yet near all the attractions”
Reviews.Author: MaKal
Reviews.Content: This timeshare resort is very lush with beautiful accomodations. Units are very spacious, private and peaceful. The property has plenty of activities and is conveniently located near restaurants and attractions. Plan to supply your own toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home..... great!!!”
Reviews.Author: suzyq60
Reviews.Content: An ideal location for all the Parks of Dysney and Seaworld which is nearly next door! The resort is well -kept, clean and the apartments are beautifully furnished and well stocked with washers and dryers.Small supermarket but best to use the Publix which is very close by.for all your groceries etc.... we ate in a lot and took sandwiches and water with us as they are quite pricey in Dysneyworld! Only 10 miles from the airport and quite easy to find so enjoy we will be returning with the grandkids...

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: A_Trini
Reviews.Content: Great hotel- clean, roomy apt and friendly staff...convenient location. We had a great time and will definitely return here or to Harbor lakes across the street. Another gr8 marriott timeshare resort!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: freddiejunior
Reviews.Content: great location with great facilities,something for everyone. all staff first class and ever so helpful would recomend to anyone. all families,couples or single would fit in here

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, central location”
Reviews.Author: sp1005
Reviews.Content: Cypress harbour was a comfortable and friendly resort, in a good location, close to all major theme parks. Although it is close to the interstate, it is like a green oasis in central Orlando. The property is a little dated, and the wired internet connection in the room was a source of constant irritation to my teenage children who came armed with laptops. My main criticism has to be the lack of housekeeping service. Our towels and bedding were not changed during the week and we were told that we would have to pay extra for additional housekeeping service. The resort was clean and welcoming and staff were very friendly and helpful. I would return to this resorts and its location meant a minimal travel time to Disneyworld, Seaworld and the Universal parks.

Reviews.Title: “3rd visit- brilliant condo, with fantastic central location to parks”
Reviews.Author: morgantg_9
Reviews.Content: Next to Sea World and mid-way between Universal & Disney it does not get much better. V. quiet location yet close to all amenities including the Walmart & new upscale supermarket on Turkey Leg road. Perfect for families to visit the parks or spend hours at the pool. We have visited in May, December and July and this is consistently the best place for a family wanting some space in a well equipped unit. Staff are v. helpful and any problems with blown bulbs, clean towels etc are sorted within minutes. Cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “It was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: buzy_mom21
Reviews.Content: I will stay at this resort again and again. It was wonderful. I have a teenage son and pre-teen daughter. Both of them enjoyed themselves. There's a lot to do and you can relax without being bothered. We celebrated our 13th wedding anniversary in peace and quite.

Reviews.Title: “great experience once again”
Reviews.Author: Vintagebydesign
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several resort properties over the past several years, but this remains our favorite. The resort is large, but not enormous, ponds with paddleboats, recreation building, and 2 pool complexes on the property so a few days spent at the resort are a great break from the parks. Location is near Seaworld, you can see the nightly fireworks from the resort. Rooms are consistently well maintained and decorated. A pleasure for young families and extended families, couples and singles. We've stayed here a few times, this would still be our first choice. Christmas week was very busy at Disneyworld, if you travel at that time, be prepared for lines and crowds. Epcot was less crowded, a great week all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: TG2000
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here August 2-9 at a time share we purchased at our high school auction, for a very good price. Our unit in building 63 was comfortable, the ac worked well, water was hot, and beds and pillows were decent. The living and dining room furniture was a bit grungy on the edges and as a multi computer family, the lack of wireless internet was a pain. That said, we have visited Orlando numerous times and stayed at high end Disney properties and other Marriott Hotels, and this complex beats those hands down. It is is extremely convenient to all attractions, generally well kept, and has an ok pool. And if you want a lot of $ can be saved by eating in. Probably most appealing to famiies with pre teens and under.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good week spent at Cypress Harbour”
Reviews.Author: OlympianOn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with during the first week of August after hearing firsthand from several friends and family that Cypress Harbour was a beautiful place to stay -- we were not disappointed. Accompanying us on this trip were my sister and her family who were placed in a condo beside us after we had made the request a few months earlkier. For this we were greatly thankful. The accommodations were roomy, clean, and spacious. We particularly liked the fact that the master bedroom was on the other side of the condomimium and away from the other bedroom. We think that the kids liked their privacy as well. Granite countertops, new appliances, and comfortable beds were standard in the units, and the two bedroom layout allowed for a spacious living room area. Yet despite the positives, there were a couple of negative points that do bear mentioning: our check-in went seamlessly but my sister and her family had to wait until after 5:00 pm until they were allowed in (check-in is at 4:00 pm). Marriott did make amends by allowing for a later check-out time as well as providing a gift certificate. Their week continued to get off to a shaky start as two cockroaches were found in the unit and the AC froze up during the night. Both were attended to by housekeeping and maintenance, and the rest of the week was problem-free. The television in the master bedroom in our unit was a Magnavox that had a bit of a snowy picture. We checked the cable connections, but they were fine so we don't have an explanation for this cause. The TV's in the living room and guest bedroom were both fine picturewise. Despite a couple of bumps in the road at the outset. Cypress Harbour is a beautiful resort with kind and courteous staff. From the front desk to the housekeeping staff to the various guards at the front gate, all were friendly and courteous. You can never go wrong with a smile and a wave. Overall a good week on beautiful grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Great villas, but prepare to be Nickel and Dimed!”
Reviews.Author: n0lajen
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at resorts comparable to this one every summer for 15 years I was surprised by my experience. The villa was great: roomy, relatively up to date, comfortable bed, and clean except for some grime on the living room furniture. The extras were all shockingly low class. For example, the resort does not provide conditioner (only shampoo - i made a special trip to buy conditioner b/c I guess I'm used to everyone - even Motel 6 - providing conditioner so I didn't bring any of my own on trips like this), housekeeping told me I had to wash my own towels if I needed clean ones (although when I spoke with a manager they agreed to bring me some clean ones), you have to pay by the minute to use the computer/internet in the lobby, and to use the resort activities (like mini golf and paddle boats) you have to pay. Maybe I've been extra spoiled at other resorts, but I didn't feel like an honored guest at a full-service resort, I felt like a victim of a marriott money making scheme. I was just glad they didn't slap a fee on using the pool or parking. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for the Perfect Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: tinamarieturner
Reviews.Content: We arrived "early" (around 9:30 a.m.) on July 19th and to our delight, our condo was ready! Everyone was extremely impressed with the quality and cleanliness of our unt. Considering we have four teenages in tow, this is saying a great deal. The location was perfect as we visited Disney and Universal during our stay. We could not have asked for a more gracious staff or more effort on their part to see to our needs. Daily maid service made the stay even more pleasant! We will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: kemmy64
Reviews.Content: we were at the cypress harbour from the 8th of July to the 12th.We stayed in buliding 72 which exceeeded our epectations.Getting to the resort my kids kind of looked dissappointed because the resort looked a liitle old and tired....Getting to our Villa they were overwhelmed with excitement.This was all completely refurbished.The rooms were huge and bed sheets were spotless and fresh.The maid comes in everyday to clean up which was great.The kitchen was also very well equipped.We saved some money by buying Groceries and stocking up in the Refrigerator. Air conditioner worked perfect and the grounds were all well maintained.Could use more Landscapping Sprucing to make the exterior come better alive.We would be staying there next time we visit Orlando.Great value for your money especially when staying in Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: ReclinerDad
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Felt at home and comfortable. Only concern was with the hot water not being hot in shower. I can take a cold shower maybe once, but every day? This should be addressed. Other than that, my family loved this place. Especially after spending a week over at the Westgate Vacation Villas. That place was scary. Marriott property's are great!

Reviews.Title: “Trust Me - the stay was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: 2beaglesPa
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the not so good reviews on this property. I read them and started to question my choice -only to be almost embarrased when we checked into this beautiful place. The staff was phenominal, the property well kept and our room was excellent. I did request a room on the top floor in a newer renovated section so maybe that helped, so if you're concerned you can always do that. But I thought the place was great; again excellent staff and tons of things to do right on site. A 10 minute drive from of the things you want to do in Orlando. We were almost sorry we didn't plan to stay more at the resort. We had one minor issue with what they called sugar ants (apparently from the people before us) but we called and within 5 minutes someone was there. They came again in the morning to check and respray and then had our entire unit done the next day. Never had a problem after that! So if your expectations are reasonable for a nice,clean place to stay while in Orlando, you shouldn't be disappointed. All in all would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location between Disney and Sea World”
Reviews.Author: smnlefty
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott owners and exchanged to this property. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit and our unit faced the lake. Like most Marriott timeshares this place was great and the staff was very friendly and interested in making our stay prefect. We arrived a little early and our unit was not ready. The front desk clerk took my cell phone number and called me within 30minutes and he had found us another unit that was close to the main pool. This property has two larger pool areas and at least one smaller pool. I do think they should add a slide to one of the larger pools. There are plenty of chairs at the pool and it never seemed overly crowded. One of the pools has a volleyball net set up in one of the shallow ends. The only negative thing I can say about the property is that there is no wireless internet in the units. The is a broadband cable in the units and the service is free; however it is slow. In this day and age there is no reason that wireless service can not be installed. We would gladly return to this property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: SquareDaddy
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my wife to her convention held at Disney. My 22 yr old daughter also went with us along with my father and mother-in-law. While my wife was at her conference, we visited Universal one day and stayed by the pool one day. The rooms were very nice and the beds extremely comfortable. The pool areas were nice and clean and were close but not too close to our unit. The unit was well stocked with blender, pots and pans, and all necessary items including wine glasses. The screened porch overlooking the lake was wonderful in the mornings for breakfast and the evenings for cocktail hour. While we were there, the whole building was powerwashed and cleaned. That is why a 20 yr old unit is still in exceptional shape. When we left we could not locate a watch my father in law had hid in the unit (he has alzheimers and hides items). We told Marriott at checkout. Before we could get to Jacksonville, housekeeping had found the watch and called to say they would mail it free of charge. It is great to know there are still honest people in the world. Also, used the fitness center one day. Small but very nice. One night we ventured to a hole in the wall Italian restaurant called Lido's. Nothing fancy but was reasonable and great food. You will need GPS or mapquest to get there. In Summary, Great Place, great people, and good vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott Cypress Harbour!”
Reviews.Author: lask4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one week stay. So sad to leave. We exchanged our California time share through Interval International. Since we toured Disney properties each day we would have really enjoyed this as a two week vacation. There is so much to do on property which we did not take advantage of. We stayed in building 62 which has been recently remodeled and is right next to the Fitness Center. The unit is stunning. The textiles chosen are gorgeous and rich. The jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom was awesome for two people. There was a couch right next to window which was wonderful for gazing out at the lake. The screened in porch has not been highlighted enough in the reviews. NO BUGS while eating outside is terrific. We sat on the porch to eat, talk, read, work on our laptops. Plus there is a ceiling fan. We checked in and headed to the local Wal-Mart which was so much fun!! They had everything we needed foodwise and at incredibly cheap prices. We also picked up cheap sandals and other misc items. We went there after front desk suggested this vs. Publix. The fitness center was deceptively good. They squeezed in all the essentials in a small and well ventilated place. The only bad part to a florida vacation is that the tap water is not delicious. Big deal. We bought 20 water bottles at Wal-Mart for $3!! Wish we lived closer as we would stay here again and again. Oh, we had so much fun at the Prime Outlet Mall!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, convenient location. Nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jghope
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort. My family and I recommend it. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite with kitchenette and family room for a 1 week stay. Also there was a screened in porch which was great to keep out the bugs when the adults were enjoying a cold one at nite on the deck. All appliances were in good working order. Furnishings were well maintained. The rooms were clean and in pretty good condition. The bed and sheets were very comfortable. We had a problem with the A/C one nite but other than that there are no complaints. The pools and the pool area were well maintained. And the surrounding grounds and property of the hotel were beautiful. Especially the nice nature walk nearby. Never had a chance to golf on the adjacent course but I heard it was a quality course. The course looked very tempting. The location of the hotel couldnt be more ideal. Just a quick 10 minute drive to the Disney parks, downtown Disney and Sea World and the Outlet Mall are basically across the street. One minor issue is the Marketplace on the hotel property is very expensive. For example, a 12pk of Miller Lite was $15 and food from the Galley Grill was expensive as well. A medium pizza was $20. Overall, very nice resort. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Singles, couples and families. The hotel was very family friendly. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, GREAT staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pitter4
Reviews.Content: I used the reviews on Trip Advisor in order to make my hotel selection, so I wanted to pass along my experience in case it could assist others! We stayed at this hotel using a guest certificate (we do own other timeshares elsewhere) during the first week of June. The room we received upon check-in was one of the furthest ones out (I had hoped to be closer to the pool, but that was the luck of the draw I figured). That first day we spent $250 on groceries only to find out that our fridge wasn't working correctly. We called the front desk at 9:30 pm and they had a new fridge brought to our room by 10:00 pm. That night I was also concerned that the A/C wasn't working correctly, the handle on the toilet was loose and the wheels were off on the dishwasher rack, but I remained hopeful that everything would be ok! When we ran the dishwasher the next morning we discovered water all over the floor (after I slipped and nearly fell). We called the front desk and they said they would be by to fix it; however, they did offer to move us if we wished. A little paranoid by now we went for the move and requested a room closer to the pool. After getting back from the beach we returned to find that they had fixed the dishwasher (and the A/C!), but they did still let us change rooms and gave us a great one right beside the pool! The staff were superb at responding to our concerns so quickly and kindly. The rooms were very nice with well equiped kitchens, and the pools were great. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: Delawhere
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week over Memorial Day weekend. We have no young children but they had alot for kids to do. When I found out the place was 20 years old, I was shocked! Everything is updated and well taken care of. We really enjoyed our stay!!!! The beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in beside my own.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - Would rate a 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: Comar9
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the villa. It was quite large and definately roomy enough for everyone to have their own space. The master suite was beautiful. Each villa has an enclosed patio, which is very nice. The villa and entire resort were very clean and well maintained. There were staff and landscapers out every day. There are so many ammenities to do at the resort. Unfortunately due to our focus being, going to Disney, we were unable to participate in most of the things they offered. 1 week was not enough time. We would definately revisit this resort and perhaps make time for some of the fun stuff at the resort. The work out room was very well equiped with top of the line equipment. Very nice! It is very close to Disney, dining, downtown disney, shopping, you name it. Easy to access since it is right off the highway. Great resort and would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gbfanFortBelvoir_VA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a Disney trip and we loved it! The villa was gorgeous and had plenty of room for the 6 of us. There was so much to do for the kids and the pools were very nice. I would stay here again in a minute. I could nitpick about small stuff (pools crowded-expected, would have liked more towels but not enough to ask) but we never felt like we had anything to really complain about. Quite happy with the whole thing.

Reviews.Title: “Our most spacious stay ever - loved it - no regrets!”
Reviews.Author: rizzo127
Reviews.Content: I have spent months reading reviews on this hotel and find it appropriate to add my review after our stay here from May 12th through May 19th. We stayed here on a promo for the Marriott Vacation Club, and added 3 nights as renters of this beautiful time share property. It was myself, my two boys (5 & 7) and my father, who we took on vacation as a present. Check in was easy, with friendly service. From the moment we walked in our villa, we knew we picked the right place ! So spacious for the family. The master bedroom was enormous with double sinks, and a massive tub (which we didn't use). We stayed in building 54, close to the club pool. This pool is pretty big with two hot tubs and a kiddie pool. Across the way, is the island pool with tons of activities. We were so busy visiting the parks and family, we only stayed near the club pool when we had the time. I could have spent another day just exploring. Staying on an end unit is great, on the 3rd of 4th floor, to avoid "next door" noise. Most of the time, other than by the pool, we felt we were the only ones there other than the workers driving by in their golf carts always waving hello. Near us was the Island Grill, Pizza Hut, Starbucks, and Krispy Cream Donuts in the store. We bought groceries for breakfast and snacks at the nearby Publix, and enjoyed our full kitchen and daily room service. When you are an owner of a time share, I think you only get maid service on the first day. As a renter, you get it every day. They give you 8 pool towels (two were in the 2nd bath) to use for the pool and they would exchange them for new pool towels daily if needed. The 2nd bedroom is perfect size, except when you pull out the sofa bed. We didn't use that one, but the sofa bed in front of the TV for the kids. I would recommend that kids sleep there as it doesn't look to comfy for adults. The "grown up" beds were very comfortable with celing fans in both bedrooms. There were 3 TVs, and a DVD and VCR player. They have DVD rentals in the lobby as well. The washer/dryer room was so convenient as we did 3 loads of laundry (they give you one complimentary detergent but I packed some extra in my suitcase in a plastic bag with some bounce). They also have an on site photographer if you want family pictures taken. Through our promo, we got a free 5 x 7. You can buy all the tickets for the parks there, at small discounted rates to avoid lines. Sea World is a mile away, as well as many great restaurants. I recommend Bahama Breeze and Lone Star Steakhouse. Good for families and reasonably priced. They even have a place to print your boarding passes in the lobby. With Southwest, you need to check in early to get a good section. They have FREE internet service in the rooms, and we had our laptop hooked up the whole time for us and the kids when we were in the room. Safe in the master closet as well. We are going back next year but staying at the Harbour Villas directly across the street for the kids - as they have the pirate theme for kids at the pool even though are kids were just as happy playing around in the regular pools. If you stay at Cypress, I hope your family enjoys it as much as we did. So nice to stay away from the parks and it felt like home. If only we could afford it year round !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Matt Wendt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent seven nights at Cypress Harbour (Apr. 26 – May 3) as a timeshare trade through Interval International. Not having children, we specifically chose this resort thinking it would be less family oriented. Although it wasn’t, we enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend this resort. Likes: - Nice sized two bedroom/two bath unit with washer and dryer and screen porch in every unit. - Updated furniture, beds and carpeting. - Large kitchen, with dish washer. - Two sink vanity, large closet and two-person whirlpool tub in master suite. - Free, in room safe - Excellent room darkening shades - Fresh, well maintained landscaping - Convenience store was well stocked. Nice options for a quick lunch or snack! - Poolside bathrooms had shower facilities. Very nice when lounging around the pool on checkout day, waiting for a late afternoon flight. - Centrally located to all of Orlando’s top attractions and very accessible to main highways. About 15 minutes from the airport. - Very friendly and helpful staff! Concierge made a great dining recommendation for Columbia restaurant in Celebration. - Small but decent exercise facility with updated cardio equipment - Lots of activity options (free and paid) for families of all ages. - Ample parking - Free high speed internet Dislikes: - Guest bedroom closet was rather small - Guest bedroom would be very cramped if one chose to use the hide-a-bed - Unit was generally clean, until you started looking in the nooks and crannies - Food from pool side grill was below average - Kitchen had the very basics (4 plates, 4 bowls, 1 pitcher…) - Additional charge for mid-week change of bed linens and towels. This is often included at other timeshare resorts. - Limited dining options immediately nearby. We found the best options at the Pointe Orlando Mall about 10 minutes away. - Like our room, the grounds were generally clean and tidy, until you started looking in the nooks and crannies. For example, the landscaping in front or our unit was riddled with small pieces of rubbish, as if someone had dumped their garbage and only the big stuff got picked up. - The Main pool and Island pool were very busy (and loud) with small children. The pool near the recreation center was much more peaceful and relaxing. - A little skimpy on the quantity and quality of the soaps and shampoos. - The tap water tasted terrible! - It took a long time to get hot water in the shower but running out was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A litttle outdated, pools a little small, overall just ok”
Reviews.Author: aprata
Reviews.Content: We are here for one week in a two bedroom two bath unit May 15-22. Check in staff was very friendly, we checked in at 2 am. Location is close to Sea World and convenient to Disney. The apartments are well equipped, spacious, but they show age. The pools are a little small for a big resort and the Island pool was really crowded wit kids. I also disliked that there are no towels at the pools, you are given 6 towels in the room and must always carry them to the pool - one towel barely covered half a chair, you would need a couple of towels per person to cover your chair and also another one to wipe. Overall it's a good place to stay - a little above average for a timeshare (we stayed in many timeshares in US and Mexico), no luxury feel, but convenient for families. It is clean but they could do a better job with spider webs in ceiling corners and on hallways. Free parking and free high speed cable internet were appreciated. I would stay here gain.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Location and price”
Reviews.Author: glory4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before our house rental was avalable. We were on the fourth floor(which I would request) and it was an easy trip up the elevators even with four adults and 1 child's luggage. The suite was VERY roomy and super clean. It was the largest of the timeshare resorts that we have ever stayed at, in terms of suite size. We had a two bedroom villa and it slept us comfortably. The master bedroom was massive, with a beautiful circular tub that our son loved to swim in. The second bedroom had a queen bed along with a pullout sofa. The living room had a pullout sofa as well. We did enjoy the main pool one day and our son loved the infinity whirlpool! The location was ideally located to both Disney and Seaworld. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and were amazed at how clean the entire resort was. We would return!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for family of five”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoSnowMom3
Reviews.Content: I never travel without thoroughly exhausting the reviews on this site and need to add my two cents as "pay back." The Marriott Cypress Harbour is wonderful!! We are owners at another Marriott resort and traded a week for a Spring Break trip with the three kids to Disney. The reviews posted here were spot on. Cypress Harbour met and exceeded our expectations (and we like nice things, places, restaurants, etc.) The villas are large (yes, the second bedroom is small especially when the sofa bed is pulled out, but our two boys did just fine in it.) Our daughter used the sleeper sofa in the living room and in that way had her "own" room too. We never felt cramped or on top of each other. Having a full kitchen and washer/dryer is a must for us. Prior to our arrival we ordered and had groceries delivered. We cooked at least one meal every day and ran a load of wash each day too. While we did do the parks for 5 out of the 7 days, the two days spent at the resort were a lot of fun. We could have spent another week just laying by the pools, enjoying the lake, and playing ping pong, etc. The kids even did one night at the Kids Club while mom and dad had an evening out. They went fishing, played video games, ate pizza, played basketball and did crafts. They thought their night out without mom and dad was great too! Several years ago we did the same trip but stayed at the Marriott Grande Lakes. We much preferred Cypress Harbor! We would stay at the Cypress Harbour again without reservation. It was also nice to be off of Disney property for the quiet .... I could never do Disney 24/7!!! My husband has a hard time just doing Disney for more than 6 hours!! We could leave a crowded park and be "home" in 15 minutes before anyone truly melted down. If you are traveling with kids, like space, privacy, quiet, and many of the comforts of home, you can't go wrong with the Cypress Harbour. I spent hours and hours making sure we stayed at what would be the best place for our family and this was it!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Disappointing Service and Policies”
Reviews.Author: globetrottermom
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Cypress Harbour where we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite as an exchange owner (our family owns several weeks at other Marriott Vacation Club locations). While the resort is for the most part very nice, there were a few infuriating things about the place that keep me from writing a more positive review. The service at this resort is friendly, yet ineffective. For example, after 4 answered calls over the course of the day to the concierge to make a dinner reservation I ended up having to trek down to the office to find a human to speak with. Once there, the concierge was friendly, but the point is, 4 calls and an in person trip should not be required to get anything done. Similarly, it took 3 calls to replace a dirty blanket for my son's bed. On the subject of blankets, I found the following infuriating: In the lovely, spacious, well appointed master suite there is a comfy bed with a lovely duvet. In the minuscule second bedroom there is a comfy queen bed with the same duvet and a bony mattress pull out sofa with an acrylic blanket. My two boys did not wish to share a bed so the youngest opted for the pull out. Upon making the bed I saw that the acrylic blanket was not only sad, it was covered in hair. This is when I placed call #1 for a blanket. I asked if they could send a duvet so my sons could both have the same bedding. The answer was: "No, it's against our policy to". There was plenty of vacancy, what trouble would it have been for them to provide one? Disappointed, I said that we would settle for a blanket that didn't have pubic hair on it. After 3 calls, one arrived. One sad, synthetic blanket. To me, as an owner especially, unacceptable. The blanket was not comfortable for my son, so I tried again and again, was rebuffed. They offered to send a comforter, which sounded like a fair substitute. When the "comforter" arrived it was an old slippery nylon bed spread, probably retired from an older unit. Icky. Ordinarily, properties like this do what they can to make owners and guests happy and comfortable during their stay. At Cypress Harbour I heard a whole lot of NO and little, if nothing was done to make my stay comfortable. Given the cost of owning and maintaining 2 bedroom units, this is unacceptable. The resort makes it clear that there are 3 classes of guest: 1. Renters (the lowest on the totem pole-- good luck to you if you fall into this category), 2. Exchange owners (second class citizens as I experienced) and 3. Owners (perhaps they are nicer to you, I can only hope). When I called about daily tidy service I was told that it was only for owners-- if I wanted this service I could do so for a fee. Apparently owning several weeks in Marriott isn't good enough to get your waste basket emptied and your bed made. Tisk tisk. My other complaint lies in the layout of the second bedroom. For all the massive space of the 2 bedroom villa, the second bedroom is cramped. When the pull out sofa is opened there is hardly any room to move about and you cannot open the dresser. Every time you want to get something out of the dresser or closet you need to fold up the bed. Annoying. Especially considering the vast amount of space in the rest of the villa. I would only return to this property again if I were to speak with a manager ahead of time to insure that both my children could obtain comfortable bedding. Aside from the complaints with the slow response time and bedding the resort itself was well appointed and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Altitude9600
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by Cypress Harbour. First of all the check-in took maybe 3 minutes from when I entered the registration office to when I walked out with my villa keys. Then the villa itself was huge and gorgeous. The kids' bedroom had a queen and a pull-out double/sofa with its own tv. The living room was huge and had a great big tv, then the master was really huge and had a big tv. Now we are not tv people but I can see where that might have been nice. The only thing we ever check on vacation is the weather channel and the kids watch nick. The best part of the layout was the kids' bedroom was on the opposite end of the unit from the master, so it was very private, and the kids bed and bath could be closed off completely from the rest of the unit by a door, so in a sense it was like having two masters. Overall just a well-thought out floor plan and both baths were big and had tubs. The master had an enormous spa tub and a shower plus double sinks. The kitchen was also very well laid out with a bar, granite counter tops, dishwasher, etc. Super nice! The unit also had its own laundry room with full-size washer and dryer, which are indispensable if you ask me. The room came with 8 bath towels and 7 beach/pool towels, all very high quality unlike you get at most resorts. The swimming pools were great also. Not one thing to complain about with Cyress Harbour, hopefully next time we are in Orlando I will be able to rebook here! Oh yeah and believe it or not you get free hi speed internet in your room , which is unheard of at "resorts".

Reviews.Title: “Nice Relaxed and Comfortable Resort”
Reviews.Author: mtgreen96
Reviews.Content: It is late but better late than never :-) This is a great family resort if you are traveling with children. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and that was more than enough room for 3 teenage girls and my husband and I. The grounds are well maintained and security is tops everytime we left and came back they always have you stop at the guard house. the sundry shop is a bit pricey but there is a publix grocery store up the road where we did most of our shopping. The kitichen is stocked with everything you could possibly need, dished, pots, pans, blender etc... it also comes with a washer and dryer. I would say it was like a mini apartment. The Suite itself is very colorful the Master bedroom is big and roomey the patio is closed in so that you can just sit outdoors and enjoy the fresh air without the bugs getting at you. All in all this is a very well maintained family resort.

Reviews.Title: “As perfect a vacation as we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: rar6621
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cypress Harbour for two 14-day stints first in January and again in March; family and friends joined us each time. Facilities are excellent in every way, beautiful grounds, wonderful pools, excellent exercise room and lots to do. Our villa had all the comforts of home, well equipped with most everything we needed . We especially enjoyed the barbecue grill nearby, cooked out often and dined in the screened in porch off the villa. Villa comfortably accommodated four adults. Cypress Harbour is close to everything, but you have the wonderful feeling of being far removed from the traffic and crowds of Orlando. Quite honestly, once we got there, we hardly left the grounds. Just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...again!”
Reviews.Author: QuietWater
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this resort and it was just as nice! This visit we really stayed at the resort more instead of going to the parks every day. The activities calender is packed with fun, neat things to do...especially the ice cream party :-) The rooms were clean and well stocked. We were able to eat every meal on the patio, great view, nice weather. Every time we saw or spoke to a staff member they smiled and were helpful. It looks like they have started renovating some of the buildings which is good. Our furnishings were nice but looked like they will need replacement soon. The location is quiet and convenient to shopping, parks and International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, spacious, bright, relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: trvlrfromMA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in February '09. The rooms are as advertised and as reviewed here. I found the beds very comfortable and our teen who slept on the pull out sofa in the second bedroom even said that provided a good night's sleep. We were in building 64 "Islamadora" and this was a great location - on the lake with a lovely view from the porch (we even caught a slight view of the fireworks at 9pm each night). Close to the pools (there are 3 of them) and close to the activity and boating center. My parents stayed with us and we never felt crowded since the units are so spacious. We would prefer a larger second bedroom with 2 beds instead of the one bed and pull out sofa. The hot tub in the master is just a huge waste of space - it seems Marriott has dispensed with these old space hogs in their newer timeshares - yeah! We enjoyed the island pool but found the hot tubs here sub standard as most of the jets simply did not work. The clubhouse pool was great and the hot tubs there were toasty and operating perfectly. We did not use the smaller third pool by the activity center but my parents thought is was a PLUS that this pool was designated quiet and adults only for portions of the day which, had we spent more time there, they felt they would have really enjoyed. We enjoyed the activity center - rented a pontoon boat which was fun. My daughter loved ferrying me around the lake. We also did spend one day at the resort and did the tie-dye activity and played some video games in the arcade and enjoyed the ice cream sundae offering. My parents also caught the Hawaiian Luau one night at the clubhouse and while they thought it would be better outdoors (it was held indoors due to cold weather) they really enjoyed the show. Bottom line, there is enough to do here to just relax and enjoy the resort. Acitivites we wish we had done: rented the quad bikes, done the mini golf course and done a second round out on the lake in the swan paddle boats. This being said, however, I (and the kids) do believe the "fun" factor for kids is higher at the more elaborately pirate themed Marriott Horizons across the street where we stayed this same time last year but you can't beat the comfort and relaxed atmosphere here at Cypress. Our only (and minor) complaints: The kitchen just did not have enough pans and bakeware - we had only a single fry pan that was not non-stick and EVERYTHING stuck to it making a disaster of a morning when we tried to make pancakes and left us juggling to cook the bacon. They need more than a single fry pan and please make it nonstick! We also bought muffins and quick bread to make only to find no muffin pans and no loaf pans - kind of ruined our scheme for quick and easy breakfasts. I guess they just assume folks really don't cook even though they provide a full kitchen? I also didn't like the sub par hot tubs at the island pool - I made the kids go to the clubhouse pool every time even though it was further away. My parents also complained of an electrical fan/humming noise at night although we did not hear this in the other bedroom. I also found the shower layout in the master a bit odd - the toilet and shower are enclosed in a seperate room while the sinks and whirlpool tub are open to the room itself. However, the shower also has a frosted glass wall that also is viewable from the room. I guess they plan on couples only in the masters at Marriotts (the shower was also viewable from the room itself at Horizons) but it offers less privacy than some might want if sharing without a significant other. My daughter and I actually shared the master and I routinely found myself banned from the room as she showered due to lack of privacy! Not a big deal - but a bit strange - these are not "honeymoon" suites - they are family oriented - just give folks some privacy in the shower already! Overall we'd recommend this resort is you want a spacious, bright, comfortable place to stretch out and relax. I can't imagine why folks would pack their families into tiny hotel rooms at Disney prices when you can have a spacious full living room, kitchen and two seperate bedrooms at Marriott vacation properties. If your younger kids want a higher "fun" factor - stay across the street at Horizons. If you want comfort, quiet, lovely grounds and many nice pool options - stay at Cypress.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than We Expected”
Reviews.Author: RMFD94
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a week's stay at Cypress Harbour. From the day we checked-in to the day we checked-out, everything was perfect. The suites have all the comforts of home and are very spacious. The previous reviews which describe the suites and the resort facilities are accurate, so I will not repeat them. Don't let the negative reviews about this place discourage you. No place is perfect, but this resort makes every effort to maintain the highest standards. If you want peace and quiet (like we did), there are suites at the far end of the resort overlooking a golf course. It is a bit of a walk to the pools, but we appreciated the tranquility. Compared to the miles we walked during the course of days at EPCOT and the Magic Kingdom, it was nothing. And speaking of Disney, it was such a relief at the end of a LONG day at the parks to arrive back at Cypress Harbour. There is such a thing as Disney overload (i.e. the crowds, the noise, the theme music, the lines) and it was good to get away from it. The best advice we followed from a previous reviewer is to stock up on supplies at the Publix supermarket about a mile away (you can find it quickly using GPS). We bought water to take with us each day at the parks and also stocked up on breakfast supplies (cereal, milk, juice, muffins and fruit) to have each morning in our suite. We also bought bread, peanut butter and jelly for making sandwiches for our picky eaters. This resort is well worth the money and we look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Beat This Place For Family Get-Togethers!”
Reviews.Author: sthomas0616
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd visit to this Marriott timeshare and we absolutely love the place! We hook up with my daughter and her family (including in-laws) and we all meet at Cypress Harbour for a wonderful holiday visit - this year the weather was a bit chilly but that didn't stop the kids from going in the pool - and, what a pool area it is - there's not one area but around 3 different places you can go to swim - one is a very secluded island pool - gorgeous. And, the rooms are huge - w/jacuzzi tub for two, balcony overlooking a beautiful lake, large dining and kitchen area, two spacious bedrooms and 2 bathrooms - there is so much to do in this area trying to figure out where to stay shouldn't be a priority and, with the knowledge that Cypress Harbour is so close to everything and has everything we're looking for - you'll be seeing us every year - count on it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort -- great location”
Reviews.Author: LetsBeFrank
Reviews.Content: I traded into this resort through Interval International, and it was a very nice resort. We were able to check in around 1PM on Sunday (the regular check in time is 4PM), and we ended up with a 2BR unit on the back side of the resort. Nice view of the golf course, and just a small walk to the Island pool. The unit itself was very clean and updated, the beds super comfortable. I didn't mind the setup with the shower in the master BR, but it was a little odd. The activity center had a ton of nice activities set up, either free or with a modest charge. The staff was very friendly ! I hope we can swap into this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “The best resort we have stayed at ...”
Reviews.Author: lawtonjl2002
Reviews.Content: This was the best resort we have stayed at since owing our time share for six years. We exchanged into this resort and would recommend it highly. Marriot knows what they are doing with guest relations. Everyone from check in staff, maintainance, groundskeepers, boat staff, etc. was so friendly and helpful. The location was great. We enjoyed Sea World fireworks each night as we were located behind the park. Needless to say we could get around to many attractions if we choose but there is so much to do right at the resort you don't have to venture out. The resort has three pools, boat rides, walking trails, basketball, billards, ping-pong, videos, etc. We enjoyed the roomy feeling the resort has. It is laid out so you are not on top of others. I cannot write enough wonderful things about this resort. We hope to return when we travel to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “potential to be nice but some issues”
Reviews.Author: CelesteDenver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family from Jan 2-7, 2009. I spent very little time in the hotel as I marched from dusk till dawn around Disney. However, my husband was ill and spent a great deal of time in the resort. The grounds were lovely and the suite itself was well kept and attractive. However, there were several issues that kept us from full enjoyment. The hot water did not work properly in the morning. The first time I thought it was a fluke, but the second time, I left it running for over 15 minutes before it started to get warm. When I took afternoon showers it heated right up. There were two minor issue with the tv remote not working properly and the glass plate in the microwave being too large to turn, so food did not heat properly. One night returning at 11 from the parks with two sleeping children in our arms, the key to the suite didn't work. As you can imagine, this was a drag. We thought the key had become demagnetized, but when the security guard came over to let us in he said something about the lock inside not being perfectly horizontal, and thus the key didn't work! Two mornings later, I noticed the security deadbolt in the room hanging off its hinges with screws nearly completely out of the wall. I was unable to determine when this happened, but when I called security they could say that no one had tried to use the card key lock since we entered the room the night prior. They did replace the lock that day. The unsettling thing about this is that in order for this lock to be in place and the damage to be done, someone had to be in the room with the lock in place when it happened. Housekeeping was very kind, keeping up with the tremendous mess caused by me being out at the parks all day and dh being parked in the room! On our last night we returned to the room around 9:30 p.m. to find that the parking at our building and both of the adjacent buildings was completely blocked off for repaving. This was extremely inconvenient with bags to haul up, and again, sleeping children to haul. The next morning dragging the same tired children and luggage across the lot at 6:30 wasn't much fun either. We did enjoy the pool and hot tubs as did the children (5 and 7) and did the nature walk which wasn't much to write home about!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Hullsfarm
Reviews.Content: I went to Marriott Cypress Harbour Dec 7-14 with my daughters 8 and 13. What a beautiful resort. The security was great. Pools and grounds were clean and well maintained. Our unit was huge and well stocked. The food on site was great. My 8 year old participated in the activity center games and ice cream social - she had a blast! The beds and pillows were comfortable and the room darkening shades were an added benefit! The staff was friendly and knowledgable. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: LeaDickinson
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this resort for the week of Thanksgiving. We were here on a timeshare exchange. I must say prior to going down there, we were nervous due to the reviews we read - but we were pleasantly surprised upon arrival. We had a 2 Bedroom Unit on the ground floor at the far end of the grounds. Although it was far away from the pools, that was fine with us becuase it was quiet and relaxing. The rooms were absolutely immaculate and decorated very nicely. The kitchen was fully stocked with all the utensils one could need while you're on vacation We were never bothered about time share, we only got 1 call concerning that, and were never bothered again. All 3 pools were very nice. We really liked the island pool at night with the waterfall and jacuzzi. Having a little market on site was nice when you just needed something little and didn't want to bother going to the store. It was especially nice since they had Krispy Kreme Doughnuts! The have a 'nature walk' trail that I must say we were disappointed in. It wasn't very long, and wasn't very nice to look at . But it was something to do. I've stayed at many timeshares throughout the country and the Caribbean, and I must say this was one of the nicest ones we have stayed in (next to the Marriot in Hilton Head, SC.) So the people who are complaining must either have nothing better to do than complain, or have extremely high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Marriott once agian”
Reviews.Author: wyannuzzi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought a time share 3 years ago at Cypress Harbour because we go to Orlando every other year and figured we would get alot of use out of it. We finally got to use it for the first time this year with our 3 daughters ages 17, 13 and 12. We also used one of our banked years to bring friends of the family down with us who also had 3 daughters the same age as ours. My wife and I are so glad we purchased our time share at CH. The place is beautiful and clean. We arrived early on Thanksgiving day and were able to get in our room as soon as we arrived shortly before noon. Our friends room had a problem with the plumbing (the dishwasher overflowed and soaked the carpet) and they had a new room within 10 minutes. The pools and grounds are immaculate and the rooms are very roomy. Our friends were also very impressed, I wouldn't be surprised if they purchased a time share soon!!! It is very conveniently located by Sea World, 10 minutes from Universal and 15 minutes from all Disney parks. I highly recommend Cypress Harbour for your vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: wrisberg
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time staying here, 1st time 1996 then 2005 and again 11-18 October this year. It was a timeshare exchange and well worth it. The room is massive, plenty of space for all of us ( 2 adults and 10 year old triplets). The jacuzzi bath was fantastic, the kids looked forward to having one every night while they watched George Lopez (our new favourite programme) on the TV. Everything was absolutely spotless and must have been refurbished as everything was as new when I first went in 1996, the cupboards are well equipped with everything you could possibly need. There were no insects even although we were on the ground floor, and staff were constantly cleaning and gardening everywhere we went, even cleaning the sun loungers. The staff were also very nice and approachable and everybody said "hello". We went for an early check-in and were in our room for 09.30 which was great, so we could use the facilities from first thing in the morning. There is so much to do you don't need to go to the parks, the kids are well catered for and so are the adults, it is just the best place in the world to go on holiday. I have stayed at both Grande Vista and Horizons which are great but this is just better. How this place has received some negative reviews I will never know. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely ground in a great location but worn and dated furnishings”
Reviews.Author: Partsky
Reviews.Content: This resort has the most beautiful grounds and some great facilities throughout the site.. Not to be picky though, it is sometimes too big if you want to reach things relatively easily. For example, we stayed in August and had 3 days of heavy rain. We were miles away from the activity centre and main area with the pizza hut so felt a bit isolated. However, this is a matter of opinion.We were pleased with the size of the rooms and the facilities within but the furnishings are, for want of a better word, tatty. This particularly applied to the wood furnishings, such as TV cabinets, dressers, etc which were chipped and worn. Come on, Marriott. Its a lovely place but you get better furnishing in much lower priced properties. After all, it is not in any way a value priced resort. Also, 10am checkout is a bit ridiculous, even for Florida. Mixed feelings about returning. although the grounds and great location may call us back

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Harbour: Relaxation at its Best”
Reviews.Author: KAILUAKID
Reviews.Content: My wife and I began our two week Florida vacation at the Cypress Harbour. We joined my sister who arranged this resort for us as she had special rates. We spent one week at Cypress and my sister gave me the honeymoon bedroom which had a jacuzzi as she took the smaller bedroom. The unit consisted of two bedrooms, two baths, kitchen with stove, refrigerator and other appliances including dishwasher as well as a washer and clothes dryer. The unit also had a screened porch as well as three large flat screen TV sets (one in each bedroom and other in the parlor) I really enjoyed myself and it was really total relaxation especially after a day of visiting one of the Disneyworld Parks. You dont confront other residents, you just relax. What was especially good was our unit was centrally located and it was on the ground floor. The swimming pool and whirlpool was nearby and the fitness room as well as the rental/activity center was next door. My wife and I did the minature golf and the theme two person paddling boat which was shaped as a white swan. You paddle around their man made lake. You can even fish there. I did not check in or out as my sister was responsible. She even drove the the day before (from the Panama City area) to spend the night at the Resort so when we arrived we would go directly to our unit as our flight from Hawaii was a long one. The maid did come in the first day but after that you were on your own. Heck, when the towels were dirty we washed it ourselves. Resort employees were always cordial and explained things in a cheerful manner . The only slight perfection was the water temperature in the room jacuzzi did not really get hot but only lukewarm. Marriott needs to invest in larger and more powerful hot water heaters...I deducted a third of a point for this and my final rating was 4.66 out of a 5.00 for the Cypress Harbour. Beside selecting Cypress Harbour and paying for this lodging my sister (Brenda) also treated us to see Blue Man Group at the Universal Studios Theme Park. Was my wife (Diane) really serious when she stated to me in private she was willing to trade her brother for my sister Brenda?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: ChattanoogaMcmom
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 stayed 4 nights at the property as part of an invitation to attend a Marriott Vacation presentation. The grounds were beautiful, the facilites that we used were terrific (pool, miniature golf, bocce, poontoon boat ride), the staff was courteous and professional, and the condo was beautiful, spacious, and very clean. The location was very convenient to many attractions and shopping areas, and we appreciated the gated security. The only negative was in the master bedroom. Although lovely and the bed was very comfortable, there was a huge jacuzzi tub in the middle of the room with no way to separate the bathroom area from the bedroom. This became a nuisance when my early-rising husband needed to shower and get ready for the day much earlier than I was ready to get up. Everything else in the condo was wonderful....including the nice extra bedroom with a queen bed and sofa and the attached bathroom, the large laundry area, and plenty of kitchen and living area space. We would consider returning to this property on our next vacation to Orlando even though we could probably find a less expensive resort. As an aside....although we chose not to purchase a Marriott Vacation Timeshare, the salespeople we talked with we very professional and not pushy at all. Staying at Cypress Harbor was definitely a benefit in agreeing to take the tour and sitting through a 2 hour presention.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: RetiredGrandma08
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare through Interval International and couldn't have been more pleased. I was traveling with my daughter and son-in-law and 1 year old granddaughter. I had called the resort previously to ask for a building convenient to one of the pools and we had a second floor accomodation in bldg. 64 which is convenient to everything. I had also asked for a crib & highchair which was not in the room when we arrived but upon calling it arrived within 10 minutes time. The rooms were clean, inviting and the kitchen immaculate. All Marriott staff were friendly and helpful. The pool never had more than 10-12 people at any one time. Check out was done from the room and we hated to leave. I will definitely go back, my children ended up buying a Marriott timeshare at Horizons that is being built across from the Cypress Harbour. Worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Why would I buy into this?”
Reviews.Author: peppydrummer
Reviews.Content: We only needed a night or two so that we could meet our grown son, who lives in Florida, and he planned to stay with us. We are not members of Marriott Vacation Club, but we have stayed at Grande Vista for a couple of nights. We wanted the extra space so that our son could stay with us. Check-in was great; everyone was friendly. My daughter asked about the nature trail, and we were told by the clerk at the front desk that she had never been on it because she heard there were gators and snakes on the trail. Enough said there; we skipped that. Upon arriving at our unit, everything looked great. Then we discovered there was only one bed in the second bedroom. Nobody wanted a pull-out, so my son went back to his place 1-1/2 hours away. After going to the bathroom, I found that we could see through the glass shower wall from the bedroom in detail. That was fine. We could live with it.....until the next morning. It took at least 10 minutes to get warm water. I had to flip the shower handle around a few times to find out where the hot water was located. It was only lukewarm. So I went to the 2nd bathroom to get a shower. I got up early, so that was no problem. I let the water run a few minutes to an acceptable temp., then almost got in the tub. I looked down at the water accumulating in the shower, and there was white globs of soap and scum. No way was I getting a shower here. I went back to the big bathroom and decided I'd brave the colder water, which had now warmed up a bit more. I got in the shower and felt like I was putting on a show to anyone in the BR. My husband said the same thing. Our daughter refused to use her bathroom and came into ours while we went outside. She took a quick shower, let me tell you. But because of all of us having to use only one bathroom, we were late checking out. That's another thing. Can you believe for a stay of one night (we would have stayed longer if things were more acceptable and if our son could have stayed with us), we had to check out at 10 am? Good grief! The unit looked dated and worn out, even though we were told at check-in that they were putting us in a newly renovated building. Ha! Newly renovated, but dirty and not really finished construction-wise. The bathrooms were missing some moldings and weren't finished off. The walls in the bathrooms were filthy, and all doors were grimy on and around doorknobs. Bugs were everywhere. I'm glad we didn't use the pool or public areas. Can you imagine how clean they might be if housekeeping could not clean one bathtub? The outside lights stay on all the time and cannot be turned off. So if you go out at night, be prepared for a million bugs to come in when you open the front door. There was also something about the security that I felt very uncomfortable with. The gatehouse was fine, but there was something unnervy once we got into the unit. This place would be so beautiful if housekeeping took a little more time. I'm used to staying in hotels and motels, over 50 nights a year. I'm used to bugs and a little dirty housekeeping. But why would I want to pay over $8,000 and up to $20,000 to join a MVC to get a dump like this? Once you book and stay a night, how would you ever get out of staying anywhere else during your vacation? I will never again book a stay at Cypress Harbour!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: lvetotrvel
Reviews.Content: The property is nice and our rooms were spacious and clean. We used the kitchen and the washer/dryer really came in handy. We also had a lovely view of the golf course. What I did not like about this property is the location of our rooms to all the pools and exercise room. Our building was at the very end. The property is pretty spread out and you have to walk quite a ways to get to the pools. We shortened our stay because of this and decided to go to JW Marriotts for a much lower price and included breakfast too. Overall, the property and service is not bad. Our stay would have been perfect if we were closer to the pools and exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and a little dirty”
Reviews.Author: Gallags
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at Cypress Harbour from 5th to 19th August and have been staying at CH for the past 8 years, It is now looking a little dated and the furnishings need updating. There were bugs, spiders webs and mold on the patio bug screen and this spoiled our morning breakfast on the patio. Marriott seem to be investing in their newer properties which still have time share sales going on.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Resort for larger families”
Reviews.Author: cab1118
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott's Cypress Harbour from July 27 - August 2, 2008. We booked through a Marriott time share solicitation and got a great deal on 4 nights. We then booked the other 2 nights on our own. Most of what you read in these reviews is true. The resort is clean, people are friendly, the pools are great and not too crowded, the location is perfect to get to Disney, Universal, or International Drive. Really our only "complaint" was the size of the second bedroom. We are a family of 5 (mom, dad, and 3 teenagers). The master bedroom is huge with a king size bed, jacuzzi, and large bath area with 2 sinks. The second bedroom is tiny with one queen/double bed a pullout sofa. When you pulled out the sofa to accommodate 3 kids in the room, there was no room to move or even open dresser drawers. We always stay in 2 bedroom condo types of resorts and we have always had 2 double beds in the second bedroom. It just seemed to be an odd use of space to make the master bedroom huge and the second one tiny. We ended up having one kid in the bed, one in the pullout in the bedroom, and one in the pullout in the livingroom (the sectional also has a pullout). It was just inconvenient if one of the kids wanted to get into the dresser or closet, they couldn't if their brother was still asleep in the pullout in the bedroom. Other than that, the boys enjoyed the basketball courts and we loved the screened porch to sit and have coffee in the morning. We also had a problem with the refrigerator fan freezing up and making a very loud (almost jet engine quality) noise. When I called to have it fixed, someone came right away. However, the next day, it started again. We called again, they came again to fix it, but it started up with the noise the next day. We spent a lot of time at Universal and ate out every night so we just didn't bother to pursue it. I think that particular unit will need a new frig. While we pointed out some slight issues, overall it really is a very family friendly resort. I would consider staying there again but only when my oldest is in college and I would only have 2 kids in tow instead of three. I think for families with younger kids, it would be fantastic. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: BargainBuyer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantastic week at Marriott’s Cypress Harbour. If you vacation with a teen-ager, you know that vacation choices can be challenging.
