However, we three adults and one teen had a wonderful time. The resort is a short drive from Orlando airport. Check-in was courteous, prompt and efficient. (Thank you Barbara). We requested in advance and received a corner unit on the top (third) floor. Our unit was beautifully decorated and was huge. The master bedroom had a king bed with Jacuzzi tub and separate room with a shower/toilet. Twin sinks were conveniently outside the enclosed bathroom area. The second bedroom had a queen bed and a fold out couch. It also had its own bathroom / shower. The kitchen featured granite counter tops, microwave, dishwasher, garbage disposer, stove and large refrigerator with ice maker. Dishes, silverware, pots, pans, cooking utensils, water pitcher, etc were all available. There was a dining room with a table and seating for six. The large living area had a sectional sofa with tables at each end and a central cocktail table. An entertainment center hosted a 36” television and DVD player. Each of the bedrooms also had its own tv set. A desk midway between the kitchen and living room provided a work area with wired internet access. The public areas had wireless access. The unit had a utility room with full sized washer and dryer, cleaning utensils and storage area. We also had a screened in balcony with table and chairs for four and overhead fan. We were able to see the fireworks at SeaWorld at 9:15 p.m. from the balcony (call SeaWorld for firework display times). Our unit was spotless. All the furniture and carpets appeared to be in excellent condition. We had absolutely no complaints about our beautiful accommodations. The grounds are very pretty, and in a constant state of upkeep. Every person we passed – housekeeping, maintenance, activities personnel, etc., greeted us in a friendly manner. We have been to Orlando and the theme parks before. This vacation we decided to really relax and spent most of our time at Cypress Harbour. There were scheduled activities each day including bingo, exercise classes, family fishing tournament in the lake, crafts, ice cream social, live bands, “Are You Smarter than a Fifth-Grader” competition (adults versus the kids, and the adults lost), a “dive-in movie” at the pool, camp fire and S’mores. Although some of the activities were an additional cost it really was nominal ($3 to $5). HINT – at check-in you will be given a booklet with the week’s activities. The last page has a family scavenger hunt game. Answer the questions and bring it to the Activities Center for a VIP card. This gives you discounts on some activities and allows you to do some for free. We also participated in some of the games and were given prizes of free bike and boat rentals. In addition, we played tennis daily, and tried shuffleboard, billiards and mini-golf. Activity Center employees were all enthusiastic and friendly. Of course, we spent time in the Florida sun by one of the three pools. There were always chairs and loungers available in the sun or shade. We had no problem with people “reserving” chairs who weren’t there. The Island pool and Bayside pool were quieter when we visited them. We spent most of our pool time at the Clubhouse pool since it was adjacent to the outside bar and Market Grill Café. We enjoyed salads and lunch items at the café. We used the hot tubs by the pools, but never did get to the sauna. We generally ate breakfast “at home” and had lunch at the pool. We stocked up on food at the beginning of the week at the Super Wal-Mart, about 20 minutes away. There is also a Publix supermarket that is closer; we made an end of the week run there for some additional supplies. Dinners we ate out at one of the numerous local restaurants. We did take a day trip to Melbourne Beach (about an hour away) to swim in the ocean, and to view the PostSecrets exhibit at the Brevard Art Museum. In closing, it was a great vacation – we loved the Cypress Harbour and can’t wait to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely will return!”
Reviews.Author: smtt
Reviews.Content: Fantastic resort! I did a timeshare exchange through Interval International during Spring Break. After much research, we chose Marriott’s Cypress Harbour based on the many, many positive reviews on trip advisor. We thought the resort would be so crowded that we would have to wake up at the crack of dawn to get lounge chairs, especially for the time of year we chose. Not the case. The resort has 3 pools – plenty of space for everyone. The staff was friendly, rooms were clean and furniture was in good shape. The grounds were very well maintained. I sent an email to the resort a month or so before our trip requesting a building close to the main pool. They delivered. Our building was the 3rd one from the lobby/main pool, so a quick walk to and from the pool. Our view was of the lake, the screened balcony was equipped with a table and chairs. It was great to sit and have your morning coffee with the lake as your view…very relaxing. I have been to other resorts (timeshare exchanges) and the property and room amenities were not what they advertised. This was not the case at Marriott’s Cypress Harbour. This resort was convenient to the Disney Parks, International Drive, around the corner from Sea World and a Publix supermarket. In the same shopping center, there was a CVS pharmacy as well. There were plenty of moderately priced restaurants to choose from on International Drive. We recommend Bahama Breeze for sure! To get to the Disney parks, you make a right out of the resort and a left at the next light to jump on I-4. The main pool at the resort was wonderful. Plenty of lounge chairs, clean pool water, and maintenance people walking around sweeping, cleaning, etc. We especially liked the tables with the umbrellas so that you can sit and eat your lunch. We brought some snacks down in a small cooler and nobody bothered us. The outdoor bar was convenient for those cool, frozen drinks. Prices were good, not outrageous. There was waiter service as well. There is a walkway/pier that connects the main pool to the “Island” pool. It was nice to take a walk in the middle of the hot day and catch a breeze off the lake and enjoy another pool area. I was impressed with the security too. There have been other resorts that advertised a security gate, that really never existed. This was not the case at this resort. We liked the fact that unless you were a guest with a visible parking permit on your dashboard, you could not go in and out. Parking was plentiful. We absolutely would go back to this resort again. Family-friendly, clean property, convenient to all, great room amenities., wonderful pool areas. Kudos to the folks who manage this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: VacationCrazed
Reviews.Content: Simply wonderful! Stayed here 5/17 -5/25/08 with DH, DS17, DS16. We’ve never stayed at a time share before, and now I think we’re ruined for hotels. The grounds were beautiful and quiet, it was a pleasure to stroll around when we weren’t at the parks. The unit was exactly as it appears on the website - clean, bright and large! Great with teenagers, so much room to spread out we could have fit two of their friends with no problem. Both the grounds and rooms were very quiet. We had a family of six with small children above us and I never heard them! I loved the screened in porch, so peaceful to sit and read and the ceiling fan keeps it comfortable in 90 degree weather. I even sat out in it during a flash thunderstorm – awed by Mother Nature. Having a washer/dryer was great to. Never thought I’d want to do wash on vacation but it was so nice coming home and not having to do 4 loads of laundry. We stayed in building 60 – perfect for us. Close to the smallest pool and close enough to walk to the Marketplace. I don’t think we ever saw more than 3 other people at this pool and had it all to ourselves several times. There’s nothing like sitting in the hot tub at 10pm after a long day at the parks. The Marketplace had everything we needed at reasonable prices. The staff – front desk, marketplace, maintenance – were all friendly and efficient. The drive to Disney’s entrance (which leads to Downtown Disney and all parks) was a 10 min drive. Usually takes another 10 min to get into any of the parks. We frequently came back to the resort in late afternoon for a break – seems to me it was just as quick as if we stayed onsite and had to wait 15 min for a Disney bus. We took Turkey Lake Rd/Palm Pkwy (make a left onto this road, take several miles to a main intersection – pizza hut will be on the right- and make another left and then a right into Disney). Very quick and easy, no traffic. In case anybody is comparing this property to the other Marriott properties – Horizon by Marriott is right across the street from Cypress Harbor. I think we passed Grande Vista on International Drive. I would say that Cypress and Horizon are quicker rides to Disney. Absolutely the nicest place we’ve ever stayed at. I compared it to staying onsite Disney. A moderate room with 2 double beds would have run us $149/night. Here we paid a rate of $205/night with a $30 food/merchandise credit per night (easily used with 2 teenage boys) So for $26 more per night we got 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, living room, dining area, full kitchen, laundry room, and porch. Simply wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised better than thought”
Reviews.Author: ecualumni06
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. I picked this placed based on the reviews on here and their high ratings. Upon arrival I noticed it was right across from seaworld at what looked liked "timeshare row." I was a little worry because I did not want to be hasseled on vacation about buying a timeshare. We were contacted once about a possible showing via phone in which I promptly declined. They were very nice and did not contact me again. The room was very clean and really nice and spacious for the 4 of us. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: BvilleTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife, brother-in-law, and I stayed at Cypress Harbour from Nov 11-18 via a timeshare exchange. We spent most of our time at Disney (something I hadn't done for 20+ years). Overview: This is a fairly large complex with dozens of buildings, two pools, hot tubs, BBQ Grills, a fully equipped activities center (shuffleboard, bocci, basketball, pool table, etc.), and well tended grounds. Located a few minutes from Seaworld and about 10 minutes from Disney. This is a very well run resort and offers plenty of activities for everyone. Pros: (i) the two bedroom units are quite spacious (probably 700-800 sq ft), are very nicely decorated, and offer a well equipped kitchen; (ii) as I've mentioned, the location is very convenient to the theme parks, (iii) the grounds are extensive and beautifully maintained. Cons: honestly, I have very few criticisms...our sofa was showing some signs of wear, particularly with a couple of cushions that bottomed out. Other than that, I was really impressed with the resort and the unit. Conclusion: Orlando was fun (even for adults)...we'll probably go again someday. As for the resort, this is an excellent choice and is highly recommended if you don't mind driving a short distance to the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: MsSpootz
Reviews.Content: My family booked 4 villas for a mini-reunion during the week of 4th of July. The villas were beautiful stocked with everything we needed. Very close to Sea World (we watched their fireworks from our screened balcony) and Universal. The resort provided so many activities for the kids that we didn't even have to go to the theme parks everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great villa/ great value”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad99
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3n stay with the Seaworld package which was booked via Marriott. com. The package included 2 adult, 2 children tickets which the park allowed us to upgrade to 2 adult tickets for the difference in the cost. The tickets were good for the entire length of stay at the villa. The villa was so nice and spacious. The parking was very close and the 2 bedroom villa which we used was great. It was quiet, beds were comfortable, and the screened porch was a great amenity. The 3 televisions, great kitchen, and washer/dryer combination were an added plus. it was very close to the parks, shopping, and many restaurants and easy to access from I-4. I defnitely will return to this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected”
Reviews.Author: musikmanSherwood_Wi
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about this stay since this is one of Marriotts older condominium residences in Orlando. However I was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and in good shape and the service was very good. The landscaping and grounds are very well kept up. The pools are heated. I was especially impressed with Owen the pool bartender. He was polite professional and made the best drinks at the resort. Plus he remembered my name after hearing it just once. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: AmsFam
Reviews.Content: By writing this I hope to help others who are searching for that perfect location just as this site helped me find this fabulous resort! This is how it began.... With rising costs of everything it was a big decision for us to spend money to take a family vacation - me, husband and 14yr old twin daughters. Once it was decided we would go for it and a destination was chosen it was my mission to find the ideal spot that would satisfy my VERY picky family's tastes - all of which never fail to be different! Coming from Colorado I didn't find many of my local connections with much knowledge of places to stay in Orlando so I spent many hours researching more locations than you can imagine and became dependent on reviews from Trip Advisor as well as other review sites. Our budget allowed me to look at higher end accomodations so I ruled out the typical less expensive chain hotels early on. After many hours it was narrowed down to: A high end resort hotel at Universal or Disney- PROS - accessibility to park and lots of entertainment around. CONS-very expensive or typical oversized 2 bed, 1 bath hotel room that was more affordable but still high price. Not the best arrangement for my husband spending 5 nites with the 3 women in his life - girls pack alot of junk! Plus, the reviews I read didn't help, seems the added expenses associated with staying at these places can be a bit much. This might have been more attractive if my kids were younger and wanted to be in the middle of all the craziness of these theme parks. Thankfully, we all said no. Marriott Cypress Harbor Resort - PROS - 2 bedroom, 2 bath, kitchen, living room, screened deck condo, washer/dryer. What more can I say there. Price - MUCH more tolerable. We saved on meals by going to grocery store and not eating out every meal, especially breakfast, cereal/toast is the typical choice. During down time - 3 tvs made everyone happy. The unit was very clean, the screened porch kept those nasty little bugs from bugging us - not used to so many bugs coming from Colorado. If I was really being critical I would suggest a little updating but really no big deal. We had a great location - a building about half way between activity center and island pool, main pool and store/grill. My very independent 14 yrs olds were all about doing things are their own, without mom/dad, and we were very comfortable letting them be out and about into the early evening. They loved that! The grounds were beautiful, well kept and clean. We did come across some interesting creepy crawlies - once again, not seen where we come from. One morning there was a large black snake sunning near the pool deck - we took some pictures and it slithered off into safety. We kept hoping to see an alligator for some thrills - don't see those in CO. The pools were beautiful, hardly crowded while we were there. Evening resort entertainment was fun. We did the paddle boats - don't pay for more than 1/2 hr - its a leg killer. Played giant chess, ping pong, basketball and mini golf. It was all perfect, despite excessive heat and humidity we are not accustomed to. Thank goodness for the washer/dryer, I changed my clothes twice a day. The staff was all friendly and helpful, bartenders shared lots of valuable info, conceriege was helpful, we had a later flight home and front staff graciously let us extend our check out a little later to take the final advantage of this wonderful place. This is the place to stay! As long as you have your own car, it's easy to get around town and to those crazy theme parks. Our final family thought - we got to experience the theme parks - don't need to return to those anytime soon. But we would definitely make a vacation out of just staying at this resort and doing nothing more than hanging out and having fun. We wished we could have stayed longer - that was the only CON - fitting in the theme park experience didn't leave us enough time to take advantage of this great spot so we would like to return to do so! Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Cypress Harbour”
Reviews.Author: FlyJayClass
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Fantastic. Myself and two friends recently stayed at the Marriott Cypress Harbour for 6 nights while in Orlando to hit all the theme parks. We could not have asked for anything more. The property is gorgeous, very quiet and very private. We shared a 2 bedroom villa with 2 baths, full kitchen, dining room, living room, veranda and laundry room. The accomodation was spotless and unbelievably comfortable to collapse in after a long day at Disney. The pool is beautiful and the proximity to all there is to see in Orlando couldn't be better. The pictures on the hotel website don't do it justice. If you stay here you will not be disappointed. I would rather stay here than ANY Disney hotel. The Marriott vacation properties are definitely the way to go if comfort is key.

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Harbour was nice.”
Reviews.Author: cindyrella25
Reviews.Content: This resort is a great option if you plan on going to Sea World or Universal! It is right across from Sea World and if you ask for a room in the back of the resort anywhere around 6912 you can see the fireworks from Sea World every night! All the pictures are true to life.....only the second bedroom is very small. It does have a queen size bed and a pull out couch, but if you pulled out the sofa there is no room to walk! We had six of us. My husband and I took the smaller room and our friends took the bigger master room. We had to put the kids on the pull out in the living room, which meant putting them to sleep in the bedroom then waking them up to move them to the living room. (Only draw back.) Our last day there the pool was a little dirty, but it had stormed earlier so maybe they just didn't get to it yet. LOTS of activities....most are at an extra cost though.......we were visiting family so didn't have time to do any of it, but bike rentals, pontoon boat rentals, basket ball court....and much more The scenery is very nice, and I thought it was well deserving of at least a B+

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: tomgou
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a Marriott and we can honestly say that we were impressed by the overall experience. Upon arriving at the resort (around 1 PM) we checked and found our room not ready. The desk clerk took our cell phone and got us towels while we lounged at the pool. I went back at 3 PM and was informed that our room would not be ready for two more hours. Asked about other buildings and we were placed in building 51 third floor. We had no complaints, two bedroom, very spacious, clean and close to the main area. We really enjoyed the pool, bar and food on property. If they had a sit down restaurant, I would rate this resort a 10. All employees were friendly and helpful, even the sales lady who called and asked us to take a tour of the Grande Vista (we declined). My granddaughter did a few crafts that were ongoing. The staff was great with the kids and there is something always going on. This resort is about 10 minutes from disney and many stores are closer, if you like to shop. We definitely will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED Marriott's Cypress Harbour!”
Reviews.Author: sdkhappy
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Marriott's Cypress Harbour Resort in May 2008. We exchanged our timeshare week in a Virginia timeshare, for this resort. Our vacation at Marriott's Cypress Harbour was wonderful. Our two bedroom, 2 bath villa had every amenity we could possibly want, was beautiful, and very spacious. There was plenty of room for our family, (husband, me, married daughter, grandchild). The villa was very clean, well appointed and comfortable. We loved the screened in porch and the large laundry room with full size washer and dryer. It is evident that much thought was put into the design of this resort. The grounds and landscaping were beautiful and well kept. There were 3 pools and we had plenty of room to just sit by them and relax, swim, or enjoy the live bands that provided music twice during our stay. We enjoyed the convenience of the "Marketplace" which was a little store that sold convenience items, frozen foods, hand dipped ice cream, and more. The resort is located in a very nice area and is close to Sea World, restaurants and a great outlet mall. We look forward to returning to Marriott's Cypress Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!! Would defintely return”
Reviews.Author: TexasTink54
Reviews.Content: We booked this condo based on the reviews from Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed at all. This condo easily accommodated me and my significant other along with three adult children and a six year old. This condo had everythig we needed--full size kitchen that was stocked with cooking utensils and dishes we needed plus the nice size laundry room. We were near the grocery store which was convenient. We enjoyed the screeened in porch. We also liked the proximity to Disney. We would defintely recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: merchbig
Reviews.Content: Our recent 1st time stay at this vacation resort was awesome. Our 2 bedroom villa was clean. Housekeeping came in everday. Our bldg#74 was located right next to the recreation area where the basketball court, playground, arcade, mini golf, huge life size chess board, boat dock & my favorite place the fitness room. We had the choice to stay at bldg#64 where you can see the Seaworld fireworks but I preffered being near everything I mentioned having 3 kids of different ages 13,4, & 9months. All pools are nearby. The main lobby offers theme nights like karoke, texas hold'em, black jack, wine tasting etc..One nite I thought there was no hot water in the main shower & maintenance came to our room before I could hang up the phone & it was around 11pm. No fancy restarant at this location but their is an Eatery grill open til 10 that serves cheesteaks, burgers, salads & a pizza hut that delivers to your room until 11pm. The hospitality, access & cleanliness was excellent. We are definitely staying there again. Oh I forgot to mention there is pool bar in the main lobby area. This location was near Disney, Seaworld & Universal. We had access to Rt 4 which took us to Disney in like 10 minutes & near International drive which is like a strip of LOTS of attractions & ALL TYPES of restaurants, Must take a stroll in the early evening & have dinner, you would have lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be sorry!”
Reviews.Author: derby3680
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week 4/17-4/24/08 and came back so relaxed and eager to return next year! We had two familie's of four sharing a two bedroom with plenty of room (note-we are sisters/cousins so rooming together was not an issue). From check-in to check-out this Marriott continued to offer superior accomodations and service. The grounds are continuously being groomed. The place was absolutely gorgeous! Our kids ranged from 8-13 and were always entertained. There was a pontoon boat that would pick you up at the pool and take you to the Activities center for free. The kids were able to ride that over for "make you own sundaes". There was some kind of music entertainment daily poolside and one night the kids were able to make s'mores by the pool. You can save $ by shopping at Publix and eating breakfast/lunch in your villa or by bringing in cooler to the pool area. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, spacious, a little rough on the service”
Reviews.Author: junodee
Reviews.Content: We stayed over April 20-22, 2008. We asked for a quiet location and received one overlooking the golf course. Very nice to sit outside on the screened porch and read, enjoy the breeze. The pros: --The 2 BR were spacious, bright, comfortable and cosy. --Beds were wonderfully comfortable. --Pools were warm and grounds were pretty --Close to parks --Close to shopping and restaurants --We were able to check in early --Most staff were friendly The cons: --The food service is very limited and the service from the Grill was slow and confusing. We were not notified when our food was ready (twice). --The jacuzzi did not work. The stopper in one sink was broken. While housekeeping was aware of the latter, they did not fix it. --There were no towels available at the pools, nor any signs explaining how to locate them. If you wanted to obtain a towel, you were told to go to the front desk (which could require a drive or a 10 minute walk). --The staff was either very friendly or disinterested. At one point, we were eating lunch at a poolside table and asked to move in the middle of our lunch so they could have the table for an activity. This could have been avoided had they simply "saved" the table or brought in another. It was rude to ask us to move when we were midway through our meal (and there were no other available tables). In the end, these little glitches prevented the Cypress Harbor from being an outstanding experience, but I'd probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Loved It”
Reviews.Author: dontino
Reviews.Content: Long Island, NY We were their from 4/14/08-4/21/08. I was with my husband, 2 sons 8 & 11 and my parents. It was the first time they were in Florida and they could not get over the resort. The resort is beautiful, clean, and friendly staff. I wish we had more time to spend on the grounds. There was a lot to do at the resort. The 2 bedroom villa was very spacious. We were in building 50 on the 4th floor. Beautiful view. I would come to this resort again next time we visit Florida. I

Reviews.Title: “Didn't think it could get better!!”
Reviews.Author: The-Wandering-Whites
Reviews.Content: Just returned a week ago from our 2nd visit to Cypress Harbour in 3 years and enjoyed the experience even more than last time. We arrived after a first week (first visit) at Grande Vista and were delighted that our request for the same building, top floor as last visit had been honoured. The unit had been totally refurbished since our previous visit and was absolutely beautiful, granite kitchen tops, fresh & bright paintwork, new furniture & electronics (tv, DVD etc.) & had retained our favourite feature - the HUGE jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom. We love this resort so much as it is laid out to enable people to walk around the resort - to the pools, reception, bar etc which is so nice. Since our last visit they have also put in a small nature trail where you can see squirrels, turtles & lizards which is really nice. As we were only visiting Seaworld this trip & doing more relaxing we all made much more use of the facilities such as boating, basketball, table tennis & the pool bar (margarita heaven!!) The staff were, as before, so friendly & helpful to all our requests for info. If you want a laid back, top quality resort, easy to Seaworld & all the other parks take my word for it, this is it, we can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - I've Found My Second Home!”
Reviews.Author: DebandJim
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Vacation Club owners who booked our stay through an Interval International cash Getaway. Cypress Harbour has an "old fashioned" Florida Key West feel to it. But it also reminded us of our vacation on the island of Kauai at the Sheraton on Poipu - from the fish ponds as you cross over the entrance threshold to the glass enclosed lobby that looks out over the palm tree shaded main pool. It just feels like you are in the tropics and you are definitely on vacation. We were in Building 50 on the top floor in an end unit. The unit was spacious and very clean. The beds were extremely comfortable. We could see Seaworld's fireworks every night from our screened bay window shaped balcony. Since we were close to the main pool and gift shop, we bought the refillable mugs and definitely got our money's worth out of them - filling up on soda and Starbucks coffee. The staff, pools, and recreation areas were wonderful. We couldn't believe how clean they kept all the bathrooms. Marriott's staff were constantly checking bathrooms and emptying trash. We are also Disney Vacation Club members and Marriott's Cypress Harbour is as good as any DVC resort and maybe better. I fee like we have found a second home with Marriott's Cypress Harbour. We fell in love with the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: laliz
Reviews.Content: I was worred about check in as we were coming in late saturday night of spring break. I thought we were going to get stuck with a bad room. We had a great 2 bedroom apt. We were 2 adults and 3 kids. The kids slept in the 2nd bedroom with a queen bed and a pull out couch and were very comfortable there. The living area in the main room was HUGE. master bedroom also HUGE. nice beds and nice linens with good pillows. Hard to find these days. The only complaint is what I read in other reviews. In order to use the master bathroom, the glass shower lights up which illuminates into the main room. A little awkward. There is a great huge jacuzzi tub. They also provide extra towels so we didn't have to call for more. We spent our days at the parks so we didn't swim at all

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: NCtoDC
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare week using Interval International for our stay from Feb. 29th to March 6th. About 1 week prior to our stay, I received an e-mail requesting my preferences for my stay. We requested a non-smoking quiet villa, which we received. We stayed in Building 57, which is located on the south end of the resort and backs to a golf course community. We had a wonderful stay. There is easy access to I-4 and SR 528 - Beachline Expressway. Also getting to the southern end of International Drive was not a problem. The Publix is just down the street for groceries. Just remember that you will need to call the front desk so that maintenance can light the grill for you. They removed all the ignitors for safety reasons. I did not use the pool while we were there, but I heard that Owen at the poolside bar makes a decent margarita (for those 21 and over).

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Harbour - Sophisticated Paradise”
Reviews.Author: tobsailin
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a 2 bedroom, 2 bath villa for 11 nights at this resort and it was fabulous. We booked a 4 day timeshare review package and then extended it with a full week. We had planned this as a Disney vacation with 7 day passes to the park for our 4 teenage kids (2 hers & 2 mine). I just wished we had allowed more time to spend at this luxurious resort. The multiple pools and activities on site are tremendous. The days we did spend there allowed us to relax near the pool, have a late afternoon tropical drink at the pool bar and feel comfortable that the kids had plenty to do all day & night. The resort is close to the parks which made for easy driving back and forth. The rooms are spacious, very clean and had screened in balconies, which was a nice touch. The master bedroom jacuzzi tub was just the prescription Dad needed after 18 holes of golf. The grills situated near the buildings allowed us to cook out a couple nights and not have to worry about cleanup. The staff at the resort was attentive and most professional. I can understand how the resort earned its multiple awards. We even scheduled the resort photographer to take family photos of us one morning at a very reasonable fee. Marriott's Cypress Harbour is like going to a tropical paradise but having all the amenities that Orlando has to offer nearby. The perfect resort destination! We will certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setup for a Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: FlyNavyCincinnati
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights during a family vacation and absolutely loved it. The Cypress Harbour is located about 1 mile from Sea World and 15 minutes from the Disney parking lots. This is a very nice resort with a pool, golf course, recreation activities, etc. Here are some goods and "others": Goods: - The rooms are huge - about 1400 sq ft. - Two bedrooms and two full bath suites. Plenty of room for a family. - Full kitchen (range, microwave, dishwasher, full fridge) and washer and dryer for laundry. - Dining table and big sectional with a pull out bed. - Very good service. Our microwave broke and they had it replaced within a couple of hours (consider that it is a space saver). - Most, if not all rooms have been updated recently - the rooms are pretty nice. - Huge whirlpool tub in the master bath. - Nice golf course at adjacent Marriott resort. - Free internet Others: - The beds were a little hard. - I wasn't crazy with the layout of the master bath. It is open to the rest of the room (execpt the shower and toilet). Not a big deal, unless somebody needs to get up early. - Internet was a little slow. Overall, I highly recommend Cypress Harbour and hope to stay there again on my next trip to Orlando. If you are looking for some take out while staying there, try Flippers. Good pizza, salads and sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: jme1016
Reviews.Content: Overall, a great stay at this property. We stayed here on a 5-day try-out for $150 per day. The facilities on the property were well maintained and we found our way around the property easily. The activities for kids were OK, but we weren't able to use a lot of them because our son was only 2 1/2 at the time. I expect that there will be a lot more for him to do on future vacations! The room was excellent. Two bedrooms with a huge jacuzzi tub in the master. My mom joined us for part of the trip and our son slept in the pull-out bed in her room. Overall, plenty of room for the 4 of us, and room for more. The kitchen was sufficient and it was nice to be able to cook some of our breakfasts in the room rather than paying extra for meals every day. The maid service ran the dishwasher and took out trash etc. Two small complaints that I had, was the lighting in the master bedroom. There was no way to turn on the lights at night without disturbing the other person in the room as the jacuzzi tub was in the same room and the bathroom shower was a glass pane into the bedroom as well. This could easily be rectified by bringing a small night lite with you on the trip. Also, we were in a room that backed up to a tee box. Not a problem for me in general, but was sometimes tough to keep the kids quiet as people were teeing off. Again, something that we could have changed by moving rooms, but didn't want to bother with the hassle of packing everything up. The check-in process was very easy and we were given a room on the first floor, which we requested to make it easier on our son (and my wife as she was 7 months pregnant). We used both pools and they were great. There was a place to barbecue, which we didn't get to use, but will if we go back. Also, there were a ton of activities that we didn't get to use (fishing, bike rentals, basketball, paddle boats). We spent too much time at Disney and not enough at the resort. Overall, a great facility that we will consider visiting again (since we ended up purchasing a week timeshare at the Marriott Horizons facility during this trip).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: carouseltravel
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff very friendly and efficient. Lobby and pool area were beautiful. We had a two bedroom unit. Master was wonderful with a HUGE jacuzzi tub in the room. Second bedroom had a queen and a pullout sofabed. Kitchen had everything you would need for cooking. Living room had a huge wraparound sofa (it may have been a sofabed too but I didn't check to make sure). Also had a nice screened in veranda which was nice to sit out on and not worry about the horrible Florida bugs. Also a full size washer and dryer. Only complaint - no popcorn in the welcome basket.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: nana6099
Reviews.Content: The resort is lovely, the grounds are very well maintained. Our villa was just as you see online which was great. it was in need of a little tlc fresh paint new furniture however, nothing we could not live with. We had our 4 grandchildren with us and our villa was spacious enough to be comfortable. I do perfer 2nd bedrooms to have 2 full size beds which would always be more accomadating. Our major disappointment was that the heaters for the pools were broken 2 were fixed before we left. The resort is huge and the pools were so far away we had to drive to enjoy the ammenities. Because we were on the end we had no view of the beautiful grounds. I think that they should pay more attention to detail when ones reservations mention 2 adults and 4 children they should try to be placed near pools and other activities. However, my husband checked us in and did not ask to be close to these things. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: little_brown_bag14
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family after returning from a cruise, and was only staying 1 night here.. When I arrived I was amazed! We were staying in the 'Tucker' block (Think thats the name - something along those lines) And we had a 2 bedroom apartment booked. Loved the size of the rooms, the jacuzzi, the kitchen facilities, the view from our balcony of the lake. I really really wish we stayed here longer before the cruise, we didn't have enough time to explore the whole complex. I can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good resort for the family”
Reviews.Author: bernardlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days in early January. The resort is very nice and is conveniently located with restaurants, supermarkets, and freeway access nearby. The airport is about 15-20 min away. The staff was friendly and helpful and they'll even print boarding passes for you. The rooms have free high-speed internet access. We stayed in a 2-bedroom unit and it was very spacious and clean. We had a lake view from our balcony. The resort grounds are very nice. They were offering timeshare presentations at Marriott's Horizon property but I preferred the Cypress Harbor property. The pool and jacuzzi were great after a long day at the theme parks. Enough the air temperature was colder for January, they heated the pools which were great for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property for Families”
Reviews.Author: PennStateFan
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for families. We had a two BR, two bath room overlooking the golf course. Service: The checkin and check out process was extremely easy and fast. It's a decent sized property, so it probably depends if others are there at the same time, but easy for me. The rooms were cleaned each day on time. Room: The room was incredibly spacious with the bedrooms, baths, full washer/dryer, kitchen, dining room and living room (3 TV total). The room had some wear and tear but was perfect for our family. Location: The property is near I4 and is easy to get to from the airport is within 10-15 for disney and universal parks. Sea world is less than 5 minutes away. I think you'd definitely have to have a car here unless you want a lot of big taxi charges. Pool: It was too cold for us to hit the pools, but they looked nice and should be good when it gets warmer. Restaurant/food There is a little convenice market store on property which was very nice and had coffee, donuts, sandwiches and ice cream. There' s a little pizza hut there too but that's about it. Good for snacks or last minute, but not a big menu. The property wasn't over the top in luxury, but we weren't looking for that in our family vacation. We will definitely return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place !”
Reviews.Author: Poohh66
Reviews.Content: Awesome place. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and it was great. Very comfortable and clean. The resort sends out a survey before you arrive and it even offers to stack up your kitchen with your selected groceries, very convenient and resonably priced. Can't wait to go back. Enjoyed it !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: stepback
Reviews.Content: We ( family of 4- kids 5,7) stayed here the first week of December. We had a 2 bedroom-2 bath unit on the Fourth Floor. The Unit was spotless- the bed was extremely comfortable- towels were plentiful, the layout was great. The staff were SO friendly- everyone from the front desk, to the marketplace employees, to the groundskeepers. We had a package that included a $50/day credit to use on the property- We could use it on food, drinks, or anything in the marketplace store ( which was a mini-grocer that even had souveniers and webkins). The pools were so clean, and all of the grounds were spotless. If I has done ONE thing differently, I would've asked for a unit that was right near the pool- we were a little ways from the pool, so we usually drove, which was fine too. It took us about 15 minutes to get to the Disney Parks and 3 minutes to SeaWorld- we were happy to leave Disney at the end of the day, and return to our nice quiet resort.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely loved the place”
Reviews.Author: kb57
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort and true to the Marriott standard of quality and customer service. Before you arrive, the resort sends out a survey requesting your preferrences for your stay, such as your preferrence for a non-smoking room, on an upper floor. I received all of my preferrences. The resort has many features, including two pools, golf course, and tennis court. The rooms are very spacious and all the pictues, both candid and the resort website pictures, are true to what you actually experience. This location is perfect for any and everyone and is a convenient drive to all the amusement parks and restaurants. The next time I visit florida I will not buy my park tickets in advance. The Marriott resort accross the street (Horizons) offered a tour of their resort and offered $100 in either Marriott bucks, Sea world bucks, or Universal bucks. Since we already had our tickets, we requested Universal bucks and used this money to buy food, go to the movies (at City Walk), and at the gift shops. Any future visits I plan to enjoy the resort more, and use these offers to buy tickets for the parks. The timeshare presentation was one of the best I ever received. The presentor was not pushy or rude. I actually enjoyed the presentation, and had to convince myself not to buy.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Disappointed...Especially with Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: invest06
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? The room we stayed in needed serious help. The matress and box spring were stained, carpet was frayed, the paint in the master bed/bath wasn't finished, the jacuzzi tub jets blew out when it started up, there was a leak under the sink in the master bathroom, and I can go on. Most importantly the front desk staff was extremely rude! I have never been treated so horribly ever! I will never go back. In fact we changed our reservation to another time share for when we go back again in December.

Reviews.Title: “Great...but watch out!”
Reviews.Author: EkimPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott rewards member. We were offered a special rate for a stay. When we first arrive we were given an VERY OLD, Musty room. The furniture, kitchen and bathrooms were worn out and ugly. I immediately went to the front desk and raised H because that is not what I was told the place was like. That night we had to spend in a remodeled smoking unit (supposedly nothing else avail). Yes even though Marriott is now smoke free I was told that they had to maintain some smoking unit because owners had bought vacation villas long before the policy was put into place. After a final move to a newly remodeled room the stay was great. The ground are wonderful and my sun loved the activity center. Room was nicely maintained during the stay,

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Harbour Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Gummybarb
Reviews.Content: This is our third time at the Cypress Harbour. We love it here!! We stayed on the 4th floor, building 62 overlooking the lake. It was great! The weather was perfect this time of year and the theme parks were empty which meant no lines! The Cypress Harbour is one of the nicest places we have stayed. The only suggestions I would have for them is to update the beds and shower. The beds were rock hard and the shower was luke warm and the shower heads were old. If you stay here, always ask for the top floor overlooking the large lake. While you are here, be sure and go to Point Orlando and eat at some of the new restaurants there. Enjoy your stay at this A+ resort! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “It Spoiled Me”
Reviews.Author: fernh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to spend a week in the Orlando area so we could search for active adult communities when and if we retire. We own a Marriott timeshare in Phoenix so we used Interval International to look for a Marriott property we could use and book as a getaway (didn't have to trade). After much research, I booked Cypress Harbour when the week we wanted became available. Needless to say, the place was terrific. I had requested a lakeview room, high floor, and that's exactly what I got. The two bedroom, two bath villa was spotless. Parking was never a problem. If I had to complain about anything, the bed was not the typical Marriott pillow top. The mattress was only about 6 inches thick and very hard. My husband liked it alot. We were usually so tired by bedtime that we slept very well anyway. I don't really like the open bathroom concept but it turned out not to be a big problem. The huge round whirlpool tub takes up way too much space and seems dated. The door to the toilet and shower area is very big and heavy. The shower itself is decent size but the shower head could use updating. Also, the towels are very thin and not that soft. The hangers are the thin plastic kind and not very good for hanging pants. There is plenty of drawer space though. We did spend time at one of the pools and it was very pleasant but the lounge chairs are rock hard. We had to use the pool towels as cushions. It was great having the Marketplace and Pizza Hut Express right on the property. The location is not far from all the attractions. I complained when we were leaving that I wanted to stay another week. It really did feel like a second home.

Reviews.Title: “Families Could Ask for Nothing more!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirlgirlfriend
Reviews.Content: Friends gave us a gift certificate from Interval Int'l to stay here. A family visiting the theme parks could ask for nothing more. It is basically a home - full kitchen, dining area, screened porch, large master suite w/ jacuzzi, another full guest suite, laundry room - what else do you need? Beautifully decorated - and the amenities they have on site for acitivities when you are not at the parks is fabulous. Never a dull moment, very upscale, I like a Ritz Carlton type of hotel - but for families, this is great. Between the 3 pools, basketball courts, bocce ball, ping pong, chess, game room, pool tables, fishing, boat rentals, bike rentals. Great location, there is a 7 Eleven right down the street for supplies & a grocery store about a mile away for those of you who really like to stock up. We even got take out Chinese from a local restaurant. Sea World is in your backyard (along w/ Discovery Cove). We just happened to have stayed @ the Marriott Horizons, across the street in January. Very similar. If there were any possible drawbacks from the Cypress Harbour, it is that it is spread out (many units) to get to the main clubhouse w/ the heated pool, Pizza Hut & Starbucks Coffee, we had to drive. (You could also hike across the bridge over the lake)We will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Gob-smackingly good”
Reviews.Author: Tiggerleic4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of our Florida tour. After staying at Disney Wilderness Lodge we were gob-smacked at the sheer size and quality of the place. It was huge, and incredibly good quality, beautifully furnished, I cannot praise it enough. Why would any family stay any where else. It is a home from home, it has a full kitchen, washer and dryer (make sure you take powder for all those log flume wet clothes). A big fridge, brilliant comfy sofa, master suite was incredible with jacuzzi for heavens sake. The other room had a sofa bed and double so the kids alternated but they slept just as well in both. We stayed in a newly refurbed room on the 4 th floor (as advised on TA previously) and it was amazing. The kids never made it to the pool but they looked lovley. Housekeeping wouldn't take the tip?? don't know why. We will certainly never stay any where else agin, 5 min from sea world, 15 from Magic kingdom, 20 from Animal kingdom, 15 from Universal, and at the better end of International drive for food, can you get any more central? Brilliant (didn't add pictures because it looks just like the website!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: Graeme0723
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Cypress Harbour and once again we found the room spotless, the resort clean and well maintained and the experience peaceful. I phoned them about a fortnight prior to our stay and gave them a short list of preferences as to where we wanted our unit. We got everything we wanted and were more than happy. I would advise anyone who wants a panoramic view of the grounds to ask for a lakeview room as the trees round the golf course are quite mature and restrict the view. The staff are so polite and eager to please it is unnerving at times! I'm already planning my next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pixiedust
Reviews.Content: The units are beautiful,large,clean and well stocked.The grounds,pools,common areas are perfectly maintained.The location is great,but a car is a must.We got to Disney parking lots in about 15 minutes,Sea World is around the corner,and Publix and Wal-Mart are close by,but you probably wouldnt be able to even walk to a bus stop.The staff was helpful and friendly,there are lots of activities day and night,but once you are in your apt.,it is nice and quite.If possible,try to get in a building towards the middle of the complex.This place is huge and if you are in one of the last buildings you might feel a bit isolated.I realy dont have one complaint about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: paradisesun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort from 8/17/07 through 8/24/07. I bought this week as a getaway through Interval International. This resort is large, beautiful, immaculately clean, and I loved the accommodation. I would definitely stay here again. There are activities to do onsite. The Grill and Pizza Hut and the marketplace are very good and convenient to have on site. The pool bar makes delicious Pina Coladas!. The resort is large enough to accommodate a lot of people and yet it never seemed crowded. Very beautiful landscaping and clean pools and jacuzzis. I especially loved the very large, screened in balcony that had a ceiling fan and light so that you can sit out there at night looking at the lake. This is just a beautiful resort!. The staff and front desk were very helpful. Oh, one example of the service is that I had came back from one of the theme parks one night at 1:00 am in the morning to find a huge waterbug or Palmatto bug in my suite. I'm terrified of those bugs, and i called the front desk to have someone come kill it. They sent someone immediately who found the bug and killed it, and then they called later to ask if I wanted the suite sprayed. That's service, at 1:00 in the morning. I was not unhappy at all. Florida is known for having these bugs, but I was told they only come out when it is very hot and they are looking for water. After this incident I did not see any more bugs. This is a high quality resort.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use if Cruising”
Reviews.Author: joensu89
Reviews.Content: Visited Cypress Harbour August 18 for one week. Our family selected this resort through interval as a week getaway. Since it was my parents anniversary I decided to bring them along while I took a four day cruise out of Port Canaveral. We arrived on a Saturday with little wait for check-in and was given a top floor room as requested facing Sea World. It was great watching the fireworks at the park's closing. My family left my parents at the resort on Sunday as we left for a wonderful 4 day cruise. Parents only planned to stay until Wednesday and go home and we planned to return on Thursday to complete the week which we paid for. When we arrived back at the Cypress Harbour on Thursday around mid-morning, we went in noticed that some food and laundry cleaning items were missing. No problem we thought, maybe my parents used them up. That was until housekeeping showed up to finished cleaning the room. Long story short. Housekeeping came in the room after my parents left. They thought had checked out and called the front desk to make the room available. The problem was that my parents didn't call for housekeeping and their own policy states that housekeeping will not clean your room unless requested when visiting as a guest owner. The front desk told me when I went to the front desk to report items missing and that housekeeping had visited without my permission, that I had checked out and that I couldn't get back in my room without "proof" that I was supposed to be there for a week. The manager was called and checked me back in when he checked the computer and saw that I had paid for a week months in advance. I got a lot of excuses about what happened but the manager never apologized. A survey came a week later via email. I complained in the survey and asked to be contacted. To date I have heard nothing back from Marriott. A letter to corporate is on the way!!! In closing, I had no problem with the grounds staff and other employees not related to this incident and the property is very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: cmrtraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute getaway before school started and were more than pleased with the resort. Check-in was smooth and quick even though it was early evening. The room was beautifully decorated and very sizable. Our son loved having his own room with a TV and own bathroom. Our room had the most beautiful whirlpool tub and double sinks. The accomodations were top notch. The resort pools were fantastic. The clubhouse pool was used more by families. It had a volleyball net at one end and whirlpool jets in the shallow end - very relaxing for the adults and fun for the kids. The Marketplace was right there for ice cream, pizza, sandwiches, etc. The pavilion bar served all kids of drinks as well. The other pool with the waterfall seemed less crowded but equally as fun as our son had a blast sitting under the waterfall - great massage! Did not have time to partake in any kids activities but there was a pontoon that went back and forth to the other side of the resort continuously throughout the day. You could rent paddle boats and fishing gear also. Great proximity to Disney (about 7 miles) and Sea World (about 2 miles). Right off I-4 and International Drive which has all the restaurants and shops. Would definitely stay here again - not one complaint! We have some friends who are looking to stay here after our wonderful review.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect respite from the theme parks!”
Reviews.Author: ellenok
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely two bedroom villa on the golf course. I was concerned about the distance from the pool (and still would have liked to be a bit closer...), but we checked in early and took what was available at that hour. The front desk staff was friendly and accomodating. The beds were comfortable, the villa was clean and well-stocked, and there was plenty of space for four of us. We loved the huge two- (or three squished) person jacuzzi tub in the master suite! Housekeeping was wonderful. Despite the presence of many kids in the pool and exterior hallways, the villa itself was very quiet and peaceful, a perfect place to chill after the heat and intensity of the theme parks. The island pool was spacious, with two hot tubs and a waterfall in the main pool. My teenagers had enough space to play catch in the pool without getting in anyone else's way. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: Dawnnno
Reviews.Content: We exchanged another timeshare to book this resort. The rooms are very large. Although we have always stayed on Walt Disney World property before (POFQ, CBR, AKL) this resort is close enough to the property to be convenient. There were lots of activities, but as we were at WDW the whole week, we really didn't sample any of them. No timeshare pitch, no phone call from anyone trying to sell us a timeshare, no pressure at all. The staff members were very nice and helpful. Only two complaints. We had a huge palmetto bug in the second bedroom one morning (this is central Florida after all, not the hotel's fault) and the maintenance guy outside our room came in and squished it (even he said "whoa" when he saw this thing!) The other, more relevant, is that the bed in the master bedroom was a little lumpy and hard. Otherwise, great resort, and we will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation location!!!”
Reviews.Author: kaydee1
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough wonderful things about this resort. Villa's are large, roomy, well appointed, beautifully decorated, and clean, clean, clean!! Close to Disney, Sea World & Universal. Many nearby shopping and dining areas. Lot's of activiites. Luau was a blast! Three gorgeous pools. Friendly staff. Felt very safe there. Fabulous place!!! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings here”
Reviews.Author: calypso1
Reviews.Content: This is my 10+ visit to this property since 1994, my first time back within the past 2 years. CH has always been my favorite of all of the Orlando Marriott Vacation Clubs, but prior to the renovations it was getting a little tired looking. The new decor, fabrics and kitchens look fantastic, and the landscaping is as lush and beautiful as always. Staff was helpful, maid service daily was friendly and thorough, the pools and deck are never crowded and are well maintained. The Clubhouse pool is fun with its large bubbling jet section, and the island pool is pretty with the waterfall feature. Every day the activities staff offers ice cream sundaes in the activities center which was a big hit with the kids. Fitness center is adequate, a few treadmills, steppers and nice selection of free weights. What I didn't like: The baths are still in need of some upgrading, and the 11:30pm visit from a giant palmetto bug that ran into my daughters luggage was good for at least one sleepless night! I did find it and kill it BUT.....yuck. The amount of space in the villas and the beautiful grounds are why I keep returning here, but I do think there are newer and fresher condo resorts popping up all around at comparable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: jpress
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Disney World package through a charity auction and it included hotel and air. It was through a timeshare company so I searched though tons of properties. After reading the reviews on this location, I chose this one. What a perfect choice for my family! This resort is 8 miles from WDW and only 2 miles off of the main freeway. Having access to a washer/dryer, kitchen, full living room, 2 full bedrooms and 2 bathrooms was amazing. Our 8 and 15 year old daughters had their own space and we had ours...I had called ahead and requested a newly remodeled room in a quiet area (I had seen this hint written in these reviews) and it worked! We were given a beautifully appointed suite with an enclosed balcony overlooking the golf course. Awesome. This facility is only a couple of miles from Seaworld and Discovery Cove, also. There are many timeshare and hotel in this same area but we saw no others that had a security gate as did the Cypress Harbour. What a find. If we get a chance, we'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Neurosciprof
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a seven-day trip to Cypress Harbour. My husband and I purchased a week from a timeshare resale site, and we could not have been more pleased. From start to finish, the stay was amazing. Check-in (even at 2am) was speedy, and we got everything we asked for--including a ground floor for my handicapped mother and a pack and play for my seven-month old baby. The units have been newly refurbished, and are just beautiful, as everyone has mentioned. We have stayed here and at Marriott Grande Vista before, and I've come to like this property better...The (renovated) bar is closer to the pool, and unlike GV, the property doesn't feel overwhelming. Also, unlike GV, the laundry room is separate and the second bedroom does not have the "lock off" feature and its own entrance which is something that concerns me with younger kids. The pools were just beautiful and were busy, but never felt crowded. Water temperature was just perfect. The kids (14 and 4) enjoyed some of the activities, including karaoke night, and seemed to have more fun at the resort than at the theme parks nearby. Food options (Pizza Hut, Starbucks coffee, and the grill) were very good, and the Marketplace was wonderful for getting last-minute items. There have been some complaints about not having an on-site restaurant, but that just seems unfounded to me. The restaurants nearby offer limitless possibilities! The proximity to Sea World (about a mile) and other theme parks is fantastic. As a word to the wise, I would recommend going to Sea World early to avoid lines on the major rides, then leaving mid-day and returning early again a second day. No crowds from 9am til 12noon. In summary, it was great great great. They made us feel wonderful, and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nikkima
Reviews.Content: Exchanged timeshare through Interval International and it was well worth it! The unit was very neat although a few things needed repair. My kids loved having their own bedroom and bathroom. The washer and dryer in the unit is very convienent. What a way to save on packing! The resort is close to everything. The pool area was never crowded and my kids wanted to swim every day! The staff was very nice and we were not bothered at all to do any timeshare tours. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families or Couples! ”
Reviews.Author: US9
Reviews.Content: Exchanged week of ownership for just my husband and I. They did not hound us at all on going on a tour/ownership. It offered great provacy for couples, yet so many things for kids of all ages to do! Playgrounds, pools, paddle boats bike rentals, video/ game room, crafts, pool tables, basketball courts. Just around the corner from Sea World, Discovery Cove, International Drive!!! Rooms had everything you need including full size laundry rooms in each 2 bedroom suite and full kitchen! Also, for those rainy nights, we rented withour block buster card just around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: lifeiscyt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott Cypress Harbour for a week in May 2007. We loved this resort. The grounds were beautifully kept. The pools were spotless, and the location was perfect. It is a very central location for anything you want to do in Orlando. We have a family of five and found our 2 bedroom unit to be just the right amount of space. The master bedroom was large and beautifully furnished. We loved the screened balcony and used it every day. We have stayed in 3 other Orlando resorts, and have found this far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: Fritza
Reviews.Content: Just back from two weeks with 2 teenage boys. Accomadation was excellent - plenty of space for us all, clean, housekeeping was done half way through our stay but for an additional $20 we could have it at any other time. Facilities were great - 3 pools to choose from, gym, tabletennis, basketball all helped keep our boys occupied. Location is superb if you are trying out both Universal AND Disney - it's just about half way between the two. Timeshare sales opportunity is there but just say 'no thanks' if you don't want it. We went and got $125 Marriot Money to use towards our final bill. If I have to be negative it would be about the bar/restaurant facilities, or lack of them, yes there is a bar but it is poorly stocked unless you like Bud and frozen cocktails (wine selection is very poor). The food on offer was fine (Pizza Hut) but it would have been nice to have a better selection and a more comfortable place to sit. Overall - great, we can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Time!”
Reviews.Author: sparky1Marlton
Reviews.Content: May 20, 2007, Marlton N.J.- My family and I stayed at the Marriott Cypress Harbor Resort for 8 days. We were so impressed with the service and the entire property. The front desk was courteous, helpful and extremely accommodating. They fulfilled all of our requests on our reservation. The room was unbelievable. It was incredibly clean and well maintained. The kitchen was well stocked with pots and pans and dishes. It was great to have a dishwasher and full kitchen conveniences. We enjoyed the jacuzzi tub especially after walking in the parks all day! The grounds were well manicured and the pool area was kept perfect. My son enjoyed the childrens activities at the pool. Our only complaint is that the food was a little pricey at the grill area. The resort is a comfortable distance from all of the hustle and bustle at the Disney park area. It was only a 10 minute ride down I-4. We can't say enough about this resort. We would absolutely return again!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch! Loved It”
Reviews.Author: redridinghood27358
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights 5 day stay. I was very nervous given some of the negative remarks on some of the reviews. We had an absolutely wonderful experience with no down sides at all. We were marketed by the timeshare people at the Grande Vista down the road b/c this is a timeshare resort. We had been to one other Marriott presentation and found it to be very low pressure so we booked our stay KNOWING we agreed to listen to the 90 minute presentation (It lasted exactly 110 minutes start to leaving the property, so I guess this was the down side) However, we did not buy and found our representative pleasant, low key and w/o pressure tactics. The grounds themselves are beautiful. It is lushly manicured in the Floridian way with lots of privacy, shade and a sense of quiet We checked right in no problems at all. They gave me EXACTLY the kind of room I requested, remodeled, non-smoking, quiet and away from the elevators. We were in the last building, last villa on the 4rth floor overlooking the golf course. We loaded the luggage trolley and took the elevator. From then on out we just used the stairs around the corner from our unit. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit w/screenporch and 2 person jacuzzi and full kitchen. We were in paradise. It was clean, quiet and more than I was expecting. They even have several down pillows on every bed from Pacific Coast Down. I brought our own down pillows b/c you never know what kind your get but these would have been fine if I did not bring my own. We had maid service everyday and a welcome pack with shampoo, laundry soap, dish soap and all sundries you might need. They gave us $100 in Marriott money to use for anything at the resort. I agree the Market Place prices are high but I did buy a dozen eggs, loaf of bread, 1/2 gallon of milk and stick of butter for $9.00 but that is what I fixed for breakfast for 3 days so it was worth it. They do not have any kind of real restaurant on the property but this does not bother us. They did have a bar which we did not use but I saw some funky drinks in coconuts which looked good. I suggest you just drive to the nearby Super Walmart and purchase some food and drinks since you have a full kitchen with everything you may need. We had no problem with bugs maybe b/c we did not stay near the lake and we had only a view of it from our villa however, we did fish several times at the lake and caught 15 good size bass. Everyone we encountered was pleasant and helpful. They have a very nice college age man who runs the water taxi which shoots you back and forth the lake. They have beautiful pools and activites. Actually, my children loved it so much that we ditched Seaworld the second day even though we had passes that allowed 2 visits and they were not interested in the Blizzard Beach passes we had. We did go to Typhoon Lagoon and I think this was the worse part of the trip for me. Anyway, we had a wonderful vacation and would go back in a minute. Please just be specific on the unit you want and dont be afraid of the timeshare presentation you can say No if you are not interested.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but.......... less than average”
Reviews.Author: biged
Reviews.Content: Hi there, Let me start by saying we have 4 timeshares ( 2 at Disney itself, and 2 in Cancun ). I booked at the CH to check it out, to see if a TS was worth buying into. Well, based upon what I have seen in our 4 days there, it is NOT. We got here the week of spring break, and first thing I see around the pool areas are a bunch of teens drinking, running all over, and even jumping off some of the interconnecting bridges ( not a good sign ). The 2 bedroom we had was outrageously small ( the second bedroom was so small, one of my teens had to sleep on the ricketty sofa bed in the LR ). Overall, I was not impressed with anything here. After 4 nights here, we went to Old Key West in Disney ( our TS ). There i truly felt like " we were home " again. There are no similiarities in the two places. OKW is by far much better. Well there you have it, my opinion, for what it's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTaa_Travel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a family vacation in Orlando and boy I can t wait to get back. We booked this resort through my monster-in-law's timeshare. Very pleased with our stay. The grounds were beautiful, the condos were clean and well kept, our appliances and cookware looked brand new. The condo was very spacious lots of room for the 4 and 9 year olds to play..they particularly liked the screened in patio and given the amount of tiny creatures flying around in the neck of the woods that was an A+ in my book. The full laundry room and jacuzzi tub were also A pluses. The propery was huge with many activities to do for the kids and adults as well. The pools were great, the 24 hr fitness room was good (only had one elyptical though), the game room was fun for the kids (air hockey), basketball courts, pool, playground...it was all fab. The Market place store is way overpriced..$4.99 USD for a 12oz box of Froot Loops. I did not eat at the grill on the grounds as there were soooooo many more restaurants on International Drive to choose from. Received a great complimentary photo 5x7, of course they will trick you into buying more...the smallest package starts at about $49.00 USD. And with all ownership properties.......there is a timeshare pitch.....hence the special gift waiting for you to pick up at the concierge desk. Would definitely stay here again. The only complaint I have has nothing to do with the property itself, the "Love Bugs" were horrible..I had no love for them. Do take a day trip to Cocoa Beach about 45min-1hr drive away beautiful beach.....hmm how many more days before my next vacation? PS. Do not..I repeat,,,do not order food from Orlando pizza,,,the food is disgusting and they ripped us off...they forgot half our order and the delivery driver never brought it back even though we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice for tmeshare exchange”
Reviews.Author: mam2109
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a week timeshare exchange at the Cypress Harbour and want to report that we had an awesome stay. We probably were in a unit that still had "older" decor, as has been reported in other postings, but it didn't matter. The unit was spacious, immaculate, quiet, and more than comfortable - it was like home! The bed was very comfortable and linens were new and nice. The resort property is beautiful & well manicured and cared for. The pool and hottub areas were awesome & there was even a small "beach" on the lake (probably couldn't or wouldn't want to swim in the lake though!). Our unit looked out onto the golf course, so was very quiet at all times of the day. Sometimes there were kids playiing on the grounds, but once inside the unit we could not hear any noise. I read a lot of reviews for many different resorts, on this Trip Advisor site, before finally booking at the Cypress Harbour and I was NOT disappointed one bit. It was very close to the Disney World parks, as others have mentioned, but more importantly, it was very close to freeway access to get you anywhere in Orlando, which was a bonus also. Others have mentioned about the complimentary housekeeping. If you stay here through a timeshare exchange, there is a fee for daily housekeepiing services, but I didn't book it as I figured it was easy enough to quickly tidy the place ourselves, each day. We did also receive a phone call to come for the Marriott timeshare presentation, and I simply declined & that was that. There was no pressure to attend at all. I would definately recommend this resort for others considering it, and if I ever visit Orlando again, I will certainly stay at the Cypress Harbour again!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and lovely”
Reviews.Author: nypatty
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week there. Staff was friendly and helpful. Our 2 bedroom suite was fresh and immaculate. Decorating was serene and warm. We would reccommend this highly. Pools and entire complex was clean and well kept. Our only negative was that the gorgeous round whirlpool bath and master bathroom was only available through the master suite, That made it difficult for our kids who used the sofa bed in the living room. The second bedroom and bath were small, but lovely. All said, the rest was perfect. The living area and kitchen were open and delightful. We would most definitely go back..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kjmvacation
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth WEEK at this place over the past few years, and everytime they EXCEED our expectations. From the amazing two room villas to the incredible pools, grounds, hammocks, children's activities, propane bar-b-ques... this place has it all, in a laid back, comfy atmosphere. The BEST.

Reviews.Title: “Cold for Florida, but enjoyed ourselves”
Reviews.Author: mainecooncats
Reviews.Content: This was our first timeshare exchange thru II. While this is an older Resort (13 yrs I believe), EVERYONE was so friendly and helpful! It was a fairly quiet week for Florida. We had one hot day to use the pool and the rest of the time was cool, windy and sometimes rainey. The cleaning crew does a fantastic job and we had everything we needed inside. The only problem was the main pool was being renovated, however we wouldn't have had a chance to use it much anyway. We agreed to go to a Marriott sales pitch which lasted way too long. (3 hrs) The Pizza Hut on site was great as well as the mini grocery. The nights were extremely quiet: no traffic noise or sirens. Close proximity to major parks. I would return here again if it was not for the fact that I like the adventure of a new resort. :-) But if this was the only 5 star available at the time I needed; I certainly would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: disneydreamsnh
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at Cypress Harbour for two weeks in Mid-July. We loved the extra space a 2 bdrm villa provides! The kids loved the pool, and didn't want to leave to visit the theme parks. We plan to spend two weeks at a neighboring vacation club this year, but wouldnt hesitate to stay at Cypress Harbour again!

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Harbour a Hit!”
Reviews.Author: Jaquiboy
Reviews.Content: We loved this vacation club. We are owners in Aruba and this is the second year we traded for an Orlando vacation. In 2005 we stayed at the Grande Vista. I was pleasantly surprised at how much more I like Cypress Harbour. I liked the way the property was laid out. There was much more for families with young children on the property. The villas were also very nice. I liked the true two bedroom, as opposed to having a one bedroom with a lock-off. The space was huge! The kitchen was utilized every day and night as we cooked all of our meals there. It was pretty baby proof, and our 2 little boys (4 and 10 months) had a blast. The staff was also very accomodating. We missed our plane and had to come back, and they were very reasonable with paying for an extra night, although I think they have a different rate for owners. It was a wonderful get-away, and high recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: melbell35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this timeshare in November '06 and had a wonderful time! There was no queue at check in and the staff were really friendly and professional. I asked for a renovated room and i was given a choice of three! The apartment was HUGE and fully equipped with everything you need including washer/drier (lifesaver!!) dish washer, tv's in all rooms . We were on the ground floor and managed to park right outside the door on most days. It did take us a few days to get our bearings as this place is massive. All the staff were very friendly and helpful we didn't get bugged to attend i timeshare tour. This place is really close to Seaworld and about a 20 min drive to Disney. This has been the best holiday we've ever had!! We loved it so much we're going back although this time we are going to stay at Horizons@ Marriiott, which is across the street. The reason being the kids like the look of the pirate ship and water slide! But i must say i think Cypress Harbour is wonderful and i sure will miss the jacuzzi bath when we're at Horizons!!

Reviews.Title: “great family stay”
Reviews.Author: runningmommy
Reviews.Content: Huge condo,like staying in a small house. 2bedroom/2bath. Nice screened in porch.
