I understand there are some units that have not been updated, ask for newer renovated unit on booking. Service from staff was excellent, friendly and effecient. Also this is a hotel and a timeshare. We booked just as a hotel stay (no timeshare issues), but you can book a 4 day 'timeshare' info visit, (requires you to attend a 90min info session?) but the rate was something like $450 for 4 days or something like this. They offered it to us, but we were not interested, however sounds like a good deal. We paid an offseason rate of $240/night. A great place to take the 'extended' family. We will bring 'grandparents' with us next time. Downside, no full service restaurant on property. Pizza and snackbar only. (and small grocery for basic supplies.) however, 400+ restaurants within 5min of hotel. We will return. Nice property, across from seaworld, but with breathing space, not part of the busy 'Disney" property.

Reviews.Title: “we loved this vacation resort”
Reviews.Author: whaleseekers
Reviews.Content: we all loved this resort as it had something for all ages. plenty of pools although still not enough time just for adults, especially in the hot tubs. maybe would have liked more time to do lane swimming. villa was great. it felt like you were really rural, sourrounded by trees and lakes, lots of quiet places to sit and watch the world go by watch out for all the wildlife including an otter which follows the boats around. we were happy to spend a few days just on the resort as a break from the theme parks. really close to sea world and discovery cove.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there all over again!”
Reviews.Author: r_melba
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the resort we were delighted at the layout. We stayed march 1-8th and it took only moments to check in. The condo was a two bedroom and the master bedroom had the jacuzzi and a shower also. The kitchen was well equipped with anything we would need during the week. There was an icemaker in the fridge that was wonderful for the margarita craze! There were several pools and several hot tubs that were always warm and inviting. There was a sauna that worked well. The atmosphere was great and the staff was very acommodating to your every need. There were gas grills to use and the staff would come to light it for you when you called. There was a pizza hut and a grill at the main pool with fast food reasonably priced. They had late hours and even pizza delivery at night. The store there had most everything you could need in a pinch. They had activities pretty much non-stop. With entertainment a few nights during our stay. There was a bar there and a great lobby area what was very welcoming. We all had a great time, we are in our 50's and had our 20 something kids with us, we would all stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Harbour is the best for families!”
Reviews.Author: WdWoKw
Reviews.Content: Cypress Harbour is our favorite resort. We have stayed there many times, but this year was the best. We stayed in building, #64, facing the lake, between the activity centre and the Island pool. The suites are newly renovated, very comfortable, spacious, and very clean. Marriott has really gone to a lot of effort to improve Cypress Harbour and it shows. When making reservations be sure to ask for a renovated room and you won't be disappointed. All the staff at Cypress Harbour are very accomodating and friendly. There is a schedule of activities for all ages. The evening entertainment at the Clubhouse pool is a bonus, free and fun for the entire family. Don't miss the Hula show on Thursday nights! *A note to the reviewer who wrote they had to purchase soap for the dishwasher and washing machine. Dishwasher detergent is provided free of charge, in packets under the kitchen sink. If not, just a call to housekeeping will get you some.

Reviews.Title: “Great Week at Cypress Harbour with our family”
Reviews.Author: PartyOfFive_Grandma
Reviews.Content: We had a great week at Cypress Harbour. We had stayed at Marriott Horizons last year (across the street) and were concerned about some of the comments about the rooms at Cypress. Our room looked totally new...new furniture, paint, everything was as good as could be in building 66. The pools were great. We went with our kids, 3, 5, 8 and grandma. Lots of vegitation and water surrounding the rooms. Quiet. Lots of activities it you want. We even had our 8 year old try scuba in the pool with Scuba Steve, which was great. Comparied to Horizons, the pool has more space to swim, but no pirate ship or water slide. The kids did not seem to mind at all. Fun pool activities one day. Steel drum one night. Rooms, about the same, althought the two queens at Horizons were great. The hot tub in the master at Cypress is nice. I would recommend both equally. Nice little store and grill. I would recommend to anyone. We saw families as well as retirees having a good time. A nice mix.

Reviews.Title: “Much Quieter than Grande Vista”
Reviews.Author: NHgranite
Reviews.Content: We spent the last week of February in Orlando at Cypress Harbour over our children's winter break. Last year, we also came to Orlando for the same week but opted to stay at one of Marriott's other timeshare properties, the Grande Vista. In comparing the two properties, choose the Grande Vista if you want a hopping pool scene and lots of people and activity. If you want a quieter experience at an equally nice resort, choose Cypress Harbour. The plusses: Cypress Harbour has a very central location to ALL the parks. It was literally 15 minutes door-to-door to Epcot; two minutes to Seaworld and 10 minutes to Universal (once I actually read the directions the resort supplied, oops!) The staff and service were great. All of our requests were duly noted and carried out - including a 1 a.m. check-in that got pushed back to 2:30 a.m. due to flight delays. A smooth check-in (complete with complimentary stuffed animal for my youngest) at that hour isn't just a blessing but a necessity! The cheerful room decor and layout that assures privacy between the bedrooms. One of the largest Marketplaces that I have seen at a Marriott Vacation Club location. The minuses: The main pool area was closed for renovations, but due to open in a few days and easily visible. Even with the renovations the pools at Cypress Harbour won't be able to hold a candle to the pools at Grande Vista or Royal Palms etc. The units are a bit older than Grande Vista and even though the kitchen was refurbished (and lovely) the bathrooms need new showers, fixtures and tilework. We also had a few ant visitors when we ate near the screened porch. No trouble with bugs in the kitchen though :-) Overall, Cypress Harbour is definitely a quality place to stay in Orlando, especially if the pool scene isn't too important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: OliviaWestSussex
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Marriott Cypress Harbour for a two week stay from the 05th-16th February. We was very impressed with the efficient staff at the resort. Check in was a breeze and we stayed in building 53. The apartment was lovely, very spacious and had everything we could ever need. What suprised us was the amount of activites you could do at the Marriott. They have a full program running daily and you could join in as and when you wanted to. As we were there to do the Disney parks etc we were unable to make as much use of this as we would of liked. Our children loved hiring the tandam bikes to get us around the resort. All in all we had a great time and would definatly return. We have stayed in numerous Orlando resorts before and this is by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with Cypress Harbour”
Reviews.Author: NorthStarMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Our party of four stayed at Cypress Harbour the last week of Jan. The staff from the front desk to housekeeping could not have been more accommodating. We were in a newly renovated room overlooking the 6th tee box. The room was very clean and there was everything you would need for preparing meals. The spaciousness of the unit is the best part. The island pool was very warm even on the cool days and the whirlpools were delightful. The golfers in our party loved the course and found it challenging but user freindly. The location of Cypress Harbour is excellent if you're going to the Convention Center or to theme parks. There are more than enough "chain" restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Melands
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends who own timeshares. Our room was fairly clean, but some of the windows had rust/mold which was noticable. The overall facilities were nice, including game area, pools and clubhouse. Nothing extraordinary about this resort and it is slowly becoming outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have a timeshare here”
Reviews.Author: catherp
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect if you get a refurbished room. It's within a couple of miles of Seaworld and it's easy access to Disney. The room is beautiful. The kitchen is very well equipped. I stayed in the room babysitting for one of the days and found that it had enough space and enough to do that I didn't go stir crazy. We were only here for 3 days, but we're planning for a week next year.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: travellerfromalberta
Reviews.Content: My husband, two small children and my parents stayed here for one week at the end of Sept. We traded our timeshare in Mexico for this one. This was a very quiet time of year which was great because we had the island pool to ourselves each day we swam. We had requested a renovated room ahead of time which we recieved upon check in. ROOMS: Very large, modern decor, well equipped, even had a washer and dryer. Had a huge air tub in ensuite and double sinks, large shower. 3 televisions and also had a nice screened in deck which was great for playing cards and eating breakfast. The kitchen was fully equipped, nice living and dining area. LOCATION: Top notch. This hotel is close to International Drive which offers tons of dining and some souvenir shops and entertainment. Good proximity to The Florida Mall which has a Target in behind and a Burlington Coat Factory across the street. Good proximity to Disney, and Wet d Wild and the airport. Loved the location, can't say enough about it! EXTRAS: There was a playground right outside our room which was great for the kids. My husband used the fitness facilities, he said it was adequate but nothing special really. Check in was quick and friendly, The grounds were very nicely kept. Overall we were very pleased with our stay here and would not hesitate to choose this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: WorkingmomNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is a nice resort to stay at with kids due to the layout. The bedrooms are spacious and the kitchen is well stocked. The facilities for families are also nice - activity center with basketball, playground, shuffleboard, and a good amount of scheduled activities. The problem that we encountered was the cleaniness of the room and ants! Our unit had an ant problem and we had to have the maintenance team and an exterminator come and spray on several occasions. We also found chewed up chicken wing bones in between the bed and nightstand in the master bedroom. I've stayed at two other Marriott properties with similar or better amenties (Horizons and Grand Vistana) and our experience was completely different. When we head back to Orlando we won't be staying at Cypress Harbour again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative to Disney Properties”
Reviews.Author: AHFox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cypress Harbour Resort for the last week of August 06. My husband is a Marriott Rewards member. We had a two bedroom two bath villa on the third floor. There were four adults and three children. We had ample room - a sizeable screened in outdoor patio - living/dining area - and a fully equipped kitchen. The property was very well maintained. There were three different pool areas, all easily within walking distance from our unit. The drive to Disney was approximately ten minutes. We did receive the "time share" sale attempt, but did not attend. Never another word about it, no real pressure. Overall, A very nice property. No negative comments to report. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but some problems”
Reviews.Author: alexsndiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a newly remodeled unit near the main clubhouse. I really tried to like the resort but we encountered some problems. #1: Upon arrival, one of the chairs in the living room smelled like either puke or poop. We weren't sure. We notified staff to remove it, but nothing ever happened. We just put it in the corner and did not use it. #2: Shower pressure was horrible! Not enough pressure to clean out your hair. Embarrassing water pressure for a Marriott property. Otherwise the resort is a great place to stay. The rooms are huge. Kitchen and full size washer and dryer in the unit. The resort has plenty of things to do for the family. Themed paddle boats, fishing, activity center with video games, Poker tournaments for the adults, etc. Staff is awesome. Be sure to talk to Ira at the concierge desk. She was the best of all the concierges. She was extremely helpful. Gave us shortcut directions to Disneyworld to avoid the traffic on the freeways. We tipped her nicely before we left. The older Filipino gentlemen conceirge treated us like we were bothering him and we are Filipino! Beds were comfortable. Free wired internet. Free parking. Gas BBQ's needed to be replaced or cleaned. We didnt want to cook our met on those things. This is an older Marriott Timeshare resort. We own in Canyon Villas in Arizona which is far superior than Cypress Harbour. Cypress Harbour is still a good resort to stay in but they need to increase their water pressure before we return. The best sandwiches in Orlando is called Yellow Dog Eats. Do an internet search on it. Its a little bit out of the way, but it worth it. Stay away from all restaurants on International Drive. Over priced and tasteless. Avoid MING COURT for chinese food. No flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms!”
Reviews.Author: kwscraps
Reviews.Content: My 5-year old daughter and I just returned from a stay at Marriott's Cypress Harbour. We loved the accomodations! The master bed/bath was huge as was the living area. Once we arrived I called my husband and couldn't stop saying how big the room was and that it was too bad he had to stay home to work! The villa was also clean and everything they said was available was there. We had a couple of small maintenance issues that came up. A toilet that needed to be fixed and a window that wouldn't close. Both times the maintenance staff was there within 15 minutes and quickly resolved the issue. We rented a mini pontoon boat one afternoon and that was alot of fun. It was too cold for us to use the swimming pools but they looked nice. We will definitely look for availability at this resort when we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay!”
Reviews.Author: jnoel1977
Reviews.Content: This resort has it all. Great rooms, staff, management, activeities, location, pools, all were really super. It was a really great experiance for our family and I'm sure it will be for yours too.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but a nice choice!”
Reviews.Author: kahl1_1999
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent choice for our family. The rooms are nice. Not excellent, not fancy, but nice. There is a lot to do on the property. We fished, rented paddle boats, went swimming, played basketball, played in the video arcade etc. All were enjoyable. Pools were nice (There are 3) and the multiple hot tubs were a nice touch. One interesting item that we liked was none of the hot tubs seemed to be the same temp as the others. When just my wife and I went down to we would go into one of the hotter tubs, when the kids were with us we would go in one of the cooler ones. This was nice to take the kids "swimming" when it was only 55 degrees out. Same went with the big pools, seemed like the 'island" pool was a few degrees warmer than the main pool. The full kitchen is helpful for families and was a perfrect place to eat breakfast before going to the theme parks. We also picked up dinner and ate in the room several nights. It is nice to have the flexibilitiy of a full kitchen. All in all, this was a great place to stay for a family. If you want a "luxury" resort this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare on harbour villa road!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kyndall
Reviews.Content: thanksgiving eve my family and i traveled to orlando from miami we stayed at this resort for two days when we arrived, i waited at check in for 15 mins. when front desk clerk finally processed me and went up to the room the whole living room floor was soak & wet i called front desk to tell the problem in the room,they stated "oh they just cleaned your room for your arrival". we will send you house keeping to clean up the water on the floor.housekepping arrived and tried to vaccum up the water but could not housekeeping reccommended for us to change rooms. i was very upset driving for three hours after work and had to run in to this mess. finally we 've change rooms and the room was wheelchair accessible i had to call front desk again to complaint and they had to change my family and i again. our thanksgiving eve was very stessed and not relaxing!!! the weather was cold 56 degrees and the units had no heat!!! only thing good i can least say is the unit is very large(two bedroom) very disappointed with marriott never again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place, especially the staff”
Reviews.Author: CramerFamily
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptional, everyone we encountered was very nice and extremely helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The pools and other common areas were clean and well maintained. We were very pleased to be able to get a mid week check-in. There was a small store with fresh fruit and bagels and donuts to get us through breakfast and ice cream for late night snacking. We ate lunch and dinner at Disney and Universal every day. We would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay for our Family!”
Reviews.Author: massrainy
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5, with kids ages 15, 13, and 10. We need a lot of space when we travel and we got it with the Cypress Harbour. The villa is very large, with a huge master suite and a decent size second bedroom. The living area is large with a sectional sofa, large armoir with TV, and desk area (with free internet!). The dining area had a large table and 6 chairs. There was a separate utility room for the washer and dryer, which were large capacity, and with the door closed, you could hardly hear the noise. Our screened-in balcony overlooked a grassy area and was so nice for morning coffee and late-evening relaxing. The villa was very clean, and all the upholstery and linens were newer. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The bed is especially important to me, as I have back problems and need a good mattress. The daily housekeeping service was great and also complimentary. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We called the front desk from the airport at 10:30 am and were offered check in right away without any additional fees. When a DVD rented at the hotel performed poorly, we were credited with the entire rental amount without having to ask twice. There are three pool areas, but we used only the main area as we were closest to that spot. It is set to be renovated starting in January (and some of the buildings around there are already being worked on), but it didn't look like it needed any improvement at all. The only complaint is that the pool and the hot tubs could be a little warmer. Location was great! You are in an area that has 3 Marriott properties (Residence Inn and Horizons) and it is just off the major roads. We were close to Seaworld and Universal, and close enough to all the Disney parks. About the timeshare inquiries -- just as another reviewer mentioned -- don't pick up the phone or claim your "free gift". The phone only rang once in our 6 days, and it was a polite woman inviting us to breakfast with the offer of $200 in credits at Disney. We were not interested, and that was the only approach made to us. Website photos often flatter resort amenities and rooms, but in this case, the photos do not lie. It is a beautiful resort with great facilities. Our only regret is that because we were park-hoppers each day, we could not take advantage of the many activities scheduled at the resort. We did not even check out the new exercise club. Just for some reference for this glowing review, we have also stayed at the Sheraton Vistana Resort and the Cypress Pointe Grand Villas, both of which we liked. The Cypress Harbour, however, was far superior to each of them. As long as the rates remain competitive, we will definitely stay at Cypress Harbour when we return to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards.”
Reviews.Author: jle1012
Reviews.Content: Like one of the other reviewers we also booked this through Interval and had the choice between this one and the Horizons by Marriott, after sitting through the sales pitch for Horizons we realized that we had made the wrong choice and we should have stayed at that one. If you have young children and have a choice between these two resorts you should go with Horizons. They have an amazing pool/water park for the kids. Although we enjoyed our stay and the amenities are very nice it was not up to Marriott standards. The girl behind the desk acted like we were putting her out when we tried to check in. Since we had arrived prior to 4:00 we had to wait and asked the concierge to recommend a place to go to for lunch while we waited for them to get our room ready so that we could check in his only recommendation was McDonalds...... Not really what we were looking for..... When we asked him where the Ice Cream Social was (they offer this every day @ 4:00 in the lower lobby) we were told that it was in the activities building which is on the other side of the resort. How could he not know where this is when it is held approx. 10 feet from him.... and is there everyday??? The floor in the master bath looked like it hadn't been scrubbed in months and the shower was one of those slow drainers...... On the good side the guys @ the pool bar where great and one of them even went out of his way to get us information on the Kennedy Space Center. Kudos to you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better service than the JW....!”
Reviews.Author: daifly
Reviews.Content: Having got fed up with my first few days in Orlando at the JW Marriott (qv) I started to look for other Marriotts in the vicinity. I've stayed before at the Grande Vista VC and have really enjoyed the place, far more relaxed, much less stuffy and HUGE villas for the same price as a room in the JW; however this time it was full and the only availability was at the Cypress Harbour. Really shouldn't have been concerned, the service was exactly the same as the Grande Vista and it's only about 3 minutes drive away (and as close to the convention centre and parks). Checkin was easy and friendly, the villa was spotless and huge! Always feel a bit wasteful using the spa bath (which takes more water than my pond...) but it's a bit of a luxury that's worth taking! Nice balcony overlooking the golf course, free internet, two double rooms with ensuite, could probably sleep about eight people in total. Kitchen is fully equipped (useful for storing breakfast if nothing else) and the washer/dryer makes taking less clothes with you an easy decision! Great faciliites (I was there on business followed by a couple of days in the parks) and everyone couldn't help enough. Like the Grande Vista they have Pizza Hut on site, which is a good selling point in anyone's book! This one or the Grande Vista and you'll have a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Doriee
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a resort, we did not quite know what to expect, I tell you we will never go back to HOTEL living again ... we are sold all the way on resorts. our HONEYMOON in Paris was very disappointing so we made a pact to travel to other destinations and research Before we go. I had read the reviews on trip advisor before selecting our resort, I am so glad we did. The two bedroom unit was VERY spacious, it was so convient to have the washer and dryer there and having the split bathrooms and the bedrooms was a great touch. We definately will be back and we will bring our parents with us next time. Great location, it definately met our expectations. O and the kitchen was a very nice touch too, we were able to go to the 24hr Walmart buy a few groceries for breakfast and lunch and used the money we saved for our trip to the theme parks and SHOPPING. GOOD CALL everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: Sabersmom
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Cypress Harbour this year. (First time was 1st week of May). We love the resort and accomodations. The first time we were in building 64, and this time in building 63 - with lake views, as requested. The units are clean and spacious, staff is very friendly, and the pools are great. I don't have anything negative to say about the resort or staff. It's a great place for families that want the extra room and option of eating in for some meals. We had breakfast, lunches and a few dinners in the condo. I would recommend this resort to anyone - we are hoping to go back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: Skip3815
Reviews.Content: A blizzard in the North East made it neccesary to stay in Florida another two days. (Darn!!) We had stayed at the Cypress Harbour before and wanted to go back. They did NOT disappoint. With three little ones in tow we went to our room. It was a spacious two bed, two bath, with cement walls. The kids playing didn't bother anyone, and even with us be next to the elevators, nothing disturbed them. I really can't believe how quiet and peaceful it was. We purchased a time share with the Grande Vista because we need the extra bedroom, but we certainly will come back here everytime we get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: alawy
Reviews.Content: The bed sheets , blankets, comforters and towels were old, raggy and torn apart.

Reviews.Title: “One of Orlando's BEST”
Reviews.Author: Islandski1128
Reviews.Content: I have been doing the timeshare thing for quite some time and if it wasn't for the fact Floridas trade value isn't that good I would definately buy at Marriotts Cypress Harbour Resort. My family and I just returened last night and had such a good time there that on several days we opted to stay at the resort and use the facilities instead of going to the amusement parks we had prepaid days at. First of all when we got there at 10:00 AM since our flight was a red eye our first inpression was how great the place looked it has a tropical theme with a key west feel in the building architecture. When we went to check in knowing that check in time was around 4:00 PM we figured they would let us know when our room was ready and page us. Instead they told us they had a room and let us check in at 10:00 AM with no extra charge. I also asked for a renovated room and that is what they gave us. The grounds are large and there is plenty of parking. The two pools are great the only complaint is there is not bar on the island pool for drinks and food, you have to go to the main pool. The rooms were fantastic. extrememly clean and well maintained. The theme in the rooms is nautical and I read in some reviews that it was outdated but I didn't thinks so because if you have ever stayed at Disneylands Paradise Pier Hotel the rooms look the same as far as theme goes. This is a great place for families and is in the perfect location for theme park access. The staff is incredibly helpful and responsive to your needs. I would stay here again and recomend it to anyone. Marriotts Cypress Harbour made up for our trip to Orlando last year where we unfortunately stayed in the Westgate Lakes Resort (which is a dump by any standards and can't even compare on a 1-10 scale with Cypress Harbour its a -25). I would just like to say thank you to Marriott Cypress Harbour and all your staff for making our vacation this year one we will never forget. I felt there were not enough posted pictures of the resort so I took quite a few so everyone could see for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Out of This World!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: suziross
Reviews.Content: We stayed at his resort in May of this year and it is the best place I have ever been. My husband and I went along with my son, my father, his wife and two children and we had a ball. The staff were very kind and the resort was immaculate. I could not fault a thing. In fact the staff were that kind and caring that when my dad fell ill on our last night they did noe hesitate in calling a local doctor and giving as more time to check out the next day to make sure he was alright. 1st class service from everyone. Our rooms were amazing and the resort itself was clean and well maintained. The pools were excellent for both adults and children and the miami vice cocktails went down a treat for us ladies.....nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. The resort itself was centre to everything...and many a night we would stand outside on our balcony and watch Seaworld firewors at night. We got home on a saturday and on the monday back at work I had booked two weeks off for next October hoping to go back to this resort.....well the following week we found out how good the miami vice cocktails were......I am now 3 months pregnant (how is marriott for a name!!!!!!!). We have now decided that we will have to go back in October 2008 and my husband and I have decided we will not stay anywhere other than this resort on that trip and future trips to orlando (we try and go every 2 years). Roll on 2008, great rooms, cocktails, entertainment and most of all kind, caring and very proffessional staff. A+++++++

Reviews.Title: “Great for young families!!”
Reviews.Author: MontrealMommy
Reviews.Content: Our family spent a week at Marriott Cypress Harbour in May and we think it is by far the best resort for families with babies and/or toddlers we have ever stayed at. Great (large) rooms, full kitchens, washer and dryer, etc. A screened-in patio with a great view. For those seeking a quiet room, stay in the farthest rooms (off the gold course rather than near the pools)...very tranquil for the little ones at nap time/bed time. The food at the pool-side grill was great (simple sandwishes and burgers but very, very good). All staff was friendly and helpful and guests were great too. This resort is close to Disney, Sea World, Animal Kingdom, etc...convenient. Also, shop at the Publix grocery store nearby (ask front desk for directions). We ADORED our time at this resort and would absolutely go back. By far the best resort for young families. Ask for a remodelled room (some rooms are newer than others in terms of decor). Elevators in all buildings makes stoller access effortless. I would not look any further if you want a family vacation near Disney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would go back”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl11
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed at the Marriott Cypress Harbour, and we loved it!! It was very, very clean and very accomodating. The people at the front desk did everything to fit our needs. We called a few days before our vacation to make sure we got a newly renovated room, they told us they would try to get us one and when we got there it was perfect. Everything was nice and in place, and clean. The one pool we saw was great. It has a volleyball net and sometimes they would have people playing music. They also had down by the pool, a lady who did airbrush tatoos, hair braiding, and hair wraps. At the end of our vacation we took family pictures. We were scheduled for 10:45 they took us at 10:15 because someone had cancelled! They were all very pleasant and no one gave you a hard time. They showed you where everything in the hotel was. They have an activity center. But they have certain times for everything. To get to the other side of the lake they have a boat with leather seats and it was so relaxing!! I would definitely go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Coachbill
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Cypress Harbour and loved it! It has about 500+ units so it's not as enormous as many timeshares. Was able to check in 4 hours early and had a recently renovated unit w/lake view. The truth is there are no bad buildings, you'll either have a lake or golf course view. Units are HUGE (over 1300 sq ft) really a home away from home. Very clean w/everything a family needs. Convenient to Disney parks, we watched fireworks from Seaworld from our sreened in porch. Many activities for children and 3 great pools. The only potential negative (we didn't care) is there are limited eating out options on sight. GREAT place, our choice for future visits to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: hbsprite
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 1 week during our recent trip to Orlando. The property is absolutely gorgeous and is wonderfully themed. As long as you understand that this is a vacation club property (they give their owners priority to the best rooms), you will be happy. We stayed on the ground floor (the units are 4 floors) and loved it! The units are very spacious (1200 sq. ft.). They also have a washer and dryer in the unit and a full kitchen. The screened patios (with a ceiling fan) were wonderful to enjoy the outdoors but keep the bugs out. In the master bedroom there is a jacuzzi tub! The resort has lots of activities for families and kids (none of which we partook in). The swimming pools were wonderful. As long as you don't expect a full service hotel you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed the week of June 12-19. arrived on a rainy day and was given a ride to the room which was a good walk away. the room was great! two bedrooms, 2 baths, great kitchen with all the things you could ever need to cook. i stayed there with 3 friends and we had plenty of room. the place was very clean. the only thing i could say to improve on would be the quality of the sheets. gave us plenty of towels. the pools were great! lots of places to sit and relax! the marketplace serves food and pizza hut which def. came in handy. the gym was nice not outstanding but open 24/7. tons of activities for kids, arcade, numerous play grounds, tennis courts, basketball courts, golf.... i would def. come back again. the staff was also very helpful with planning trips to the parks and for resturant advice.

Reviews.Title: “****bed bug alert ******”
Reviews.Author: barbeaujo
Reviews.Content: stayed there 3 nights in february before our disney cruise & had reservation for another 4 nights after the cruise (wich we cancell!). They had to change us 3 times from condo to condo. In the morning we were waking up with blood stain in bed sheet. They were supposed to call in exterminator. Never came. Other then that, a/c was not working properly. If it would be cleaner we would go back. Half of community is being refurbished because of pest problem (they remove everything, carpet,furniture..etc) So if you have a good deal, make reservation but have them promise you would be in newly renovated room. We had paid $250 a night to stay there and had a 2 bedroom villa.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned having read some reviews of this resort before our holiday, but I can only heap loads of praise for the resport, its staff and its facilities. We would certainly recommend staying here and definitely want to go again (not ncecessarily for Disney etc). Unfortunately I sustained a foot injury the evening before we flew to Orlando (from UK), but the support I received from all staff at Cypress Harbour was commendable, from checking to see if I was OK or whether I needed any help to words of support and encouragement. The resort facilities are excellent; the appartment was well equipped and well furnished; swimming pools and activities well organised, staff and concierge facility were excellent. What more could we ask for!!

Reviews.Title: “ready to go back again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the cypress harbour for a week. Just got back and thought it was a great place. First the check-in was smooth, no overzealous clerks , no bellhops, just check-in , here is your key, welcome gift and this is a map on how to get to your condo. I traveled with my daughter, son and there friends. A total of 7 of us, three girls ranging in age from 17-18 and three boys ranging in age from 20-22. The place to me was very good, the master bedroom especially with the oversize jacuzzi and seperate shower. The living room and dining room made it very spacey. Even with young adults, there was still room . We weren't crowded at all. The staff did call me to ask about a tour of there timeshare, since I was not a member , but I told them I wasn't interested and they thank me for my time. Activities abound, three pools and always activities, basketball, tennis courts, golf course and a 9 hole mini golf.. The location of the resort makes it ideal and at night while sitting on your fenced in balcony , pure quiet. The kitchen was a little small , and maybe they could have had a couple more pots. but still it was manageable. They probably would have gave me more, but hey we didn't stay in the room all that much. One thing that I did need was a toaster , I called the front desk and told them my toaster was broken and approx. 15 minutes later ... there it was. I asked about the refurbrished rooms at check-in and I was told that the newer refurbrished rooms were dedicated to members of the Marriot. So my condo was almost in the rear of the resort facing Sea World, however it was in great shape.. Maybe a 5 minute walk from the front desk or any other place on the resort , at the most.. My recommendation to anyone deciding to go. JUST GO... Had a wonderful time , very pleasant staff, very pleasant place. Ready to go back again ...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Loved it, Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Ulliboo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Cypress Harbour over the Easter break. There was three of us, and the spaciousness of the room overwhelmed us. It was spotlessly clean, and well kept. When we first checked in we arrived at 1pm. Check in is normally around 4pm. They took our cell number and we started out the side door to look at the pool. We literally hadn't got around the pool, when we got a call stating our room was ready. We were very grateful. They advised us we would be in building 71, on the ground floor...oh, oh I thought, here we go. Building 71 looked a long way off from all the amenities of the resort, and ground floor kinda struck me the wrong way. I shouldn't have worried. It's a short drive to the buildings, and a short walk to the island pool. The ground floor unit was great. I enjoyed being able to sit in the enclosed balcony and look at the pond in the back of the condo and the quiet was great. Inside the condo, the kitchen had everyhting you needed for a short or extended stay. The full size dishwasher, stove, and fridge were all very clean and worked great. Our unit was not renovated, but still looked very new. The second bedroom was huge, and could have easily accommodated 4 people with the hide a bed sofa. Second bathroom was very nice, with a shower and bath combo, and was very spacious. The master bedroom was huge with a lovely whirlpool tub, seperate shower stall that easily fits 2 !!!, and a large closet with safe. The pools were lovely. We used the one on the island the most. It has a sandy beach by the lake, and has lots of tropical feeling with shady places to lay, and enjoy the view. The pool by the check in area is usually more busy, and lively. They had a great steel drum player/singer there one night, and I felt like I was in the Caribbean. Nice store that was well stocked with all sorts of items, and they had a nice take out with pizza and french fries and other grill orders. Sea World literally is within walking distance, and you are minutes from Int. Drive. Note for supermarkets, there are 2 Publix close to the resort. The newer one is out by the Premium outlets, and is much bigger and nicer. We only found it on our last day there. Disney is literally 2 exits away on the I-4. Traffic was great, and navigating was a breeze. Needless to say, we were so impressed that we have already booked for next year, and have invited the grandparents to come to. Very enjoyable trip, and by far the best place we have stayed in Orlando to date.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 kids (7 & 3) stayed at the marriott cypress harbour the week of may 6th 2006. I had read a couple of bad reviews and wanted to make sure i set the record straight. this place is AWESOME on all levels. Have the convienant store with edys ice cream, pizza hut, krispy kreme donuts, starbucks, and the grill made it so we never even had to leave the resort if we didn't want to. The grounds were spectacular with 3 pools, a nice pool bar, music and activities at all times, a nice rec center. The actual room was phenominal. So clean and neat. The staff was extremely helpful. I think most rooms are renovated now so that isn't really an issue with asking for a renovated room. We did ask and were in building 56. the room was beautiful. Some other guests there said they come every year and LOVE IT! Location wise, you can take back roads to all the disney parks and avoid all the interstate traffic, you are there within 10-15 minutes depending on the parks. You are right next to publix/walgreens and the premium outlets and many restaurants and right next to sea world. IF we go back to orlando we will not stay anywhere but marriott cypress harbor!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hamzoo
Reviews.Content: My family just got back from our vacation at the Cypress Harbour. What a fantastic resort. The room was perfect for us (2 adults and 4 kids). Their were several pools and alot of activities for our kids to participate in. The staff was great. They were all very nice and helpful. We are not owners and it was our first time in Orlando. I would recommend this place to anyone going there on vacation. Was 15 minutes from the Walt Disney parks and their were alot of places to eat and grocery stores close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkk747
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel - we stayed in a 2 bed appartment and it was HUGE. Really well laid out and although the furnishing was a little dated the whole place was really spotless. All kitchen items looked brand new and everything was provided. Would definitely recommend it for familes. The only downside in my opinion was that the food facilities at the hotel were limited. We were travelling with a young baby who goes to sleep at 7 - so it was pizza or pizza!! During the day you could get sandwiches, burgers etc. Location was pretty good too as it was a short drive to Disney, Discovery cove, Sea World or I.Drive.

Reviews.Title: “The TOP T/S resort in the Orlando Area...by a non-owner!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KenK
Reviews.Content: Nothing compares in the entire area when it comes to a Timeshare Week...and I'm NOT AN OWNER here trying to put down others for my owned resort. Spacious 2 bed 2 bath, (nothing smaller) The Grille Room, the several pools, the boats and bikes, the PM trips to almost every where.....(Discounts for MVCI owners at the Marriott Golf Courses that surround this and the HGVC resorts. We alos don't own at the Hilton (GVC), the Sheraton Vistana, the old Wilson Worlds' Orange Lakes CC or any of the Marriott T/S resorts...which are usually very good...this one tops them out.....staff helpful ness, cleanliness, evening entertainment. Be forewarned, the CH bus and boat shuttle is limitted in the summer months. (May only be 'on demand') I've been to those listed above,,,,,the problem seems to be variation in the different room sections of a resort. Very consistant in the CH Units,,,,even the non- refurbed. And much nicer....but I would return to any of them...First on list would be CH (Or maybe a DVC with elevators :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shay0571
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Cypress was wonderful from beginning to end. The staff was excellent, the grounds were beautiful, the pools were super. The condo was spacious for a family of 4 - plenty of room for everyone. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “OK...But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: C3334
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice...we were able to stay in a recently renovated room. Lots of kids with parents yelling at them all day. Not my idea of a relaxing vacation. Jet bath tub didn't work and no one seemed interested in fixing it. The maid flirted terribly with my husband practically acting like a prostitute...making him propositions. The bar area was very dirty and sticky at night toward the end of shift. We asked for a cab to come directly to our room on the day of departure and the front desk messed that up...giving them the wrong room number. One hour later they finally sent their shuttle bus to our room and then called a cab for the main entrance. At $350.00 per night, this was definately over sold to us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: DJ3722
Reviews.Content: Our first time-share experience with Marriott. Beautiful property; great location near amusement parks; clean relaxed atmostphere. The hotel property is quite spread out, so you can enjoy quite time away from all the kids, if you choose. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Noisey dishwasher, however. Be sure to wear shoes or flip-flops on the wooden decks - I was gettin out of a sun lounger, and got a huge sliver in my foot. The hotel sent a medic, who kindly removed it-no extra charge. A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Harbor is Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: kathieT55
Reviews.Content: We own a time share at Cypress Harbor Marriott in Orlando and we have stayed at the Marriott's Horizons timeshares in Orlando. Both of these properties are wonderful vacation destinations. The timeshare units are beautifully decorated and well-maintained. They are comfortable, classy and well-stocked -- with high quality furniture, appliances, carpeting, beds and up-to-date bathrooms. The location of these propertiers is ideal. They are a fast and easy drive to Walt Disney World, Seaworld, the Florida Mall and the fabulous Orlando outlets. However, you could have a wonderful vacation in Orlando, even if you never left the property, because the grounds and pools are a quiet, private, lush tropical paradise. Surprisingly, all of these things are not the main reasons we love our time share so much. We love our timeshare primarily because of the wonderful people who work at all levels of the Marriott Company. These people are flexible, professional, courteous and they always aim to accomodate their owners. Way to go, Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our return trip to Cypress Harbour”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the week of March 12, 2006, which was our 2nd visit to this resort (last visit was March 2001). This visit met and exceeded our expectations. The resort grounds were impeccable, staff were courteous and professional, and our recently renovated 2BR unit was superb. The children's programmes are extensive, as are the number of leisure and sports activities - boating, cycling, beach, etc.. needed to keep a young family occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Good Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lost_forever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott's Cypress Habour with family 2 years ago. Check in was simple and fast, so we could get to our room faster. When we got to the room, yes, there were bug splatters on the door, but that didn't really matter. Our room was not refurbished, but it was surprisingly clean. The layout was very nice and unique for a Marriott, but the decor was. The shower was annoying because you had to stick your hand outside the shower to change the water temperature. There was a nice screened in balcony, but there is a spot near the bottom where it is not screened in, so you might get some lizards in your patio overnight, but that didnt bother us that much. Our room overlooked a lake with a fountain, and you can rent paddleboats, swan boats, etc. And there was a bridge across and a water taxi. There were two pool areas, one which had a sauna and waterfall, and the other having wave makers, whic didnt work at the time. There was a lack of a restaurant on site, but Orlando had many dining choices. The hotel is situated close to I-drive and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ClearBlueOcean
Reviews.Content: When we made the reservation we asked for a room with a nice view, and we were very happy with the room - the view was beautiful. We said we didn't care how far we were from the pool or if the room was renovated. We were far from the pool in a non-renovated room, but the grounds are so beautiful, what's wrong with walking through paradise to get to the pools? The pools are very, very beautiful. And the room, or I should say rooms, although not renovated were still beautiful, and spacious and well appointed, and did I mention beautiful? Everything about this place is beautiful...

Reviews.Title: “Top place to stay in Orlando!!! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband are a young couple and we recently stayed here overnight on February 24th and all I can say is wow! I want to go back! Upon looking online for a nice Hotel in Orlando, I found the Marriot Cypress Harbour Vacation Resort listed here on Tripadvisor, It had great reviews so I signed up for Marriot Rewards, and I was able to book the room for a one night stay directly on the Marriot's website. Upon arrival the hotel/resort's grounds were beautiful, they had a grocery store to buy anything you would need for your stay on the premises, outside seating in the pavillion that leads to a beautiful walkway around the lake beside the gorgeous pool they had outside, they even have there own pizza hut onsite! I went inside and following the advice of those on tripadvisor I asked for a newly renovated room, the reply was "yes, of course" It was great we were given a room on the second floor between building 54-56. We walked in and were amazed, it was huge, it had 2 bedrooms a full kitchen, dishes, dishwasher, fridge w/icemaker, large area with bar stools countertop area, kitchen table with chairs, huge couch, the first bedroom was nice, but it was the two of us were only there for one night, would be great for a family. It had a bed a couch and a tv in that room. A screened in balcony area with outside light and table, this place was immaculate (oh yeah and they give you a welcome gift at the desk when you check in which may come in handy). They also have a washer and dryer in the villa. The master bedroom had a king size bed, comfyy and what really won us over was the huge round hotub in the master bedroom which comfortably fits two people. Alot of hotels say jacuzzi suite for two and its this tiny tub with jets, this hotub was great, huge. It even lit up inside. A large shower area, and 2 bathroom sinks. I would highly recomend this for familys and romantic couples!

Reviews.Title: “great beautiful can"t wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: sillap
Reviews.Content: this is the best place for a family to stay. we were seven people in the room and we did not even bump into each other.i loved it and am going back in april.great accses to the highway to get to disney.

Reviews.Title: “Rock Solid for Families Looking For A Base for Disney & More”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and our two boys (3.5 yrs and 1.5 yrs) stayed at the Marriott Cypress Harbour for 11 nights in December 2005 and we were impressed and very satisfied. We had some concerns given some of the reviews here, but these turned out to be inconsequential. We stayed in a two bedroom condo in Building 66, which is nearest to the "Island" Pool and a short walk (5 mins) from both the activity center and the main pool and reception area. There were also convenient small playgrounds just outside as well as a barbecue. We found no bugs (perhaps due to the winter, of course) and had no complaints about the furnishings or cleanliness of our room----typical condo pastels that you'd never put in your own house but harmless enough. For what it is worth, our couch cushions matched! The room was very large and well fitted out. Plenty of utensils, cutlery and pots & pans all in an adult sized kitchen. Daily laundry service plus full sized washer & drier, so our gamble of packing light paid off. Two full baths and shower---and the master bedroom bath was an enormous jacuzzi. Other than the noise like a jet engine, having a soak at the end of a day of lugging the kids around the Magic Kingdom was a big bonus. Plenty of bedroom and convertible sofa beds so visiting grandparents and siblings were able to stay over without crowding. The outside porch went underused because the weather was typical Orlando winter of mid-60s and breezy. The pools were not quite as heated as we'd have liked given the cool days, but the multiple hot tubs nearby each very large pool made it possible to keep the shivers from setting in while the kids happily splashed around and turned blue. There was also a little sandy beach which was a nice change from poolside concrete. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially at the activity center where they took a shine to our boys. The activity center itself was a bit sleepy because we were there during off-peak, but still provided a place to explore and enough variety (basketball, ping-pong, swings, mini-golf, game room, checkers, etc.) to make return visits exciting. Group activities like egg hunts and arts and crafts were OK but suffered from the lack of a number of kids. The on-site store was very convenient for missed out supplies and a quick fix of Krispy Kremes or a Pizza Hut pizza when you've run out of ideas for what you might feed the kids. The location was absolutely perfect. Secluded, but minutes from Sea World (which is a terrific and chilled out park), convenient to shopping for food and close to Disney and the other parks. We were never so far away that a child melting down in the car would fill us with dread! Home was only 10-15 minutes off no matter where we were. We'll be back, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Marriott resort convenient to everything in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyPriscilla
Reviews.Content: Our family spent the week before Christmas in a very spacious and well appointed 2 bedroom villa. The view from our balcony overlooked the lake, pools and swan boats. The staff could not have been nicer. We called on the road and after a long drive were given a unit as soon as we arrived. The unit and the grounds were very well maintained. We were please to see how vigilant the staff was at the security gate. Besides keeping us safe it was nice to see a wave, smile and welcome home after a day in the parks. The location was excellent. We were on I-4 in a matter of minutes and on to various fun activities all over the central Florida area. We will indeed return when we are visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Cypress Harbour, we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second year at Cypress Harbour. Upon registering we could have immediately gotten a unit away from the main pools (it was 12:30 p.m.), or we could have waited for a unit in Building 66, which is close to the island pool. Since we had been in Building 66 before, we opted to wait. We bought grocieries, and when we came back our unit was available. Checking in was a breeze. Building 66 is not renovated and is a little dated. I can't complain because everything has always been clean and well maintained. I like the proximatey to the island pool. My father is handicapped and my mother has bad knees. We were able to drive very close to the island pool to park and walk over the bridge to the pool. There were always straight back chairs for my father to sit on. Building 66 was close enough for me to walk back to our unit to grab drinks and snacks. I also like the huge screened in porch, which is big enough for a table and four chairs. Cypress Harbour is so easy to find from the airport. Route 4, the Beeline Express, International Drive, and Sand Lake Road are close by. Being a married woman who is use to her husband driving everywhere, I have no problem navigating the Marriott Cypress Harbour area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property”
Reviews.Author: grandmom32
Reviews.Content: Cypress Harbour Villas are wonderful! Following the advice posted @ this site, we requested a renovated villa in buildings 50-56. We both telephoned (2 weeks ahead)and faxed (3 days before arrival)our request for a non-smoking, ground floor,renovated room in one of the aforementioned buildings. When we arrived, the desk clerk confirmed our request and gave us the keys to room #5116. We were delighted! Our room with a screened-in patio was right on the lake, close to the exit (free parking), a building away from the lobby and the largest of the 3 pools, and a nice walk to the exercise facility (I walked on the treadmill daily). All of our requests had been honored. The concierge, as well as the entire staff (from housekeeping and groundskeeping to maintenance) were incredibly friendly and helpful. The concierge made all dinner reservations (including some freebees) - Emeril's (great)Wolfgang Puck (too salty & carrot cake was close to dry) Fulton's Crab House (fantastic crab cakes), Cirque, provided excellent directions for everywhere we went, and arranged for a timeshare presentation @ Horizon's across the street. Although we had no intention of purchasing, the $125 in Marriott money we recieved for a low-key presentation was too good to pass up as we were able to deduct the $125 from the Cirque Du Soleil tickets that had been charged to our credit card (make sure you give a credit card @ check in for incidentals); we ended up paying $34 instead of $158.76 for two tickets! This resort location is perfect! Publix, Walgreens, and Premium Outlets are minutes away. WDW, SeaWorld, and Universal all are close. Yet, the resort itself is relaxed and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing base for exploring Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Budgeter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cypress Harbour for a week in November. The two-bedroom villa was a nice change from a typical hotel room. The full kitchen allowed us to have breakfast and lunch in the room every day, and about half of our dinners, too, saving lots of money (which, in Orlando, is too easy to spend elsewhere). Our kids (ages 7,5, and 2) really liked the 3 pools and were always asking to go back to the Activity Center for games, crafts, snacks, etc. We toured Orlando for 3 days and spent 4 days sticking around the resort. The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. We recieved 2 calls to visit a "sister" property for their time-share pitch, but there was no pressure once we declined. We arrived early to check in, and the only available room was in a building quite far from the pools and Activity Center. We had a 10-15 minute walk each time we wanted to do something, which was fine for us but could be more difficult in the middle of July. There were lots of mini-vans in the parking lot and we saw lots of families around, but when we were in our rooms we heard not one sound from any of our neighbors. We mixed and mingled in the common areas of the resort, but when we went back to our villa we were completely private. The furniture was comfortable and the kitchen was well stocked with dishes for 8 and pots/pans/serving utensils. They even provided dish washer detergent and laundry soap. We truly enjoyed our stay at this fine facility.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Adventure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Daughter and Law and grands enjoyed a wonderful vacation there. We really enjoyed Cypress Harbour. Very spacious and clean. I would definitly return and stay there again. My Granddaughter four years old asked if she could send for Her Dad and other siblings so they could live there forever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 9/9/05 to 9/15/05. We stayed in 6641 (top floor, corner unit). The room was spacious! The resort has three pools (we were near the Island Pool) and plenty of activites for everyone in the family. The location of the hotel is excellent with easy access to I-4, the Bee Line Expressway, Central Florida Parkway, and International Drive. Down the road is a brand new Publix supermarket and Walgreen's (ask for directions at the front desk). The hotel grounds are well kept and staff is very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: emperor789
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks and were sad to leave, it has everything you need in the extremely comfortable and clean apartments, and if its not there they will get it for you. All the staff from the gardeners to the bar staff were polite and easy to get along with. The grounds are gorgeous and the views over the pool extending to the fountain in the lake was very relaxing after a hard day at the parks. I would recommend car hire as there isn't really anything in walking distance although I understand the I-Trolley bus stops outside the entrance. Also because of this it would be nice if there were an on-site restaurant, it would be nice to meet other people staying there while having a relaxing meal as most people are away through the day at the parks or shopping. However the Pizza shop and sandwiches are very nice. Those are only slight grumbles to what is without doubt the nicest, most relaxing and beautiful place we have ever stayed in and one that we will definately be visiting again, we can't speak highly enough. The web-site photo's certainly don't show it in its best light. If your going to Orlando stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hoiliday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We used a travel agent for the first time ever to book our holiday to Florida, but we used Trip Adviser before we booked it. The Marriott Cypress Harbour was the most fantastic luxury appartment with all the amenities that you could cram in. We had a 2 bedroom appartment that slept 6 people although there was only 4 of us. Our children shared a bedroom with a double bed and a double sofa bed. The master bedroom was amazing with an enormous king size bed and a massive jacussi, a walk in shower and 2 sinks. The children also had their own bathroom. There was a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher (thank goodness). There was a seperate laundry room with waher and seperate dryer. We had a superb view from our balcony (which was equipped with mosquitto net) overlooking the beautiful golf course. The 3 swimming pools were lovely and clean with plenty of sun beds. We would reccommend that you find out what other facilities they have as they do not sell these as well as they should. For example dvd rental (which comes in handy when the kids want to chill after a long day at the parks), you will need your credit card for this ($5 approx.). There is also a basic takeaway pizza also supplying salads and hotdogs (really great they will deliver to your room). As per some comments on trip adviser we telephoned to ensure that we had an appartment that had been refurbished, and we received this. All in all we would definately go back to this resort as it was supurb, friendly, clean, spacious and confortable after a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was great. We were close to the pool. The "stores" were great. The convience store, Pizza Hut and Edy's ice cream was great. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The barb was wonderful and the pool was nice. I would defintely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Marriott's Cypress Harbour”
Reviews.Author: justmitype
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, plus my 14 year old son & his friend, stayed at the Cypress Harbour from August 15 - 19th. We had a beautiful refurbished 2 bedroom/2 bath villa on the 3rd floor. I didn't have any of the dead bug problems other reviewers had experienced. Our room was spotless. The villa number was 5632. The only problem we found was that the room was far from the pools and the building with the market. We sort of felt all alone there. It wasn't a problem for us since we visited Disneyworld for the entire time. Location wise, it's is only about 15 minutes from Disney and Universal. It's literally a 5 minute drive to Seaworld. When we did "drive" to the pool, it was clean and beautiful. Everyone who worked at Cypress Harbour was very friendly and helpful. We even had to attend the timeshare meeting. No. we didn't buy, but we would definitely stay at this timeshare again.

Reviews.Title: “Parrot-Head's Paradise! (:”
Reviews.Author: lcsmith
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th stay at Marriott's Cypress Harbor in the past 4 years. This time, we decided, at the last minute, to add a few days to the beginning of our vacation and booked a unit for the first 3 nights, at another property. What a mistake! We ended up here at nearly 5:00 a.m. thinking we would have to beg for a unit. But, as always, Marriott's customer service was extraordinary. The desk clerk pulled up our reservation, which was 3 days away, told us what the rate would be for the next 3 nights, we happily and gratefully agreed and she immediately gave us our keys! We returned later that afternoon to deal with the technicalities. How wonderful is that? The security is FABULOUS, the grounds are always perfectly beautiful and the entire staff is always incredible! The units are spacious and have always been spotless. If you have an issue or problem, the staff deals with it immediately. We do admit that it's time for some redecorating. The pink and green motif needed to go, go go! After a hectic day in the parks, you and your honey and or your kids can come "home" and relax in your in-room jacuzzi tub or take a swim at the main pool and enjoy either a soda, cup of coffee, cerveza, daquiri or margarita and take in some great live reggae music. Seriously, what more could a parrot-head ask for? STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: BethCameron
Reviews.Content: I was alittle concerned after reading some of the reviews on Trip Advisor but went ahead with our plans hoping for the best. We were pleasantly surprised to find a beautiful condo with lovely pools and a family type atmosphere. Great place, quiet at night. Loved it, would definitley go again.

Reviews.Title: “Our room definitely needed a facelift!”
Reviews.Author: philliegirl26
Reviews.Content: My family of six, including four teens, stayed comfortably in one villa. The resort facilities overall were fine and we had a terrific time in Orlando. My biggest disappointment was that our room was badly in need of refurbishing. The sofa was outright DIRTY. Their were a couple of unrepaired cracks in the tile floor in the master bath. And overall, the paint just had a faded look with many areas on the walls having visible old fingerprints. I found out after our stay that I could have requested a building that had already been refurbished. I certainly would not stay here again if I had to have one of these older rooms again. My advice for a potential guest: This is a nice resort but I would strongly urge you to request a refurbished and updated room. If the room would have been updated, I would probably be giving the resort an excellent rating. As a result of my recent experience however, I doubt I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Cypress Harbour”
Reviews.Author: flybeLondon_England
Reviews.Content: Just returned after our second trip to Cypress Harbour and are very pleased that again we were absolutley delighted with our stay. Our appartment was excellent with great views over the lake. The pools and surrounding gardens were beautifully maintained. Entertainment was good and staff extremely helpful and ploie. We have no doubt that on our next visit to Florida it will be the Cypress Harbour as our 1st choice. After 12 years of visiting Orlando this hotel stands out as one of the best all round places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “New Addition to Our Favorites List”
Reviews.Author: Wild4Orlando
Reviews.Content: Just returned this morning from a 3 day weekend and LOVED it. We live in Tampa and go to Orlando several times a year but this was our first stay here. We have stayed at all the Disney resorts, Sheraton Vistana, Marriott World Center, Hard Rock Universal and countless others and we have now added Cypress Harbour as one of the tops on our favorite list. I had faxed a room request with certain requirements 3 days before arriving including early check in. By the way we are renters, not owners. We arrived at 8:45 am and were told that they had us down for a villa that met all of our requirements but would not be available until 1:00 pm, but they had another villa ready immediately that met our other requirements but was not a newly refurbished one like I requested. We debated for awhile and decided to take the room that was ready. It was nice that they discussed this with us and let us make the decision. We were in the Key West building which is on the back side. Walking up to the door, yes I noticed the bugs and dirt on and around the door that others have mentioned. Upon walking into the villa I was immediately happy with the size and spaciousness, as well as its decor. Yes you could tell that the living room furniture was older, and yes the beds were worn and yes there were a couple of blades of grass or something in the huge tub and yes I saw a small corner of the shower with slight mold and yes the edge of the carpet was tattered and a small stain here and there. BUT SO WHAT! I brought a can of lysol and sprayed all the furniture down and it ended up being very comfortable to sit on. I ran some water and wiped down the bathtub. I wasn't sleeping on the front door or standing on the small mold spot in the shower or rolling around on the carpet so who cared about that. The bed is one of the few hotel beds I have not woken up with a sore back in and was actually comfortable in. All in all this room was WONDERFUL. The master bedroom is truly beautiful. The jacuzzi tub is the largest I've seen and can sit two large adults side by side easily. Although because it is so big it takes quite awhile to fill up. Besides the kings size bed there was also a chaise lounge chair, a huge armoire with TV and several drawers for clothes, two night stands and a large closet. Plus lots of walking around space. We brought an air mattress so two people would not have to sleep on the sofa sleeper in the other bedroom so my newlywed brother in law and his wife could have privacy. There was plenty of space to put the queen size mattress down plus pull out the sleeper sofa in the living room. The activities and recreational amenities were great and kept both my husband and 10 year old son entertained and happy. We didn't get to spend as much time on the grounds as we wanted because we had parks and other things on our agenda to squeeze in, plus the rain from Hurricane Dennis wouldn't of let us do anything recreational at the hotel Saturday evening anyway. We really needed a couple of extra days just to enjoy the resort and do all their activities they offer. I love the Disney resorts (especially Wilderness Lodge) and our next trip we are planning in October, I will be really torn between who to choose...a Disney deluxe resort or Cypress Harbour. For the money you really can't beat it and I know I will have a hard time convincing my husband to go to a resort that just has regular hotel rooms when we could have one of these great villas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place, Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 8 nights in a 2 bedroom unit with a water view and loved every minute of it. The screened patio was great to sit out on and enjoy thunderstorms or cooler mornings. The grounds are very lovely and the pools are very nice too. We also loved the nicely appointed master bedroom with jacuzzi. We would love to come back and stay again and highly recommend this resort to anyone wanting a fantastic place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Lots to do but units are old”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cypress Harbour from June 23 to June 27. We were in Unit 6246 (top floor). The unit was old and needs refurbishing. I had requested a refurbished unit but was told that those units were kept for owners, not renters. The seat cushions on the sofa were discolored and did not fit the sofa because they were too small. It appeared as if the cushions were from another sofa. The carpets were stained and the linens were thin. We received one bath towel that had a hole the size of a fist in it. The mattresses need to be replaced. Also, the door to the unit was dirty with bug splatters. Not a nice sight upon arrival. The walkways to the units need to be cleaned more often. There was debris and dead bugs on them. Given the quality of the amenities of the Cypress Harbour, this unit was of poor quality. The amenities compensate for the poor units. The activities center keeps the kids occupied with a variety of acitivities, most of them at no cost. The pools are nice but should cleaned more often. The grounds also are nice and the personnel friendly. We paid $159 US per night and would not pay more for this place until all units are refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbisherd, beautiful, quiet!!! Great for families”
Reviews.Author: LaCubana
Reviews.Content: My husband and two daughters, ages 12 and 15 stayed for 5 nights May 31-June 4th 2005. I am very pickey and hard to please, but I was definetely pleased with this resort. Even my husband said that I had "outdone myself" when I picked it. I first saw it on the Marriott website but decided to stay here after reading the reviews posted here. I first had a reservation at the resort across the street, the Horizons. But after reading the posts on the construction, I decided not to go there. And I'm glad I did, it is big time heavy-duty construction there. I'll go there after its over. We stayed in Blding #51, Carribean Key. It has just been refurbished. I was told that six buildings have just been redone (#50-56 I think) I specifically asked for one them. If you like to stay in a place that is clean and fresh, ask for one of the refurbished units. All of the furniture was new, the carpet was new, the counter tops in the kitchen etc. The only thing that did not seem to be new was the sinks in the bathroom. The master bedroom is very nice for a couple. King bed. The guest room is a double and sofa bed, best for kids or teens. There is also a sofabed in the living room if you don't mind the lack of privacy for a big group. There is a very nice balcony with chairs and table. We had a view of the lake. I am a VERY light sleeper and it was so quiet here at night it was nirvana for me. About the only thing I found lacking was in the quality of the bedding. The blankets were worn and very thin. Houskeeping comes in everyday if you are renting, not if you are an owner. You will be called and invited to attend the timeshare presentation. We were only called once however and they offer you money ($100 bucks I think) if you go. We really don't like attending these things so we didn't go. But if you have time and don't mind it, you could get some money for yor time. There is a W/D in the unit which was great because I could wash what we needed and I didn't go home with a bunch of dirty laundry (moms will appreciate what I mean by this). We only got to go to one of the pools because the weather was rainy while we were there. A bit of a bummer but we survived. There is also a private beach on the lake that looked fabulous if we had had better weather and more time. We stayed 5 nights but could have been able to enjoy it more with 2-3 more nights. We got a great discount with AAA leisure rate. All in all it is a GO!! Super close to Seaworld and Discovery Cove. Parking is complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Cypress Harbour with our 3 children for 6 nights before leaving on a Disney cruise. We did not want to visit any of the Disney parks or Sea World because the ages of our children are spaced so far apart, and we worried that there would be enough for them to do. They were more than occupied at the resort. From swimming, playing on the beach, paddle boating, playing at the life-sized chess set, playground and fountains, the kids never even asked for anything to do outside of the resort. Every night at 9 pm we had a perfect view of the fireworks show at Sea World from our balcony. The shopping is fantastic, too, with 2 great outlet malls and the Florida mall nearby. Our villa looked brand-new and was decorated beautifully with bold blues and yellows. The photos on the resort website do not do it justice. We enjoyed the full kitchen and laundry room, and with 3 televisions, everyone was happy. We highly recommend the Cypress Harbour!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Far Exeeded our Expections!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea5
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful visit at the Marriott Cypress Harbour. We visit Orlando every year. We are owners at the Marriott Grande Vista and have not stayed at Cypress Harbour in several years. This too, is truly a first class facility with all the amenities that families could ask for. My husband and I were traveling with 2 small children and 1 grandparent. THE VILLAS: Our newly updated villa had all the comforts of home, was beautifully furnished, and sparkling clean. The nicely equiped kitchen had granite countertops, honey oak colored cabinets and all the appliances and gadgets you need in a full service kitchen. The great room as I call it had a large dining room, desk area and huge living area with flat screen t.v. plenty of seating and an incredible panaramic view of the lake and fountains. Just off the side of the great room was a large screened in porch with it's own incredible view! My children loved playing out there and my mother-in-law must have spent hours out there relaxing and taking in the great view. There was also a full-size laundry room with all the amenities.
